Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Dallas is good booking...if you can get it under $150.”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelJunkie
Reviews.Content: Attractive convention hotel. Ask for high floor for nice city views. King Room on 20th floor was a bit small. The window glaze had been scraped off in a circle pattern by a previous guest and either not reported by housekeeping to be repaired or not a priority by management. Front desk was lukewarm and had no suggestions for nightlife/dinner withing walking distance of hotel. I would still stay here again but, only for a discounted rate of under $150. Self parking and valet only have an $8 difference so...take the valet.

Reviews.Title: “Ok location, rooms but 'going green' means scrimping on ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Schm00py
Reviews.Content: This huge property has nicely renovated sleeping rooms and the staff, including the housekeeping staff, could not be more friendly and up to the task. Some of the public spaces could use a face lift and the location is not terribly central to the main Dallas attractions but good if a business your are visiting is right next door. Starwood is 'going green' and we all know that this can often be code word for 'save money.' I opted to have my room cleaned every day, as I am pretty sure that the housekeepers don't appreciate cleaning up after a guest after several nights stay without interim cleanings. And, no shower cap is undoubtedly a cost savings under the guise of putting less plastic in landfills but really.... if you need a shower cap, you need a shower cap.

Reviews.Title: “Just Meh”
Reviews.Author: targhee42
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel February 15th, per the recommendation of a local colleague. My room was on one of the Starwood Preferred Guest floors. I also liked the hotelâ€™s â€œgreen programâ€�, which gives guests credit if they stay more than two days, and decline the sheet and towel changing service. If I were to rate the hotel just for its room, Iâ€™d give it 3.5-4 stars. Nothing fancy, but better than the average. The room a/c or heat worked fine. My issues, and reason for downgrading are: 1. absolutely horrible service with getting a taxi cab. Three of us were to meet other colleagues at the Veracruz restaurant (see review elsewhere, excellent by the way). None of us were from Dallas. The door man said we could take the hotelâ€™s SUV (seems odd that a hotel featuring green services has a Suburban available, why not a Prius, or something? Do you really need 4 WD in Dallas). Anyway, I gave the doorman the address (408 N. Bishop in Oak Cliff), and he said itâ€™d be $5 each. That rate seemed a little higher than a taxi for what was supposed to be a ten minute drive, but not ridiculous. Shortly after entry, and after programming the GPS to locate the address, the driver informed us that since the restaurant was not downtown, itâ€™d be $25. That was not the worst thing. The driver then proceeded to check his bids on eBay while he was driving in heavy traffic and on the freeway. I was in the front seat, and didnâ€™t see these shenanigans, but one of my colleagues saw the whole thing. He only almost hit a Jersey barrier a couple times, and had to brake severely as well, to avoid running into someone. I am always leery of these â€œblack carsâ€�, and should have known better. But, we were already running late for our dinner with others. But, in the future, never again. It appeared to us that the doorman and the car service were running a nice little side business. 2. I specifically asked for a room away from the elevator and ice machines. My room, XX77 was directly next to the motors that operate the elevators. I noticed this initially, but see 1 above, we were already late, and it would have taken extra minutes to change rooms. I was tired when I got back, and went to bed. Hearing the noise, I used my Bose earphones (same as one sees on airplanes) to get some rest at first, and then burrowed in pillows after the headphones were not comfortable to sleep on oneâ€™s side.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Dallas! They Care About Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Wendy M
Reviews.Content: The staff at Sheraton Dallas are the greatest! At the front desk, Edin Redzic offered to help us with a question my daughter and I had. In asking how our accommodationswere, he found out that we were going to share one bed. He changed us to two queens, making us comfortable and our stay truly memorable. He made our stay! Mr. Redzic was friendly, professional, helpful and knew his business. From the time you arrive through the tiime you leave, this is a friendly, clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, very overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Christopher E
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel a 4 rating which may be a tad too high of a ranking but this is a very nice hotel. From the lobby, to the many restaurants and even the rooms every part of this hotel is beautiful. The staff was friendly & very responsive. The location is perfect for a downtown event. The pictures on the main website are exactly how the rooms look However my biggest complaint with this hotel is the amount of standard services for which you are additionally charged for. $21/day for parking or $29 for valet. As much as $21.95 per day for Wi-Fi access. Refrigerators are an additional $20. (If they work, I had to have mine replaced twice causing me to loose perishable food). No complementary breakfast and bottled water is $5. For a hotel which charges almost $200 per night, you would think some of the amenities offered complementary by other hotels would be included here. I liked the hotel, disliked the price. I know the Sheraton execs will claim their prices are competitive, but I have stayed at hotels just as nice as this one if not nicer with all services included

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service under pressure!”
Reviews.Author: Karen G
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference with my husband for the company he works for and as we visited, the weather took a turn for the worse. There were several tornados in the area and the staff of the hotel quickly took matters in their hands to see to everyone's safety. We were evacuated to the hallways, and then later to a ballroom, until the management was updated with information allowing them to let us return to our rooms. The entire staff was extremely calm and collective during this slightly scary moment for their guests. I felt safe at all times and very appreciative for their concern.

Reviews.Title: “Great costumer service”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: I was there last month and I had a great time. The sports bar is awesome for wacthing games and the karaoke room is great for stress releave. My room was big, the bed very confortable. The food was good, but it could get a better variety of dessests at room service.. But what really got me was the costumer service, at check in Emma was plesant and accomodating. Erwin helped with my luggage and new everything about the place, and on other occasion helped me find a great restaurant near by for dinner. On my first night I got a call from Natalie welcoming to the hotel. If you need help for anything from guest service call her, she will make it happen. Sidona from the sports bar was fast and on my second night there she remember me and what I order the night before. Considering the amout of people at that bar, I was plesantly surprised and impressed by it. I encouter a few bumps along the way, but the people working there definitely made up for it. So using Natalie's words. Yes, they gave me a 10 out of 10 level service. Thank you all for everything. And if ever in Dallas again, I'll definitely come to the Sheraton Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is big in Texas”
Reviews.Author: davenak3
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this hotel - was there for a convention. The hotel was great, very big but never felt like a number or 'just another guest'. Staff was really on the ball, bell captain really good at getting cabs quickly and the housekeeping staff did an excellent job in my room. If I go back to downtown Dallas this is one of the hotels I'll certainly look to stay at if the rates are good.

Reviews.Title: “The people are great!”
Reviews.Author: Kim R
Reviews.Content: The people at the desk were very polite and accompodating. Ben Davisson at Draft was very attentative and polite and caring. It is a wonderful place to relax after a long busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Just a little fine tuning”
Reviews.Author: seth v
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel at least 10 times over the past few months. I have to tell you that the staff has always been a step above even when the hotel was booked solid with a convention. So teh staff gets a A+ for my money. The building on the other hand has been undergoing changes and renovations. Most of the renovated rooms are nice although a few of them have lacked the usual space that you would want. Overall location is very good and has access to downtown activities and the West End. If you are there on the weekend, starting Friday you do not need to pay the $21.00 per day for parking. There is a parking lot across the street for $5.00 per night. Just make sure you are leaving on Sunday. A very good place to stay, especially when you have a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Melissa K
Reviews.Content: I have never been more satisfied with a hotel as I am wIth the Sheraton Dallas Hotel. The rate was fantastic, the check in was easy and the lady that got us all set up was so warm and friendly I was so pleased. I've stayed in many hotels all over the US and this by far beat any of the "expensive" hotels. I've stayed at the SOHO Grand in NYC and the Dallas SHeraton was by far better in service, cleanliness, rates and food. The room service was delicious! I was refreshed, fed and happy when I left this hotel. When I go back to Dallas it will be the ONLY place I stay.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Matters”
Reviews.Author: Stacie R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton this past weekend for a wedding/reception that was held at this location. The employees and managers went above and beyond to assist us. We were running late and parked in Valet to get the wedding on time. The concierge service manager approached us and asked if he could help us, we explained that we were running late and rather than take our car back through the long valet line and get someone to get our bags to our room for us. He suggested that he send someone down to our car for us and they took the valet sticker to our car for us. THANK YOU SHERATON FOR MAKING THIS STAY STRESS FREE so we can enjoy the moments that really matter like sharing memories of our friend's wedding! It was also a lovely event and the food was wonderful as well!

Reviews.Title: “What should be a nice hotel just isn't.”
Reviews.Author: peakload
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Dallas Sheraton for three nights. I was told nice things about the hotel and was really looking forward to my stay. My stay was completely disappointing. My room was in the South Tower (2206) was the room left so much to be desired. The furnishings were a throwback to the early 1980s and have obviously been in the room since then. The bed linens were decent as was the mattress, however the dust ruffle was various stains all around that greatly resembled feces. It made me wonder how clean the sheets really were. The bathroom was a complete disaster. It was obviously remodeled, but, it was not done intelligently. The countertop was over done and extended into the shower which prevented the shower curtain from closing properly. It was generally uncomfortable to shower in there due to the poor design combined with the horrible shower head and the lack of hot water. The room service food was lackluster and was more expensive than most comparable hotels. The service time was decent, however the order taker was rude and did not seem to listen. The bed pillows are old, uncomfortable and one of them smelled horrible. Time for new pillows! The front desk staff was nice, however, they did not even attempt to correct my dissatisfaction. I could feel them rolling thier eyes when I walked away after bringing up the lack of hot water and the miserable shower. The only compliment I can deliver is the valet staff. They were polite, respectful and very attentive. Talking with the valet staff would have to be the highlight of the stay there. (although at $29.00 a night, I would recommend self parking). All in all, I think a room at a motel likely would have been more convenient and comfortable. I think that the staff should have been much more attentive to my concerns. As a frequent traveler, I was utterly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: Jessica G
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews of this hotel on this site, I had some trepidation about my upcoming stay. How silly of me! Everything about the Sheraton Dallas was perfect. Check-in was a breeze, the people were so lovely, I was 3 hours earlier for check-in and they found me a great room, in the area of the hotel I requested. The rooms are clean and comfy (the robe was nice touch!), the hotel is gorgeous, the roof-top pool and gym are very state of the art, and the food was absolutely terrific. Ben Defendant. at Draft was a great waiter and had us laughing all night! Draft was the perfect place to watch all the March Madness and eat perfectly prepared bar food. Don't miss The Kitchen Table for lunch -- YUMMY shrimp sandwich and sweet potato fries. The brisket sandwich is unreal too and the mac and cheese with braised ribs IN IT is ridiculous. They have a great outdoor area where you can eat your meals or just lounge by the fire pits with a cocktail. I really can't say enough about my stay here!! (Only note to hotel: your "luxurious snuggy's [sic]" sign in TKT has some grammatical issues!)

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Dallas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cher1988
Reviews.Content: This hotel in downtown almost feels like my second home, as I have had several conferences held here. The Sheraton Dallas caters to the business traveler, but families can also be nicely accomodated. Rooms are furnished with a modern flair and are very comfortable. Nice linens and toiletries. Good upclose views of downtown skylline from many of the rooms. Hotel parking is expensive, and can fill up easily, especially if more than one conference is taking place. Parking away from the hotel is more affordable, but I would be concerned about leaving my unattended vehicle in an open parking lot in downtown. I would also not want to walk alone at night from off property parking to the hotel. Rooftop swimming pool area is beautifully furnished; however, pool is tiny and serves all three huge towers of rooms. Gym is great--very nice facility with lots of equipment. Hotel restaurant and bar restaurant have good food, but pricey. Skywalk to Plaza of the Americas has several affordable fast-food restaurants, small shopping area, and an ice rink, but they close early in the day and are closed ALL weekend. DART train station is right outside the door of hotel that faces Pearl Street, but some rather sketchy characters ride this mode of public transportation. I do not always feel safe on DART, but it can be an inexpensive way to get to the Dallas Alley area where there are some restaurants and a bit of shopping. Go during the day and be sure to take a friend if you ride DART.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly & Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Raelene J
Reviews.Content: 2nd time for me. Staff really want to service you with a real willingness. Great Team The Rooms are just lovely. Also close to North park Shopping Mall!

Reviews.Title: “Great conference hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bmkennedy
Reviews.Content: Lots of rooms with an airwalk to the convention center. Not very close to DFW so expect a $50 cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: Glensmith501
Reviews.Content: Booked this trip through Priceline, Paid right at $90 for King Room. First, Be aware you will pay $21-29 for overnight parking. Second, the room was TINY, I have actually never seen a room that small. Third, in the bathroom, the Tub was dirty, drain was broken and shower head dirty and corroded to the point that the water streams go all over the place. Toiulet looked like it was wiped with a dirty rag. They were nice enough to have 2 bottles of Auquafina water in room for the low price of $4.00. Internet is $14 a day. There was a small yapping dog visiting in a room across the hall for your protection, He listened for any suspicious sounds to warn you of, and was very alert thru-out the night. Be aware they have a very nice gift shop, which only charges $4.47 for Auquafina water every price was like 20% more than Airport prices!. Room service is available for a $3.50 delivery charge 13% Tax and 22% surcharge, 19% gratuity automatically added for your convenience so you won't have to calculate based on them knowing in advance the superb service you will have. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good check in, Noisy Room due to Light Rail”
Reviews.Author: john398
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 15th fllor on a Saturday, had a fast check in, great parking however all night long you could hear the light rail from the South Tower 15th floor, even during 3 and 4 in the morning you would hear the trains

Reviews.Title: “Love the waiter”
Reviews.Author: Psbteacher
Reviews.Content: Spending the weekend in Dallas for a convention. Room is spacious, clean and well maintained. The hotel is so large that there are three towers, which make for 3 or more elevator sections - can be confusing. Best part was a waiter in the sports bar called Draft. His name is Ben Daysson and he made sure that we were taken care of - our libations were always full and he was extremely enthusiastic to take care of us. He took the time to make the connection and did an amazing job! So far, he is the best part of this weekend - and it's only Friday night!

Reviews.Title: “Maurice. NedeFa Convention”
Reviews.Author: Maurice C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Dallas for The NeDeFa Convention, from our check in to the overall service, was great. We had a good experience with everyone from the Hotel, but there was one lady in particular that stood out to my wife and I, and her name was Maria Armendariz, she always greater not only us but everyone that came to the Restaurant with a smile, and that rubbed off on the hostess and the waiters as well. She remember us by name was always very attentive to not only our needs but I noticed she was always walking around going to different tables. Making sure all the consumers were satisfied. The Hotel had an electrical issue where they had to move us from one tower to the other as a safety precaution and it was handled very promptly, and very Profesional, when we go back my wife and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What else would you expect from Sheraton...”
Reviews.Author: Ttaylo3
Reviews.Content: Flew in to Dallas to being to explore Texas. Got a deal on the Sheraton through a third party website, and it's downtown location was appealing. The hotel is located at the east end of downtown Dallas, next to a DART stop that makes getting around with a car easy. Good size rooms, with typical Sheraton-grade amenities. Flat screen t.v., comfortable beds and generally quiet hotel. The only negative, which is no reflection on the hotel itself, is that downtown Dallas is pretty dead. There wasn't a lot to see or do... after the Sixth Floor Museum and the Holocaust Memorial, we we're done with Dallas. Public transit to get to Fort Worth was an issue, but again, no reflection on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “About Average”
Reviews.Author: Besim T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about what you have come to expect from Sheraton Hotels in the states, it is OK! I stayed here with my family during a weekend trip to Dallas. We drove and parked in the garage across the street. There was a conference going on the day we go there, so the place was quite busy. Everything was ok... The staff was friendly but did not go out of their way. The gym was quite large and had a lot of cardio equipment. Rooms were large and decent. If the price is not too expensive, I would recommend this hotel. I would not pay any sort of premium to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Business”
Reviews.Author: vettman608
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for a business trip in the convention area. Rooms were very clean, restrooms clean, oh and the view from our room was very nice. I liked the convention space the staff was very prompt and made everything room smooth during our lunch's and dinner party was very nice. Food during our evening meal was only on the fair side. There was a nice sports bar on premise very nice. Parking fees were a little on the high side so be prepared to pay. Overall a very nice downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: LongTallTechsan
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveller and frequently stay all sorts of hotels for business and pleasure travel. The Sheraton Dallas is a new low in conference hotels. The room was poorly maintained and unkempt (see pic with hair stuck to / paint peeling off of the shower ceiling). The main reason for this negative review, however, is the staff''s attitude. The desk clerk was rude and treated each of the guests in the long queue at registration as adversaries, quoting "Company Policy" as unassailable reason behind her inexcusable behavior. She was openly hostile to me. Avoid at all costs. When in Dallas, stay at the Magnolia, even if you find yourself one of the poor unfortunates attending a convention with the misfortune of booking at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cingabit
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I attended the SWACDA conference in March 2012. We were treated very well at the front desk. The room was very clean, great view, comfy mattresses and pillows. Accidentally left valuables in room during cleaning. The valuables were left untouched and the room cleaning was immaculate! Food at the Kitchen Table restaurant and the bar was delicious with beautiful presentation. The buffet was a great value, including drinks and dessert in the price. 12.95 breakfast, 16.95 dinner. Waiters were stellar!! This hotel has a huge computer access station area in the lobby. Hundreds of well-behaved teenagers/college students from the honor choirs had a great place to hang out. I loved that there was a full service business center where I could have Fedex packages boxed and sent. Cab to airport was about 23 dollars. Cabs were ready and waiting and hailed by the doorman. Valet and doormen were wonderful. The public bathrooms in the hotel and conference center were stylish, adequate number of stalls, well kept and fully functional. THANK YOU for this!!! We never had to wait for a stall, even with the large number of people at the conference. The Conference center is right across the street and there's a 2nd floor walkway to it...or you can cross the street. There are great local inexpensive places to eat within walking distance. It's located in walking distance from the artistic locations of the city including the Dallas Symphony Hall, the Art Museum and I'm sure many other places. We felt very safe out walking at night in this area. Conference rate was 159 per night which was a bit higher than the Marriott nearby (139). But the room and the general climate of the hotel, plus the convenience to our conference, great food and great rooms made it a value. The staff deserves kudos and compensation for making this a great experience. Only negative was overworked elevators during certain periods. But we learned to time our elevator rides to non busy times. We were on the 24th floor, so stairs were not an option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and the beds are awesome”
Reviews.Author: LKStonewall
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid week. They were crowded but that is to be expected since they host numerous conventions and business meetings. The room was nicely decorated but what sold me was how comfortable the bed was. Down side is I didn't want to get up in the morning. The hotel is expensive to stay at and on top of the pretty high room cost, they charge $21 per day parking. Bottles of water in your room are $4 each and room service in the morning starts at about $20. I got them to wave the parking, brought my own bottle of water and went out for breakfast. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: LauraES
Reviews.Content: Reader alert - I typically stay on a club/concierge level when I travel, and my review is clearly influenced by comparisons with other club/concierge levels. We booked a Club Level Junior Suite three months prior to our stay. Upon our arrival, there were at least three large conventions happening at the hotel at the same time. As a result, it took one hour and twenty minutes to get to the front of the check-in line. When I did, I was told that they did not have that level of room available due to on-going renovations, and they did not apologize for not alerting me to this situation ahead of time. They "found" me a club level king room (not optimal for three adults, but it was all they had, and they brought us a roll away), supposedly with the same package. However, they neglected to tell me that we would have to take an elevator from our room on the 27th floor of the South tower down to the 2nd floor, then walk to the elevator bank for the Central tower, then take that elevator up to their 27th floor for club lounge access. An extreme hassle and time waster, especially due to the fact that the hotel was so full. Parenthetically, the club lounge was undoubtedly the worst I've ever experienced. The food was not only mundane, but in quite limited supply. In fact, on our first breakfast day I saw the hostess turn at least two groups away, saying there was no room/food, and suggested they go to the hotel's casual restaurant instead (this is exactly what people who pay for concierge floor do not want to do.) On our second breakfast experience, they apologized that the kitchen had not sent up any hot food that morning as promised. Oh well, that was not surprising as they had run out of cookies the evening before (after we had made the Herculean effort to get there specifically for an evening cookie.) There were no apologies for that - just, "when we run out, we're out." Another problem - we were supposed to have "free" wi-fi in our package. We had to agree to a charge before the wi-fi would hook up, which I figured wouldn't be a problem to rectify. Wrong. First, the wi-fi was sup-optimal, and did not allow access for six straight hours on our second day, despite 4 (yes, 4) separate phone calls to their "help" (poor choice of words) line. All I can say is their "senior engineer" would not last long in our company. When I called to the front desk to have the charges removed anyway (and told them about my problem) the person asked for my computer problem "reference" number so she could confirm that we really had a problem. O.K. Needless to say, when the bill was slipped under our door on our last day, the charges were all still on it. (They did delete it when I went down in person and spoke to them.) And our room? It clearly needed renovation, so I'm glad they're in the midst of that. I hope they replace the chipped sink and leaky faucet, as well as the toddler-sized toilet (it reminded me of those one finds in a kindergarten class.) Also, when we arrived, our room had no bathrobes (it was supposed to) and when I called, none materialized for 45 minutes. I called again (again requesting 3 robes), and got one robe about 10 minutes later. I gave the maid a couple of dollars and asked her to get two more, as well as another set of towels, and she did take care of it. But, about 20 minute later a different maid arrived - with one robe. It was quite comical. The only reason I give this place a poor instead of a terrible is that the bed was quite comfortable, and I"m trying to be charitable.

Reviews.Title: “LAURA at Drafts”
Reviews.Author: wince2127
Reviews.Content: Laura was great! The place was packed and she made us feel very welcomed. Great customer service. She stopped out of her section to see if she could help! Off the charts. She made Dallas a great get away amd easy.

Reviews.Title: “Mr. Mike Burton”
Reviews.Author: Ted S
Reviews.Content: Mr. Burton was extremely courteous and helpful to me during my stay at the State BPA Leadership Conference. Thank you Mr. Burton for making our stay a memory we won't forget. Ted Stephens & Family

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: Diana W
Reviews.Content: You'll know you picked the right place when you are greeted at the front door. The staff here is top notch and make you feel right at home. From the bell captain to the front desk staff, your requests will be handled with a smile. Thanks for a great trip! Cindy @ guest experiences made sure that our stay was perfect and she delivered! Can't wait to visit again. The Sheraton Dallas is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service A++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: Tony A
Reviews.Content: e have an annual meeting in Dallas every year. We arrive on Sunday and have meetings Monday through Wednesday. These include a business casual dinner on Monday and Tuesday nights. Well its Monday evening around 5pm. I go to the room and discover I have left my sport coats at home. Imagine me screaming like a child on a carnival ride. Jackets are required for the dinners. I have an hour to get ready and no jacket. I must have left them in the car before the flight. With no options I head to the concierge desk where I run into Lynn Venable. I explain my situation. He says no problem. Iâ€™m thinking no I have a huge problem!!! What happens next will blow your mind. He removes his name tag and hands me the coat he was wearing. Thatâ€™s right read it twice. Yes it gets even betterâ€¦..He offers to bring me another coat for the subsequent dinner. WOW!! That is stratospheric customer service. Enjoy your stay and stop by the concierge desk to say hello to Lynn.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic lobby, rooms, workout facility and service”
Reviews.Author: LaGrangeLassie
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been newly renovated! It is stunning. Rooms are all brand new. We stayed in the center tower room 646. Two huge queen beds with beautiful pure white bedding. Huge bathroom. Lovely decor. The only complaint was the frig was $20 if you wanted one (we called the front desk to ask for one). That seemed steep to me. Would like it to be standard. One the plus side, this place has a HUGE AMAZING workout center. And a really cool outdoor pool with cabana type chairs and lounge beds. Loved staying here. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great check in”
Reviews.Author: lbecker200812
Reviews.Content: I was joining a friend of mine for a cheerleading event. When we first arrived the line was very long but it moved quickly. I wanted to mintion how wonder full the guy that was directing the line (lenord I think his name was) and matthew the one that checked us in. Matthew had the best customer service and even had a joke for us to lighten the mood. If I get the chance I will definately come back!!

Reviews.Title: “LOBBY Bar Cheers !!!”
Reviews.Author: BabyThunder
Reviews.Content: Every year my daughters cheerleading team go to dallas for NCA cheerleading. The rooms were very cozy and the staff was very friendly. The day before we left i decided to go to the lobby bar and intended to get one glass of wine while i waited for my daughter after her competiton, Nikki the bartender was very friendly and always trying to struck small talk with every one . She could shake martinis and pour wine at the same time. I was like WOWWW she knew everything she was doing, she even sugested a texas wine for my second glass of wine. It was amazing !! My daughter and her friends Fianlly showed up to the lobby tired, thirtsty and sad. They just got done competing and lost. Nikki made them all virgin mojitos with berries to cheer them up and they loved it!!!! My daughter wouldnt even share wit me. I just want to let every one know Nikki and James did a awesome job I tried looking for a supervisor to let them know how awesome they were doing but i couldnt find one , so i had to do a review!!!!! Keep the good job guys!!!!!! 100 star experince

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VAGUIDO
Reviews.Content: I found this GEM of a hotel in 2009, and now I stay in this hotel 20+ times a year. I have to say I absolutely love it. It's clean, it's inviting, and it's energizing. A few reasons to consider the Sheraton Dallas: -Very comfortable beds (they are really awesome) -The gym facility is the biggest & newest I have seen at any SPG Sheraton (or Hilton/Marriott) property. It rivals area sports clubs. -The downtown location is great for work or easy access to 75 or the Dallas North Tollway. -The club lounge hosts two of the friendliest individuals I have ever met in the hotel industry. -The new rooms are well decorated (most rooms are renovated). -Parking in the hotel is never difficult (there is a fee). -Front desk staff members are ALWAYS friendly. -Billing errors are always fixed right the first time. My high expectations are consistently met at this property, and I get great joy offering positive feedback for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: tpglag95
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the NCA Cheerleading weekend and the hotel was at 100% capacity. I had an issue with my room after checking in and although there were a lot of unregistered guests in line waiting, the front desk manager Lavone was quick and professional to resolve my room issues. Once in my room, the housekeeping staff especially Charlotte Jones, took extra care making sure everything was perfect. It was really nice to have staff who were focused on making their guest happy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, large conference center but pretty basic”
Reviews.Author: Albert S
Reviews.Content: It's a basic, clean and convenient hotel. I like its location given the proximity to many downtown company headquarters and has many rooms. Rooms are typical Sheraton quality, clean, comfortable but not as plush as a Westin, W, or St. Regis. It's a business traveler's hotel. Front desk and concierge service is very good. They great you with a smile. Hotel restaurant is not so good in terms of menu options and staff is more like a Denny's waiter staff.

Reviews.Title: “cozy rooms and a very helpful associate”
Reviews.Author: Kristina M
Reviews.Content: my friend and I were staying at the hotel on biz for a three day conference. i travel a fair amt in CA and NV and am familiar with most of the major hotel chains. so after checking in and arriving at our room, we found the heating/air unit was clearly not working as it was extremely warm. we immediately called to report this and request a room change rather than wait around for the technician to come up. A very sweet and professional young lady named Chelsea Nussbaumer said she would not only accomodate us with a room close to our other room, but bring up our new keys rather than make us go down to the front desk. WOW, that was a first for me to have keys delivered! when Chelsea arrived she apologized for the inconvenience, shared that she pre-checked the new room for us and the temp was much better and invited us down to see our new room. along the way, she was curteous, cheerful and quite the delite about the whole situation. After we got to our room, the temp was much better but still wasn't cooling as much as it should. this time we decided to report it and request a tech to take a look, they sent someone up and he fixed it with in minutes sharing the reason for the problem and apologized for the inconvenience. after that issue, all was great! We enjoyed our room very much as it was spacious and the bed/pillows were one of the most cozy & comfortable out there! we had a mini fridge brought up with out hassle, the hotel was a little confusing in layout yet clean, upscale and very accomodating. Thanks Sheraton Dallas and a BIG thanks Chelsea, you were a delight!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lakisha M
Reviews.Content: I have stated at this hotel more than 5 times in the past 3 years. All of my experiences have been fairly good. There were 2 occassions in which the hotel was in the process of being renovated and their eco-friend air conditioning was not operating in the North tower. This may seem minimal but it is disasterous in Dallas summer heat! The staff were wonderful and acted quickly to address the issue. The room service is reasonable and I the sports bar atmosphere is enjoyable. The best part of the hotel is the location! Quick access to the highway and a DART ride to great downtown dinning. I may have traveled for work but it felt like vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mario F
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days with friends. The hotel was clean and the location was not too bad. All the staff was friendly and greeted me with smiles every time I pass through the lobby. Erwin one of the bellhops was really helpful and made me enjoy everything. Rita and Donna at the Concierge desk were some of the best people i have ever met. I can tell that they love what they do. If i had any problems these 3 guys are the people to go to because in my opinion they took care of me. Overall nice hotel and one of the best staff ever. Will come back if i stop by Dallas again.

Reviews.Title: “"Exceptional Staff"”
Reviews.Author: Michelle N
Reviews.Content: Busines travel. This hotel was recommended by others who have stayed during business travel. A group of us made reservations at the Sheraton. I inadvertently made reservations with a different hotel in error. It was my first visit to Dallas and I wasn't familar with the area. We also had a late arrival. I was told that the hotel was booked solid for the week and that there was no availability. An Associate, Ryan became aware of the situation and put me to ease at once. He not only secured a room at our Corporate rate for the week but then went out of his way to place another business associate nearby on the floor. Overall, the hotel service was outstanding and friendly. The rooms were large & very clean. The fitness area was absolutely amazing with everything from cardio to free weights. It was a great experience. Thanks so much to Ryan!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and very clean”
Reviews.Author: beachluver
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel every year for my company convention. Service is excellent rooms are very clean and spacious and the amenities are plentiful

Reviews.Title: “Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: Fanofev
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay at the hotel and Rick Vaughn rocked it with service. :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: bedeah
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Sheraton after a long, cold, and windy day at the rugby pitch -- so we were red-faced, windblown, and dressed like we'd been at a sporting event all day! The front desk staff was superb. Very polite, attentive, and we were happily surprised when we got rooms on the 31st floor, with an amazing view of downtown Dallas greeting us when we got to our room. The bed was comfortable, the water was hot, and the coffee provided in the room was very welcome! Because it has a few different towers and each elevator doesn't necessarily go to each floor, I would recommend that people be aware that the elevator/floor situation can be a bit confusing. We were very pleased with our stay and look forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: bkath2000
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the dallas sheraton from saturday through tues Feb 7, 2012 for a conference. I was on the 9th floor. The room was lovely - very clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable with plenty of pillows. Each and every time I went in and out of the hotel, whenever i saw ANY staff - they always greeted me and were incredibly polite. The concierge was very helpful and the bellman were wonderful. While i was there, the concierge helped me locate a yoga studion - I managed to go to Uptown Yoga for two classes that were terrific - however it is quite a walk from the hotel - so I drove. All in all a terrific hotel - i would definitely recommend it and if I am ever in town again I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Party central”
Reviews.Author: kmethvin
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you plan to sleep. I called the front desk about people partying in the hall after midnight. After multiple calls , security finally arrived. A man and woman stumbled off the floor, the woman draped herself on the security man and asked who complained . Security actually pointed to my room. I couldn't believe it . I was a woman traveling alone . The partying didn't stop but they also started to slide things under my door. 230, I called desk again . They said they would send head if security but never did. I left the next morning before neighbors woke up. Lot of money for no sleep and no compensation. I guess if you want to party then this is the hotel for you

Reviews.Title: “How to Value the Customer”
Reviews.Author: Jeff H
Reviews.Content: Hectic times, long lines, wide range of expectations - all of these can easily distract a check-in service representative or get them off their game. Next time you are in Dallas at the downtown Sheraton, watch for Front Desk Associate Edin Redzik. He will be professional, polite and energetic - and he will do so while being personable and caring. Edin makes being away from home a litlle bit easier.

Reviews.Title: “best business mans friend in DFW- great facility-great gym”
Reviews.Author: RFamiletti
Reviews.Content: Road warriors dream hotel! Very attractive SPG property. great staff. great gym. If you are a SPG member, there is the new club lounge in center tower. The restaurant has excellant food. The bar is a good place for a drink. Even the gift shop is a good experience. The one thing that needs work is the lighting in the restaurant. It is not warm, rather bright and flouresant. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: “Top "Draft" Pick”
Reviews.Author: Jennie S
Reviews.Content: Most hotel bars are lame, but not Draft at the Sheraton Dallas! It's a big time sports bar with the right kind of atmosphere and hospitality to make you feel like you're at your local pub! And with a full bar, killer drinks, and excellent service from Serbando (be sure to roll the R!), you may want to stay an extra day or two!

Reviews.Title: “Another good experience”
Reviews.Author: Foxtrot-BandB
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the hotel in 6 months. I was treated like a special guest by the staff (registration, bell, concierge). the room was very clean, comfortable and inviting. The food in the restaurant was very good ( the bar-b-q sandwich for lunch was so good I had again the second day). the conference room we used was very comfortable and outfitted with everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “No weekend relaxing... Watch out for housekeeping!!”
Reviews.Author: CDN-Traveller1961
Reviews.Content: This was a Friday night stay therefore a part of the weekend deal and not the rushing weekday business travellers... So on Saturday morning the housekeeper on our 21st floor of the North Tower came and loudly "rapped" on our room door with a key or other hard object yelling â€œHOUSKEEPINGâ€�. We had not set our alarm but had suddenly been awakened at 8:30am at a hotel that has a 12 Oâ€™clock check out time on Saturdays. I had NOT checked out, so surely I was NOT on the list that most housekeepers start with... No, as I lay in bed rudely awakened, I could clearly hear this housekeeper go to the room next door and proceed to rap on this door as she did in sequence with all rooms on my floor. Forward to 9:45amâ€¦ I am again suddenly awakened by the constant SLAM!! (of the room door, next door) Over and over, every 1 to 2 minsâ€¦ SLAM!!! So I get up and look, and guess who? HOUSKEEPING!!! In short, my review of this hotel is that when you consider; the management who did not process my bill correctly, the dominating â€œHOUSKEEPINGâ€� staff that ruined a relaxing weekend for me and my wife, you should stay away on weekends. Although the fantastic DRAFT lounge in the hotel does warrant a visitâ€¦ do so while staying/relaxing and getting a correct bill at a hotel next door!

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous Location”
Reviews.Author: dallasguyDallas
Reviews.Content: Don't book your convention at this hotel. Thefts and homeless a problem. Can't walk around the area. It is close to the rail line however there was a gang shooting at the train stop right across from the hotel. restaurants and food were bad. Not recommended

Reviews.Title: “Tribute to a doorman.”
Reviews.Author: Bob W
Reviews.Content: I would like to commend one of the Sheraton's employees, James Seion, a doorman, who provided excellent service in helping me with my luggage when checking in and then again when checking out. Besides those services, when I saw him casually passing through the hotel during my stay, he always gave me a friendly greeting. When the monitor on my lap top stopped working, I wanted to find a pawn shop to buy a cheap monitor to use while on the road. The hotel's concierge desk was unable to suggest anything other than a Best Buy or Wal mart, but Mr. Seion told me where to find a pawn shop, and how to get there on the city's light rail system. His directions were completely accurate, and the entire excursion there and back including shopping for the monitor was less than an hour, plus I got to ride on the light rail system which was nice. Mr. Seion saved me probably a hundred dollars by having the right answer to my problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed: Too Many Problems”
Reviews.Author: Chicagodocjerry
Reviews.Content: Five members of my staff and I stayed here for five nights this past week. By the third day, we had a litany of complaints, mostly focused on rooms in the Center Tower. In one room, TV didn't work or came on by itself, half of towels were dirty upon arrival; in another room, toilet was not secured to the bathroom floor, heating system never worked properly, sink gurgled loudly at times, sleep button on TV remote didn't work; in another room, water was either ice cold or sclading; heating system needed repair at 12:30 in the morning, but never worked properly. Those of us in the North Tower had few complaints, although there always seemed to be a small refrigerator and a microwave oven just left out in the hall for hours on end; very dangerous if the floor needed to be evacuated. When I complained, three of my staff members were given a 7,000 point bonus on their Starwood Preferred Guest accounts. It seems to me that the infrastructure in the central tower is aging and in need of major overhaul. It was not fair to my employees who were working a sales booth at a convention to have to endure these issues in their rooms, where they should have been able to relax and unwind. Strongly urge business travelers to avoid this hotel or, if you have to stay here, request a room in the north tower. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “cheated in their business center”
Reviews.Author: ira2010
Reviews.Content: Pricy hotel, without free internet, fridge or micro, otherwise the service was OK, except - we went to their business center to send a postal card overseas, and a clerk said that they are out of stamps for today. He suggested to get $$ from us for the cards and stamps, and he would send everything next day, so we paid. I asked for a receipt, but the clerk pretended that he didn't hear me and left... Later we learned that the card never made it. Cheap for such a hotel - cheating on pennies...

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: LibraryHRGuy
Reviews.Content: I just spent five nights at this hotel. I'm not much of a Sheraton fan and have sometimes been very dissatisfied with Sheraton properties where I've stayed. This Sheraton has had a fairly recent renovation and was really nice. It is a gigantic (and I mean gigantic) conference hotel, but the place seemed to handle the crush of a huge conference quite well. The public areas were in good condition and attractive. The buildings seem to be fairly old highrises, but the North Tower room I stayed in had been fully updated -- the bathroom must have been gutted and totally redone. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and attractive. There are enough elevators that I never spent an excessive amount of time waiting for the elevator. The staff seemed well-trained and were very hospitable. I found the employees at the the concierge desk to be especially helpful. Overall, I was surprised at how pleasant the place was, especially for the very reasonable conference rate I paid -- $149.00 a night. One of the other reviewers commented on the distance to the Dallas Convention Center. If you're attending meetings at the Convention Center it certainly is a long haul to get over there. I would also note that the area immediately surrounding the hotel would be kindly described as nondescript, but within 5 to 8 blocks there are nice restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: mohawk6nations
Reviews.Content: ..and that's not what the Dallas Sheraton has if you are in town for a conference at the Dallas convention center. Too far too walk; nothing around it. The DART shuttle stop is right next door, so you can get away pretty easily, but why stay at a hotel just because you can get away from the area easily? A big problem for me was the room temperature. You cannot adjust the temperature lower than 68 degrees! That's crazy! I've never run into that at a hotel before. I called the front desk because I thought the thermostat was broken, and they sent an engineer up. He sheepishly told me that's as low as it goes! It was centrally set to go no cooler than 68 degrees as part of the hotel's green initiative. However, he said it could go up to 85! The best he could do was bring me a box fan for the room! I didn't pay for a hotel room like this just to be given a fan! I also had to ask for washcloths; there were none in the room. And no refrigerator, either. An empty refrigerator shell, but no refrigerator. Not happy....however, concierge Donna Visnear (not sure about that last name) was very helpful - warm, welcoming, friendly, and a pleasure to interact with, and the bed was perfectly comfortable; the TV worked (but the online folio did not); the bathroom was clean, but I wouldn't stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service at management level”
Reviews.Author: GretchenHoffmann
Reviews.Content: My experience was very mixed, but I will never go back because of the bad service I got from a manager and accounting person when I had billing trouble, not to mention the billing trouble to start with. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE AT THE MANAGEMENT LEVEL. In a nutshell, here's what happened: 1. My stay was pre-paid by a third party. 2. The hotel had no record of the pre-pay so put a large hold on my personal credit card. 3. When I later obtained and showed the hotel a receipt for the pre-pay, it took many conversations with a manager and the accounting department to figure it out. 4. The hold wasn't released on my card until my bank intervened, despite the fact that someone else's card was charged 2 weeks earlier. 5. NO ONE AT THE SHERATON EVER APOLOGIZED FOR THE TROUBLE!!! My stay was for a meeting with an organization who paid for my stay. They pre-paid the stay with a credit card. When I checked in, the hotel had no record of the pre-pay, so I assumed someone had forgotten to take care of it. I had to give my own card, on which the hotel placed a $450 hold. Then I found out the company HAD indeed pre-paid. When I showed a receipt to a manager, he said he needed someone on the company end to confirm with a form, which he would email. While the email recipient waited for the email before going to a meeting, the manager took about half an hour to send it, and when he did, it required information she did not have, despite his assurance to me that she simply had to respond "OK," essentially. The next morning, the travel agency who made the reservation talked to someone at the hotel and took care of it before my check out. Except that the hotel kept the $450 hold on my card! I had to have my bank spend half an hour on the phone with various people at the Sheraton to get that taken care of! And no one, not once, ever apologized for the trouble this had caused to me and the entity sponsoring my stay. Even the kind woman at my bank commented on the attitude everyone she spoke with at the Sheraton seemed to have -- it seemed they didn't really care, she said. That being said, rooms were fine, dining options good, gym great, other service was mostly good. Location is not great, as you have to walk several blocks to get to an area of stores and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Love the green plan!”
Reviews.Author: L P
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights for a conference. Loved the new-to-me green initiative -- put a door hanger out saying "no need to make up my room" and they give you a $5 voucher. Multiple nights got me a free breakfast! Plus avoided lots of unnecessary laundering. Aside from that, nice big-city hotel, nothing special about decor or restaurants. Easy walk to Main Street restaurants and AT&T Performing Arts Center. Free Internet for Starwood members.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Road”
Reviews.Author: Duke_Ward
Reviews.Content: Okay choice for a downtown hotel. Comfortable room, great fitness/workout area open 24/7, onsite restaurants and coffee bar. 30 minute walk to Convention Center and plenty of choice downtown for meals. Not so great? No fridge or microwave in room (I don't want to eat out every meal), daily charge for Internet, and an odd moment at checkin with a staff member pushing the hotel being "green" and not wanting to provide daily housekeeping service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business and would like to commend Alisa Shamburg and Jamie Noble in the Kitchen Table. Both are extremely helpful about the area and give excellent attentive service. They are a great asset to the Shearaton Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovations - clean”
Reviews.Author: Jarred W
Reviews.Content: The front desk service was excellent at check in and check out. There were plenty of staff working, which is always a big plus in my book. The hotel is old, even though a "recent renovation" had done its best to obscure that fact. The location wasn't the *best* in relation to the conference I was attending at the convention center, but it was not horrible either. I was happy with the price, too. One note - the service in the restaurant was awful. I think it might have just been an off day for them, but I was disappointed in that aspect of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff make all the difference.”
Reviews.Author: designing_librarian
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff! You are greeted warmly from the moment of arrival and it continues throughout the stay. Was there for a conference, stayed 3 nights. From the front desk to the room cleaner, friendly and helpful. My room cleaner kept my room spotless and was gracious, her name was Birhane Obsa. At check-in, I asked for a room with a great view and was upgraded to an Executive Suite, Very large outer living room, spacious bedroom, with sleek, modern furnishings. The outer room buffered sounds from the hall, so the bedroom was extremely quiet. Other reviewers had complained the hotel was in isolated location. Did not feel this way at all. A medium walk to the Museum Area (strongly recommend the Nasher Sculpture Museum, a calm refuge with work by all the greats) and a slightly longer one to the Convention Center. The hotel restaurant is good, not great, and relatively expensive The breakfast buffet is the way to go, ordering separate items adds up. At lunch some local favorites which others enjoyed but the salads made to order fits my needs perfectly. The maitre de at lunch kept everything flowing beautifully, wish I had gotten his name. The hotel is a typical sports bar, but does have a secluded quiet lounge area. The hotel has many comfortable computer stations mixed together in a luxurious seating area. All and all everything I needed was provided, and with a friendly smile.

Reviews.Title: “NICE BUT...”
Reviews.Author: HDHart
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at the Sheraton Dallas with my wife and son. Given status, I was upgraded to a suite which was very nice. The hotel is incredibly close to downtown, has a great sports bar, and appears to have been recently renovated. The rooms were very comfortable and the staff courteous. The BUT is that we had an issue with the key cards throughout our stay and they consistently did not work correctly getting into our room or in and out of the parking garage. Once is not an issue but an entire weekend of this was a pain. Also, there was a chicken wing that sat in the hallway of the 29th floor for two days before I finally asked the front desk to have someone clean it up. Finally, Room Service closed at 11:00. 11:00? Really? So close but the irritating key card issue, an early room service closing, and the lone chicken wing that had a reservation in the 29th floor hallway almost as long as mine brought this property down to a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ian f
Reviews.Content: Guest Services (Lynn Venable) outystanding above and beyond service during entire visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: PGold123
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton @ Dallas does an excellent job each time I come to visit for business. The service is beyond good; and the concierge services are second to none. Dan Macey and staff were all extremely helpful and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Not for family, OK for business trip”
Reviews.Author: uskim
Reviews.Content: You will be welcomed by everyone. I tell you that their service is top notch. The location is not the best because it is located in downtown, yet there is nothing near unless you take a cab. The room was clean and nice size. You can get more rewards points if you don't want your room to be cleaned. Who wouldn't want that? The bar is located in the first floor. It's more of a sports bar with lounge chairs and booths. I was here for the business trip. No problem. I would be happy to stay here for that, not designed for leisure. Therefore, I would not bring my family here because it's just OK, nothing great in terms of room, facility or restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Kindness”
Reviews.Author: Dennis M
Reviews.Content: I had just had a terrible fall just before traveling on a family vacation to Dallas. I called to ask if the hotel might have a recliner in which to sleep. They did not, but Victor Aguilar offered to rent on from Rent-A-Center for me. He and Flavia Veta worked hard to make sure the recliner was delivered and returned. I could not believe the way they went out of their way to accomodate me! I would highly recommend this hotel to others. Also, the staff throughout the hotel was very friendly and accommodating, but nothing like Victor and Flavia's efforts.

Reviews.Title: “room was clean and had a nice view”
Reviews.Author: scot0610
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the sheraton for business for 4 nights, I stayed on the 34th floor, I had a nice view of the city. The rooms were clean and large. The staff was friendly and helpful. The food at the banquets were of excellent quality. THe option of not having your room cleaned every day, in exchange for $5 a day to be used in the hotel restaraunts and gift shop, is a nice deal at sheraton hotels. I took advantage of this offer, since a majority of my time was spent at meetings.

Reviews.Title: “All depends on which room you get but the people are great”
Reviews.Author: Juleszee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Dallas for a work conference in Sept. 2011. Some in my group were very happy with their rooms and it sounded like they may have gotten more recently updated accomodations. The hotel has a couple of different towers and I think mine was the south. (when you walk in the main entrance it was the tower to the right) The room itself was clean but the bathroom was pretty disgusting and is very outdated. The view out the window was of the bus depot located directly behind the hotel and then out towards the Cotton Bowl. The bed was comfortable. I was very pleased with the service I received. From check-in to the room service to the maid service to housekeeping tracking down a book I had left in my room after checking out they exceeded my expectations every time. I also really enjoyed all the food prepared by the hotel. Most of it was banquet variety selected by my company but it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Bell Desk to Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: TALLGUYROSS S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dripping with Customer Service. They aren't lacking in any area when it comes to the needs of the guest. Everyone is so polite, friendly and above all extremely helpful. Andrew Franks who manages the reservations desk is a great front man for this hotel who only wants to make sure that you are completely satisfied with your acomodations, to Mark the Food and Beverage manager who is all over the Sports Bar being a hands on manager attending to any and all patrons making sure they are set, to Dan and Rita in concierge who are so helpful no matter what it is. Just call Rita and she can help get you a reservation in some of the best eateries in Dallas, and finally Amanda and Josiah at the bell desk who are happy to engage you in conversation or assist in any needs you have above and beyond luggage. I am not related to any of these people. I have stayed there now 3 times in the last year and i would never consider staying anywhere else in Dallas because these guys treat you like an old friend and i'm a very tough critic when it comes to customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ctfletchall
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from Sheraton Dallas and was extremely pleased everything. Our group just loved Jackie that worked in the Club Lounge. She was one of the friendliest people I have ever met and made the trip so much more enjoyable. Everyone there went out of their way to make it a great stay. We had a problem with our transportation (Infinity Sedan and Limos) not showing up as scheduled to take us to the airport. Luckily for us the 2 guys out front helped us quickly set up alternate transportation so that we would not miss our flight. I was so stressed out that we were going to miss our flights that I did not notice their names. However, if it were not for them we would have missed our flights since our prearranged transportation was not reliable. Thank you to Ms. Jackie and the rest of the staff fro making this a wonderful visit!

Reviews.Title: “Wrong made right.”
Reviews.Author: Ashley C
Reviews.Content: Our group of 21 cheerleaders and 3 coach's checked into the hotel on a Friday afternoon. One of our 8 rooms had not been cleaned properly and the girls were welcomed with a dirty bed and linens. Housekeeping sent our angel, Debbie Stearne, who came to the rescue of the girls. Even though Debbie had not been the one responsible for cleaning the room she never made excuses and apologized profusely for the obvious oversight. While out practicing our Nationals routine and mentally preparing for the competition on Saturday Debbie snuck in and left the girls oreo cookies, cold milk, and a very thoughtful note of apology. While I expect ANY hotel would immediately correct the problem, like the Dallas Sheraton did, however I did NOT expect Debbie's incredible thoughtfulness.

Reviews.Title: “Got stuck at the Sheraton..”
Reviews.Author: Melvin Z
Reviews.Content: Ahh the Sheraton I spend about fifty percent of my life in hotels at this point in my life, most booked through the roulette game of price-line which can be the most brilliant move a person can make or one of the worst. Using this means of hotel booking is one made in an effort to save money, ending up at the Sheraton Dallas is a way to spend more than you would have for it's equivalent without the frustrations of it's failed attempts at being current and up-scale At this point in history I find the idea of having to pay for internet access in my room to be genuinely offensive, If Motel Six, McDonalds and Starbucks can give it away then who can't? As I admitted this feeling to the indignant young man at the registration desk as I was checking to make certain that this was in fact true, I was answered with the question; Really, why is that sir? So add $13.00 to the daily rate you're calculating for your stay here if you happen to be from this century and actually need access to the internet. Or plan to sit in the noisy registration area, the only place where web access is free. Also don't forget that if you need a car while here it's going to cost you another $22.00 per day to self park your car. If you actually like to have a good nights sleep with heat, remember to bring a space heater. As a part of the currently popular marketing ploy of attempting to be "green". This is one of those hotels with the motion sensor thermostats. Upon check-in the room will be cold in the winter and hot in the summer. That's okay, it's one less thing for housekeeping to remember. Only a mildly annoying point. It's the fact of no heat in the night that wakes one to shivering scramble for more covers that then sets the thermostat back into on mode that then heats the room back up to wake you to a pool of your own sweat as you throw the blankets aside. Plan to repeat this in one hour intervals. The over zealous concierge desk personnel smack of Walmarts greeters and really know how to make everyone feel welcome upon entering. So much so in fact that it feels as if it's all in leu of a flashing neon sign to say; "This place is so fancy, We have a concierge!". The well appointed room interior of room 675 is quite pleasing to the eye, however the rule of form following function seems not to be understood by the designer hired for the last remodel. The case goods are small and dysfunctional for anyone actually staying for more than overnights flop. No refrigerator or microwave, (of course room service is available at the expected prices) minimal towels And no shampoo or lotions. Sure these are simple little points to be complaining about. But for the stated price of over three hundred dollars a night for this room, I'm really wondering who could be so disconnected from the current reality of our economic state. Generally the room is small and very minimally functional or accommodating. The location is very literally central to the city and convenient to major highways. It's nice. Yes, it's "nice". I've been in worse, and for the money, I've been in a lot better. Even at the amazing daily room rate through Priceline.com I still couldn't recommend this hotel to a friend. I'm stuck here for eleven days. C'est la vie The very helpful, polite and friendly LeVaughn Parker who is some kind of desk manager suggested that rather than give him money for helping resolve my parking conundrum, that I take the time to write a review and mention him in a positive light. I do so sincerely. But I'm sorry Mr. Parker, I call 'em like I see 'em, This hotel is just a three star clip joint that has a captive audience in the middle of an unaccommodating area of downtown Dallas. So bring plenty of tip money and don't think it ends there.

Reviews.Title: “Luxourious and nice”
Reviews.Author: Antaryami
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the works. Classy, spacious and friendly staff. The rooms are nice and so are the restaurants and bars in the hotel. Parking is expensive but that's what you get at a hotel in Downtown Dallas. Overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Emma!”
Reviews.Author: 900Jen900
Reviews.Content: My husband, twin toddlers, and I stayed at the Sheraton for a conference over the New Year weekend. The front desk staff person (Emma) who checked us in was especially welcoming and helpful! In my experience it is not common for a full-service, downtown hotel in any city to be particularly family friendly, but Emma really changed our perspective and helped make our stay at the Sheraton fabulous! We will definitely be back... and someone needs to make sure Emma is acknowledged for her hard work and dedication to customer satisfaction!

Reviews.Title: “Draft Sports Bar in Sheraton Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Paul G
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling to Dallas for business for several months now and without fail the customer service in the Draft Sports bar is always over the top - starting with Serbando Berrios (and he'll say " just call me Junior " ) and many other very friendly staff and managers in the sports bar; they really make you feel at home and treat you like a VIP ! Good job Junior ! Keep up the good work !

Reviews.Title: “Find another place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Noel85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton for three nights. I would not go back and I would not recommend them. The hotelâ€™s elevator and tower system is not laid out in a customer friendly way. It is usually inconvenient to get from one place to the next. Every bank of elevators were in poor condition, they swayed made noises, and gave the riders a general feeling of uneasiness. On our last night at the hotel the elevators for our floor were broken. We had to walk down seven flights of stairs to get to the closest working elevators. We stopped by the conciergeâ€™s desk twice and they had limited knowledge about the city or directions. The people working at the car valet were unfriendly and inattentive. They did not leave the keys in the car so you had to wait for someone to let you in. We ate at two of the hotel restaurants both the food and service was poor. I would not recommend staying here. However if you do you should get the club lounge. The people who work in that area are inviting and friendly. The food and drinks are good.

Reviews.Title: “Associate Vernessa Brown”
Reviews.Author: Bridgett C
Reviews.Content: Vernessa Brown did a wonderful job cleaning our room. Wonderful service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sonia N
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great staff, quick check in,. Loved my room which had windows all across the wall with a great Dallas Skyline view. Would have given a rating of 5, except that there is no free Wi-Fi in rooms, only on 1st floor. Other than that, would highl recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Attitude”
Reviews.Author: william c
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Sheraton Hotel. I was here for a conference and from the very get go as I got out of my vehicle I was being assisted by friendly faces with great welcoming attitudes. Mitchell was an especially great help in getting all of my luggage up to my room despite the traffic jam at the elevators. Seeing him around the hotel with a smile on his face, working hard, was also a reminder of the great attitude of the entire staff at the Sheraton which made my stay more comfortable. It was certainly an enjoyable experience and I will recommend The Sheraton to anyone who is looking for the best hotel to stay in for a visit in Dallas, TX.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Samanthasa
Reviews.Content: The hotel, with gorgeous features and luxurious comforters, has equally outstanding service. The staff was more than pleasant and went above and beyond our expectations. Dan Macey the concierge and Asher, a beverage expert in the sports bar, were extremely helpful and made our stay more than worth coming to the Sheraton. It was an experience we will never forget and would consider returning to the Sheraton in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “How Every Hotel Should Be”
Reviews.Author: Tom E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a weekend at the Sheraton Dallas. From the moment we pulled up to the hotel, we were greeted and treated like very special guests despite the fact that the hotel was very, very busy. That is exactly why we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at Draft”
Reviews.Author: Natalie L
Reviews.Content: My co-workers and I have been staying at this hotel since October. Serbando Berrios has made our extended stay very enjoyable. He is very friendly and helpful and has great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Two Very Special People”
Reviews.Author: deanna_s824
Reviews.Content: I want to acknowlege and commend this "special" person, Mathew Jones, to all travelers and Management. My monthly stay at this hotel is more than great, as the hotel staff is very professional, couteous and very personable (a warm and friendly home away from home). Mathew always greets me with a smile, a super "welcome back" and a cold bottle of water when I register. He is a person that anyone would be more than glad to have on their TEAM. I would also like to take this opportunity to thank and commend Michele Imburgia for her super hospitality. Michele is a Manager who "steps out of the box" and ensures my stay at the hotel is special. Happy New Year to you All and Thank You for a great Year. I will see you after the Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience I had at the Sheraton Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Jengrif4209
Reviews.Content: Le Vaughn Parker was very friendly and helpful, made my experience very pleasant, thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel le vaugh Parker gave us the best service”
Reviews.Author: Grifster4029
Reviews.Content: Thanks Le Vaughn Parker for making our experience wonderful

Reviews.Title: “"Truly Preferred Guest"”
Reviews.Author: Bridgette60
Reviews.Content: I just spent a couple of days with my business group on our last trip prior to the holidays, and we were at the desk the day prior to checking out. I wanted to make sure that my SPG number was on my reservation and to ensure that I had a late checkout as my flight was later in the afternoon. Lavaughn informed me that I was a Gold member and proceeded to inform the others in my group about the benefits of the SPG program. I was unaware even though I have been an SPG member for quite sometime of all of the brands under the Starwood umbrella. I have not been using my number at my stays at the Aloft, and the Four Points. He not only signed my colleagues up for the SPG program but gave me the number and informed me that those prior stays I would still get credit for all while checking all five of us out at the same time. I enjoyed our stay and it was apparant that he enjoyed what he did. I also had a great experience with Shannell who operated the phones during my stay she was polite always courteous and professional. It was truly a good stay to end our travel year.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: JAZS68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a work conference and the hotel was clean and in decent shape. Only complaint was the South Tower water pressure was SERIOUSLY lacking in my room as it was for most of my co-workers. The service from hotel staff was terrific though. A special mention of the person directing traffic at the registration, Kimberly Huff. We had about 500 people checking in within the same 2 hour span and Kim was assisting guests, directing traffic, and even offered water while we were standing in line. She definitely made a great first impression for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Associate made it so easy”
Reviews.Author: Steve K
Reviews.Content: I wanted to spend some alone time with my partner after I we were forced to be apart, due to work, on their birthday. I shared this with the Sheraton Associate, Cynthia when I called in to make my reservations. I cannot say enough about how special my visit was and the excellent customer service I received. Thank you Cynthia for helping me to make this time special; you are a lifesaver.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Staten Island, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Total Experience”
Reviews.Author: Joseph A
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were beautiful. Clean & a lot of space. Very new with flat screen tv, couches & tables. very modern look. Room service as always was a bit expensive. I never mind paying because at least the portions are normally very filling. Well unfortunately the prices were still very high with very small portions. To pay $60 for breakfast and still be hungry is not a good feeling. One good thing about it was the service. Ms. Alicia Molina was very attentive and understanding to any need required.

Reviews.Title: “Service of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Cafe-Ice
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this wonderful Hotel for 4 days and 3 nights and the service was excellent! Mr. La Vaugn Parker showed great customer service from the front desk when I needed help on one evening there. The Room and Guest Services were on point as well. I love the Teas that were inside the room, I stopped drinking coffee 3 months ago and the tea selection was great! I will see you all real soon! ~M

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: James970
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to share my experience at the Sheraton Dallas. First off my check in was enjoyable because they had a make a green choice program which allowed me to exchange points for not having housekeeping which helped me double my points during my stay. Everytime I came to the lobby I was greeted by Lavon and he was very helpful with assisting me with faxes and eating options during my stay. Lauren at the desk also assisted me by helping me arrange for luggage storage so that I could leave my luggage for my upcoming stay next week. This was a very good trip and I am glad that I can recognize those who helped me by writing a simple review of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpwaco5556
Reviews.Content: I had the most perfect stay while i was in dallas. From matthew jones assisting me with my internet issues to haveing a great time with friends at the sports bar. the kareoke place was the most fun. I will definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: kincodb
Reviews.Content: I had the most perfect stay. Matt, Lauren, and edin gave me the best level 10 service I have ever seen. Kudos to all of them. The rooms were nice and the coffe was great. Thanks for the great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Dallas folks...”
Reviews.Author: Chiqui F
Reviews.Content: All employees of the Sheraton Dallas were outstanding! Special recgonition to Tonnette Steadman from Housekeeping and Will from the front desk!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Compliments for house cleaning- Iriabeth Bravo"”
Reviews.Author: raquel68_11
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the hotel, I was here for a conference, I stayed there for 3 nights, the room was very clean and there was a young lady by the name Iriabeth Bravo who works in house cleaning her customer service was outstanding. I had a very nice stay, the view was great from the 38th floor, the custome service overall awesome. I would recommand this hotel to everyone. Keep up the great work. Thanks Raquel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: InterntlTraveler10
