Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for a convention. Multiple towers, large convention area. Good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel plus hotel was pretty good. We were here in the midst of record heat wave and the room temp in our tower was never very cool. We were on government rate otherwise would have been pricey. Hotel parking is expensive as it is in most downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Compliments for the concierge - Dan Macey”
Reviews.Author: Judy B
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the hotel - I'm from Houston. Being from out of town, we had several questions about dining, transportation and internet services. Dan Macey was fabulous. He was so helpful and always spoke with a smile. He truly cares about the hotel guests and makes sure their stay is wonderful. After meeting me just once, he even remembered my name. I was impressed! Sheraton is lucky to have Dan on their team! Judy B.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool rooms, great hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: kobydog1
Reviews.Content: Everything was great! Rooms current, clean and cool. Great weekend Staycation for a local couple.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a conference~!”
Reviews.Author: E Y
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Dallas Sheraton, and I really enjoyed it! The room was very clean and updated and almost everyone there was very helpful! The only change that we had to make was because our first room was on the 19th floor and both my daughter and I have some difficulty with heights! They changed us quickly and without any fuss! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Emma F
Reviews.Content: I arrived here at 10pm on Thanksgiving night and had low expectations due to the holiday. However, was VERY pleasantly surprised to be greeted to great, friendly service. Room service was prompt and delicious to make for a Thanksgiving dinner. The newly renovated rooms were spacious, clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. Concierge was very helpful the next morning when I checked out and I would definitely recommend this hotel to travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Good Convention Property”
Reviews.Author: gwera
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a professional meeting. The room had been obviously refurbished. I got upgraded to the SPG floor which included a larger room with couch and furniture. The bathroom was small but functional. The amenities/soaps were unattractive. I got a pleasant checkin and enjoyed my stay. They did a really excellent job hosting the meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Staying for the Margarita Ball”
Reviews.Author: IslandFeverAflicted
Reviews.Content: Just spent Sat. night 11/19 at the Sheraton while attending the Margarita Ball. Overall it was a ood experience, but the management needs to make some adjustments to accommodate such a large crowd. I did not rank service, because while the individuals were exceptional, the mgt. needed to have more people to help. They were understaffed. Pros: Hotel Staff were exceptionally polite & accommodating. Nice rooms. Plenty of hot water. Lots of fast elevators. Good bed. Cons: No complimentary coffee in the lobby. Really? Swimming pool needs to be heated Need lots more bell hops/carts for this big of an event. I know that there was a rush of people to check in, but there was a line that took literally over an hour just waiting in line. They were completely sold out of rooms. They need to gear up accordingly with extra staff, & computers, Check in People, & Bell hops.

Reviews.Title: “Some trouble on my part, but great front desk staff made it all better!”
Reviews.Author: Donna W
Reviews.Content: I was attending a very large science conference... over 6000 teachers registered for the conference. My office made reservations for 27 rooms and one of MY staff made an error with the payment. MATTHEW JONES assisted me for 2 hours applying payment with 4 difference credit cards to fix this issue. He was extrememly professional and even had a few laughs for us to reduce the stress. Hotel should be very proud to have an employee with so much dedication and caring behind their desk.

Reviews.Title: “Just Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey M
Reviews.Content: Frequent business traveler. Starwood Preferred Guest. I was originally placed in a room in the South Tower (Club Level). In addition to the room being filthy, the heater was broken, the TV was broken, and the toilet was clogged (yes, it had been used). I was moved to another room in the South Tower (Club Level) that was much cleaner, but the sheets were ripped and the toilet was broken. I was then moved to a "renovated" room in the Center Tower that was nicer (although most of the TV channels were not clear). Now, I can understand when the house keeping forgets to clean a room or even flush a toilet, but the main reason for my negative review is how the hotel staff treated me. They were nothing short of rude to me and treated me as a nuisance. As an example, during my second day, I was contacted by the hotel staff (while I was in my conference) to immediately report to the registration desk. When I arrived, I was informed that I had failed to check out at 12p. I explained to the registration clerk that my reservation was for two nights and that I was not due to check out until the next day. The clerk informed me that because my reservation had a special room rate the first night, but not the second, my reservation was split into two confirmation numbers, which in turn required me to check out and then check in for my second night stay. The clerk then proceeded to check me out of my room and then check me in to the SAME room (all the while having a snub and argumentative attitude). In summary, I do recommend this hotel. Besides the rude hotel staff and dingy accommodations, the location of the hotel is in a shabby and dirty area. I did not feel safe walking to a nearby steakhouse at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnAislingSkye
Reviews.Content: Easy place to find by car , handy for freeway and downtown Dallas.Nice clean rooms and friendly staff.Plenty restaurants and bars nearby !

Reviews.Title: “Texas-Sized Hotel with Comfortable Rooms and a Few Service Issues”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisTravel4Fun
Reviews.Content: This is a huge, business oriented hotel in downtown Dallas. The main entrance/lobby area reminded me of a train station--bustling but fairly sterile. The wait to check in seemed interminable (actually it was about 20 minutes), with only two staff available at 4:30 pm, prime check in time. My 33rd floor room was truly Texas-sized, which surprised me since I was on a reduced rate. It had two very comfortable queen sized beds and an L-shaped sectional sofa that would seat about six people. I really liked the decor, in various shades of chocolate brown and other neutrals. The large flat screen HD TV had an excellent channel selection. I was surprised there was no mini bar, and I had to call housekeeping twice to get some shampoo. The fitness center is outstanding, with a good selection of equipment and plenty of treadmills. There is a Peet's Coffee in the lobby, which inexplicably closes in the early afternoon. On balance, my room was very comfortable, but the hotel is pretty impersonal and has some service kinks to work out before it reaches its potential.

Reviews.Title: “Guest Services Truly ROCKED!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Deborah_DST
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Sheraton Dallas was great....but what enhanced my opinion of this hotel was Guest Service associate, NESIB REDZIC! Nesib assisted me with serveral concerns in a courteous and professional manor. He answered each one of my questions with patience and helped me to problem solve potential concerns on my bill. It is experiences like this that make you appreciate superior customer service and the people who provide those services with a genuine smile. Kudos to Nesib Redzic and the Dallas Sheraton for an excellent experience! Nesib Redzic...you ROCK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Nikkiclark6
Reviews.Content: Matthew jones was a hero with checking in Tyler teachers.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend Escape!”
Reviews.Author: MrBry
Reviews.Content: Wow, I don't see how, I forgot to review this place last Oct (28th - 31st). We came down for Cowboy games (Jags 2010 and Bills 2011). The place is great, the deal (priceline) was tremendous. Hotel parking can be a problem, depends how much your willing to spend. It's not cheap. The hotel is located in the business district and that makes, for cheaper parking rates around the building on the weekend. Mass transit trolley, is right outside the door. Stores, restaurants and nightlife only a block or two away. Since our visits were on the weekend. It was like having downtown all to yourself. No crowds, no parking issues and access to everything. The hotel itself is a hub of activity. From Self Improvement to Herbal life seminars, including a Fetish Convention and a Black Tie Gala. Yes that's right, all those folks going back and forth, all at the same time. This along with just plain ole guest and people in town for the game too. The rooms are of decent size, they also offer Green (earth aka Eco friendly) rooms too. The Wi-fi did have an exorbitant charge of almost $13 a day (WOW). But I needed it to plan the rest of my trip. It's free and limited down in the lobby. I doubt it's Wi-fi down there. It's a great place to rest you head, but beware, your wallet might want to explore places, that surround the hotel. That is to quench your thirst, fill your belly or entertain ones soul. Great 4 star service kind of hotel! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Great Fitness Facility”
Reviews.Author: GJGPrescott
Reviews.Content: Rooms facing Bryan Steet contend with train noise deep into the night (at least ours did on the 6th floor). Hotel is older, but remodeled. King rooms are small. Parking garage across Olive could use some attention, particularly the elevator area (dingy and dirty, not a good first impression). "Draft" bar pleasant - plenty of TVs for Monday Night Football and decent prices. The best thing about the hotel from my perspective is the large gym which has clearly undergone a complete renovation - almost Vegas resort quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room so so food”
Reviews.Author: justjoe2
Reviews.Content: Expensive in room Internet. The food was very processed. The gift shop was very nicely stocked. Room was nice although I had a pair of shoes missing. Elevators were fast. The help desk wasn't very helpful. Not in an area where there is a lot to do. Computers were having problems in business center. Cab drivers did not know where they were going. Have your GPS ready.

Reviews.Title: “best concierge service ever!”
Reviews.Author: Rolando J
Reviews.Content: Besides the free upgrade for my room, last week we were in a customer event in Dallas, stayed at Sheraton Dallas Hotel and everything ran under control. Special thanks to RITA MARTINEZ at the concierge service who took 100% ownership of all the arrangements for us and our customers at the city. Thanks Rita. Big hug, Rolando.

Reviews.Title: “front desk”
Reviews.Author: Suzi W
Reviews.Content: Matt Jones at the front desk was wonderful! He was very helpful with a reservation that consisted 15 rooms. He was very nice and solved what was a stressful situation - a problem NOT caused by the hotel. Thank you Matt!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Staff”
Reviews.Author: kevin s
Reviews.Content: I attendeed a conference last month and stayed at this Sheraton. The staff was very pleasant and accomodating.The Drafts sports bar in the hotel is a great place to watch a game.The hotel was within walking distance of some great restaurants. I also recommend the Dallas Chop House

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff Enhance the Experience”
Reviews.Author: Trippin26
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hotel Dallas has a great location in downtown, close to the Arts District. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. What makes this hotel stand out is the service from all staff. Everyone from valet parking staff, greeters and front desk personnel go out of their way to assist you with a friendly attitude. I look forward to staying at this hotel, because I know my needs will be well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Great People”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to attend a large conference (1400 attended). The group putting on the conference did not leave schedules out for people arriving late at night. I needed to know what was going on the next morning and go to the right place directly (this is a huge hotel). I stood staring helplessly at the electronic listing of events in the lobby, which did not have enough detail. A passing hotel engineer, James Scott, stopped to ask if he could help me, and he quickly ascertained that the conference group did not have any materials ready for the late arrivals but he asked another helpful hotel employee behind the registration desk to print me an internal (to the hotel) room preparation list for the next day, and that showed exactly what I needed! James and the rest of the staff were super helpful and friendly - THUMBS UP for Dallas Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: amieepell
Reviews.Content: The accomidations and emenities were fantastic! Many great meals were had thanks to the help of the concerige staff. We enjoyed the Iron Cactus and Dakota's Steakhouse... all within walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Strange City”
Reviews.Author: Grande2305
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so big they have banks of elevators for different towers and floors. Rooms are nicely appointed and the staff is very pleasant and helpful. The food is very Texas -- uneventful and generally unhealthy. The Kitchen Table has a breakfast buffet that is minimal in choices yet high in price. The location is central for Dallas, but there is no central shopping or entertainment are in the city. The main streets are dead compared to other large cities. Dallas is very low on my preferred city list. The food and nightlife compares low with other parts of the country. With that said, the hotel staff was very good especially a young man in concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: MireilleSB
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel, in downtown Dallas, near touristic attractions. Rooms are clean, staff are nice and friendly, food is great but very expensive at the hotel. So try to eat outside and do not make orders to ur room, they will charge u double the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice hotel - recommend hotel package”
Reviews.Author: RL-TX
Reviews.Content: After arriving to Dallas for a long weekend, we went to the hotel to see if we could check-in early. We had reserved our room with the State Fair of Texas package so wanted to get our tickets to the metro rail and fair as well. The front desk manager was VERY helpful, checked us in early, tracked down our tickets and we were quickly on our way to enjoying our weekend - perfect! The hotel lobby was beautiful with lots of private nooks with couches, computers and wireless areas for guests to socialize and/or take care of business. I noticed the reviews about expensive parking here, so we chose a hotel package that included it and it was well worth our while! We stayed on the top floor of the North Tower and our room was excellent. My only complaint was that we asked for a quiet room and ended up being right next to some partiers. In a hotel that big, one would think they'd be able to have a quiet floor where they space folks out a little bit. The metro station (DART) rail was right across the street from the tower we stayed in. Some other reviewers mentioned road/metro noise but the room was not noisy above it (although we were very high above it). This area of downtown Dallas is quiet on weekends but the security at the rail station was very present, and the valet staff at the hotel were helpful in flagging down taxis so that we could easily head out to dinner. The hotel is a short taxi (or drive) away from some great restaurants in uptown Dallas. The fitness room in this hotel is impeccable and the pool area was gorgeous although very cold - I wish it had been heated!! The morning breakfast buffet was delicious and staff were very helpful there too. All-in-all a great stay. Just pick a hotel package that will cover the parking, breakfast, etc. and you'll be all set!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGirl618
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely clean and very nice. The gym was amazing and had every piece of equiptment you can imagine. The Draft (sports bar, restaurant) is very nice and a hopping place. I was there for a conference and it was perfect from the rooms to the food!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FScfs
Reviews.Content: Large room with excellent amenities, central location. Excellent value for the price. Parking was quite spendy.

Reviews.Title: “Victor Aguilar = STAR”
Reviews.Author: Quinn M
Reviews.Content: I spent last weekend in Dallas on some unfortunate family business. Not only did Mr. Aguilar do his best at check-in to make the process go smoothly and pleasantly, but once he realized that my stay was not under the best circumstances, he personally delivered a bottle of wine with a platter of fruit and cheese. This gesture was so above and beyond the experience I expected. I will not stay in any other hotel in Dallas again. Thank you Victor!

Reviews.Title: “Michael - concierge”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: Was in dire need of a great restaurant to host a customer dinner and Michael came through with flying colors. Understanding our needs right away, Michael was immediate with a suggestion and was able to get us a table within minutes. Seemed to be more than just about doing his job, but actually putting in that extra personal care to make the experience better than it would normally have been.

Reviews.Title: “Have Mercy!”
Reviews.Author: c e
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business conference. My room was paid for by my company. I ordered room service and paid for it with my own charge card. The hotel failed to charge the room to the company even though I reminded the front desk to do so at both check in and check out. Instead, three weeks later, the room was charged on my own charge card. Nobody called me for authorization. I received no receipt. I contacted the hotel to remedy the error. The accounting department fixed it after my accounting department contacted them. (Thank you, Victoria.) My complaint is with the front desk. I had to call multiple times over the course of three days to resolve this problem. Each time I called, speaking to the various people who answered the phone at the front desk was like speaking to teenagers with bad attitudes. Further, had the front desk processed the reservation under my company's account as I asked them to do, then this problem would have never existed. What a bad experience. A little work on the front desk could have prevented this problem altogether, or at least it would have made the resolution process less frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property; exceptional service individuals!”
Reviews.Author: Elle B
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dallas regularly for business and find myself returning to The Sheraton Dallas over and over again. Great corporate rates, clean rooms and facilities, and close proximity to the office bring me here; Exceptional service provided by keep Eddie Redzic, a room service attendant and hospitality extraordinaire, keep me coming back. In a fast paced corporate hotel filled with anonymity, Eddie is a warm and familiar face whose personal attention to sevice and kindness make me feel right at home. Thank you Sheraton Dallas for great service, and kudos to Mr. Redzic especially for making my time in the hotel a little more pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown SPG location”
Reviews.Author: NigelMA
Reviews.Content: There are many SPG hotels in the Dallas area (I've stayed in most). This is one of the better ones for the business traveller. You have a good chance of an upgrade with the large number of rooms in the hotel. I was upgraded to an executive suite which is spacious, although the living room area has no windows making it feel more like a cave. This hotel has been renovated though the bathrooms still have an older style feel to them. The staff at this hotel are extremely friendly and helpful. For food there area a few choices in the hotel and lots within walking distance - we tried the sports bar but after waiting five minutes with a waiter standing no more than 5 ft from our table just watching the TV we left and tried the main restaurant - here the service was faster but the food only mediocre (especially for the high price). Outside tha main restaurant there is a pleasant seating area on the deck around a couple of gas fires ... A good place for a post-dinner drink on a warm evening. The gym is well-equipped. The SPG member lounge is in the central tower which means if you are in one of the other two towers you need to go down to the lobby and back up another elevator to get there. The lounge itself is well staffed, includes an espresso machine and complimentary wine and beer during the evening hours. Lounge breakfast is limited to continental (cereal, fruit, yogurt, bread and pastries). The is a parking garage right across the street or valet parking ($29/night if I remember correctly).

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Sonja P
Reviews.Content: Service at the hotel was excellent from the Front Desk at check in to the banquet servers who graciously accommodated us to finding a lost phone charger and shipping it back to me. I would recommend this property to anyone traveling to the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “great for large events!”
Reviews.Author: sassysalesgirl
Reviews.Content: This is the ultimate hotel for Margarita Ball every year!!

Reviews.Title: “Expect to pay $100 in hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: Lee K
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and comfortable. Aesthetically, it was extraordinarily pleasing. However, I was incredibly disappointed with all the technical problems. As soon as I checked in, the woman at the desk had trouble with the room key. She also assured me that I didn't need a credit card to check in, but did NOT tell me about that she would charge a deposit. According to the concierge, "some" rooms had free internet while others charged $13. Mine was the latter. I also failed to realize that they were charging $4 for a small bottle of water when I assumed it was complimentary. Although I obviously am willing to pay for convenience (as I paid for the $42 to park in their garage), I felt the entire time that I was being tricked into paying charges that I was unaware of. I have yet to get my deposit back so who knows what will be on there!

Reviews.Title: “room service”
Reviews.Author: Rick B
Reviews.Content: Food was excellent and very quick (15 min.). Julio was great!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience and superior customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Tstotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was formerly owned by another chain. Sheraton took it over and have done an awesome job refreshing it. The service was 5 star. Every employee we met had a great attitude and passion for service!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Starwood quality!”
Reviews.Author: C B
Reviews.Content: Booked a Concierge Club Suite. Was meeting son's fiance for first time and wanted space for visiting and also for entertaining in the Club Lounge. Very disappointed to find that the Club Lounge was on the 27th Floor of the North Tower and my room was on the 28th Floor of the South Tower. It was a long distance between my room and the Club room. Could not believe the Club Lounge was so far from Concierge Suite! The snacks provided in the Club room were also very disappointing - cheese and crackers in evening and we walked out after checking out the breakfast -- a couple of slices of cantaloupe and some very unappetizing looking small muffins. Also we very disappointed to find my room at far end of dark hall next to an extremely noisy ice machine. Also the doors on this floor of hotel all had to be slammed to close -- this loud bang going on all through the night. The keycard was a problem and had to be changed twice. It was a problem everytime tried to open door. Learned it had to be slid in and out four time before it would "connect" and open the door. It is unnerving to be in room at far end of dark hall, alone, and have trouble getting into your room each time. Also disappointing was the fact that was charged $12.95 a day for internet connection. No hot water one morning - but everyone in this area of hotel was given a coupon for one free drink. This is an old hotel - geared for large conferences - lots of problems - did not seem Starwood quality at all!

Reviews.Title: “Concert Trip”
Reviews.Author: Happymom207
Reviews.Content: My daughter wanted to go to a concert with her friend but without the parents tagging along. It was the first trip she had ever taken without adult supervision. I called the Sheraton because we have always had good luck with this hotel chain. It was just a short way from the concert arena and that was important because I didn't want her driving too far at night. She loved her room and the hotel made it so easy for her to checkin and checkout. Bottom line, it was clean, friendly and they took good care of my baby. From a mom's perspective, thats all thats important. They took good care of my baby.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service”
Reviews.Author: Syed I
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. The last night, I had a severe toothache. I called the front desk at 4am in the morning and requested for some medicine. DORIS HEARN came up to the room and provided me with the pain relief medicine. That was very kind of her!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton stay”
Reviews.Author: Helen H
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Sheraton Dalls was very enjoyable. The staff was professional and personable. The room was spacious and clean. The amenities were excellent. The restaurants were quite good as well. It was a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “I was overwhelmed by the "can do" attitude...”
Reviews.Author: Scott F
Reviews.Content: I was quite pleased with the attentiveness I received by your staff at Sheraton Dallas. We had a huge convention in town and I never had the impression your staff was bothered by all the people and all the continuous requests. I especially want to recognize Maria Armendariz. Maria was the hostess in the cafe' and made each morning very bright with a mega watt smile, affable demeanor and a willingness to help me start my day out right. Kudos to you all, but Maria, keep up the great job!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, very clean, and environmentally conscious...”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton Dallas Hotel. The staff were exceptionally friendly (a special shout out to Julio Osorto for excellent customer service), and the hotel very clean and comfortable. Would definitely recommend to fellow travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Soft Sheets”
Reviews.Author: selective96
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of a conference I was attending but it was an excellant choice. I stayed on the newly renovated side. It was great! Soft pillows, cozy sheets. The breafast buffet is not worth the price you may do better ordering directly from the menu. Being a preferred customer I recived a 20 percent coupon a few weeks before my stay for food. That was nice. Staff is friendly, I stayed the weekend of the big game.. UT and OU..Though crowded I had a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel to Stay Very Expensive but then again is a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlie537
Reviews.Content: We Got the Hotel at a discount cost we save about 90% of what it cost. This Hotel is mostly for the high class Hotel rate normaly is 299.00 a night were we were staying parking 20.00 a day internet 12.95 day bottle of water in room 4.00 local phone calls .75 per call if you add up all the extras is not cheap.The good thing about the Hotel is that is Clean, Staff was nice even if we complain about the parking they told us they have to pay for parking too. I would stay here if i was rich but im not.

Reviews.Title: “State Fair Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: jimlc
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to stay at this hotel and we can promise it will not be our last! Easy access to and from fair grounds. Treated us very well!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Denae H
Reviews.Content: As one of the judges for the State Fair of Texas, I was extremely happy to be housed at the Sheraton! Great service, great room, wonderful stay! My favorite was the bottled water and Starbucks singles for the coffee bar- happy day! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “State Fair Stay”
Reviews.Author: mskmg
Reviews.Content: In the area to attend the State Fair. Hotel was in an excellent location to access all major freeways as well as shuttle bus to the fair located accross the street. Accomodations were nice, rooms are comfortable and spacious. Workout facility is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shelley B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and priced reasonably for downtown Dallas. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was on a business trip and the Links business center was also nice AND it was free internet! I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Debbie from Memphis”
Reviews.Author: Deborah S
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to this hotel for business and as always they were fantastic! All of the staff was kind and courteous and friendly. We had close to 50 new agency employees staying there and everyone was higly pleased with their stay. I would recommend the Dallas Sheraton to anyone for business or pleasure. The atmosphere was great and the food delicious.

Reviews.Title: “NICE STAY”
Reviews.Author: Tajuana N
Reviews.Content: I had a great time staying at the Sheraton Hotel. The hotel had luxury style amenities at an affordable price. The rooms were clean and very nicely decorated. The patio was so relaxing, they had comfortable chairs and sofa's surrounding an open fire pit where we sat and talked amongst other guest. I would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Charged our credit card out of the blue!”
Reviews.Author: Katie C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sheraton for 2 nights in July. Really nice hotel, helpful staff, really nice bar BUT we prepaid for our hotel through our travel agent, there was a bit of confusion on check in and as usual they swiped our credit card for incidentals. Arrived back to Ireland and several weeks later they charged $230 to our credit card out of the blue!! They have conceded that this charge was made in error but six weeks later I still haven't got my money back. Really disappointed with how it's been dealt with, I've effectively been robbed by the hotel and they've made little or no effort to rectify their mistake in a timely way. I'm hoping to receive a repayment in the coming days but I've spent so much time on the phone trying to sort it out at this stage I'm still holding my breath. Fab hotel but massively disappointed with customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to public transport”
Reviews.Author: ZazfromSydney
Reviews.Content: Beds were fantastic and staff were helpful. Dallas isn't really the place you would go on holiday unless you had specific things you were planning to do. We only stopped in Dallas as we flew Qantas's new direct route from Sydney, and decided to check it out for a few days. The tram is a 2 minute walk away and should get you where you need to go. All in all, we had a great stay, and I would stay there again should I ever be passing through Dallas again. Would be a great hotel for those on business or attending a conference in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “No Parking (and rude staff)”
Reviews.Author: Sandra M
Reviews.Content: We will not be staying at this hotel ever again. First, I was told that there would be parking for guest, then when we discovered the garage closed, we were told to circle around the building to another garage. This garage was also full, and we were assured that we would be allowed to park in the first garage if we presented our room key. Well that certainly did not happen, and after being told rudely that we would just have to find someplace else, we ended up parking 1/2 mile away (would have been nice if we could have at least unloaded our luggage). So I call the front desk when we are in our room, and they assure me we will NOT be charged for parking. You can guess what happened then --- morning receipt shows parking charged against my credit card. When I go downstairs to registration and say we have been overcharged, the clerk argues with me about whether being charged for parking (when you couldn't park) is actually an "overcharge". Again rudely informed me that I was using the wrong term. Embassy Suites here we come.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: Foxtrot-BandB
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation for a standard King room for two nights. When I checked in they said that I had been upgraded to a suite. I expected it would be a "Jr. Suite" where they put a sitting area at the end of the room. Was I surprised when I walked in and found a living room with two sofas and a big chair, plus a dinning area. There was a long hall down to the bedroom that was flanked with a large closet and a very nice bath. The bedroom was large, with a in-room wet bar and relaxing chair. When I called the front desk to check if this was right, they assured me that it was. The restaurant had a great breakfast buffet. The concierge service was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton DFW”
Reviews.Author: arney121
Reviews.Content: My comments will fall into two categories not so good and very good. Not So Good: The roads around the hotel are one way; if you miss the entrance you have to circle around a couple of blocks to return to the entrance. Parking costs are crazy, Vale is $24 and Self Park is $21. So add that to the overall cost of Sheratonâ€™s expensive rooms. I look for minor issues because they are indications of how Sheraton takes care of major issues. In my room the bathroom light cover was covered in so much dust that the bathroom lighting was very dim, the hot water faucet handle was loose and spun around, and the sink drain was clogged. I found a safety issue, the electrical outlet located at the head of the bed had a two outlet converted into four outlet with four plug connected to everything, all of the wires were nestled against the box spring. Potential fire hazard - You be the judge. Finally; Sheraton has a restaurant but their prices are not very reasonable, an example would be breakfast buffet was around $20. The quality and quantity fell short of my expectations. Good: The exercise room as over the top, great facility, great equipment. The pool was located outside the exercise room on the fourth floor so the view was interesting. The Sheraton has 29 floors, great stair running if you enjoy that kind of exercise. The staff was the best part of my experience, they were very friendly. All of my questions were answered to my satisfaction. The registration process was slow but Sheraton had several agents on duty to keep the flow moving. Over all, my room was vey nice, the view of DFW was breath taking. The bed was pillow style and the TV was a large flat screen high definition model. I was impressed with room service. Over All; I probably wonâ€™t stay there again, it just didnâ€™t meet my expectations or my budget.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Hotel, Convenient to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: YogaTravel
Reviews.Content: A group of about 25 stayed here in July for a fitness competition that was held at the Convention Center. We stayed for two nights and were pleased with our stay. The rooms are very spacious (3 of us roomed together) and we felt like we had plenty of room to spread out. There are also several counters/mirrors in the room which are great for people to spread out and get ready (fix hair, makeup). The staff was friendly, but very average. We stayed at this hotel due to the proximity to the convention center. Half a block away is a tram and you can get a pass for $3. The tram ride to the convention center is about 10 minutes. I made the mistake of meeting up with the group later and rode by myself (I'm in my 20's, blonde) and actually received honest feedback from several locals that I need to either go back to the hotel or get with my group, so please be careful. There were a number of restaurants and bars within a 10 minute walk, but again please go with someone. The hotel has a delicious brunch (although ~$25/pp), but it was very good with a broad selection. The hotel gift shop also has a lot of essentials if you need anything. There is hotel parking with plenty of room for everyone. All in all, it was a fine visit but I wouldn't necessarily stay there again if I felt there were better options.

Reviews.Title: “Not everything is what it appears”
Reviews.Author: Ari F
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a large block of rooms at the hotel for a wedding and brunch. The group reservations girl offered a suite for the Bride and Groom for the wedding evening. After getting the bill, it appears that our Group Reservations girl is no longer working at the Sheraton, and they refused to honor her commitment. We also booked a per person brunch with the hotel and had 70 guests attend. They presented me a bill for 96 persons on the basis that they had to set more place settings (as people moved to visit with others) and that rather than counting the actual number of people, they counted place settings. Not a really good idea when you have people going back for more food and moving to other seats to visit with other family and relatives. I would not recommend another event at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Panchex
Reviews.Content: Great service! I have been staying in this hotel for the last 6 month. Hotel is clean and nice if you are staying for business or pleasure during the weekend. Location is good, driving distance to the best shopping malls (Galleria and North Park) and tourist sites. Suites are huge! a lot of space of 4 people. The two best things of this hotel is the Executive Lounge and the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: travlinlite319
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a couple for four days in September. Every member of the staff was pleasant, accommodating, and efficient. Asked for and received an upper room with a great view. Room was medium size, modern and spotless. Big screen, flat HDTV. Starbucks coffee in room. Excellent, though a bit pricey at $19, breakfast buffet. Large sports lounge with very large TV's and reasonable drinks and snacks. Hotel is connected by skybridge on north side to a small mall with shopping, ice skating rink, and small cafes and fast food including a McDonald's. A number of inexpensive restaurants within a three block area. Walk to the famous Adolphus hotel four blocks away to view the historic lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean room”
Reviews.Author: Clifford A
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed walking into a nice, clean room/bathroom. Many times you go to hotels that look great but when you see the room want to run. This was definitely not the case. I was greeted quite nicely by porters, taken to registration, and given excellent service; and, even tips on how to get where i needed faster. My only reason for not giving 5 stars was for the rather high cost of guest self parking, which was $21 nightly, but the upside was it seemed well watched and my vehicle was safe.

Reviews.Title: “huge conference center”
Reviews.Author: G K
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Sheraton and this hotel does not disappoint. The only thing keeping it from 5 circles is the loud and almost constant train that runs most of the night. I recommend ear plugs. The food is excellent, the hotel and conference center are attractive and clean. Room service is just as tasty as the restaurant and swift. The sports bar is good, too.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and just ok”
Reviews.Author: marco1234_2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a convention and it was just "ok." The lobby was nice, but the rooms were really outdated. The bathroom was narrow and the fixtures were from the 70's. The shower pressure and temperature changes when anyone else in the hotel flushed a toilet in a nearby room. The air conditioning in the room was not keeping pace....they have installed one of those motion sensors to shut the thing down when nobody is there....clearly a good idea. Problem is at night, when you are not moving (asleep), it shuts off, so I woke up each night uncomfortable. The bed was great, so was the bedding and pillows. Ordered room service and it took forever (1.5 hours) and was over priced and mediocre at best My advice...lots of other choices in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service, otherwise, just good”
Reviews.Author: Copyedster
Reviews.Content: We got a bargain on Priceline, and we were quite happy with the stay. The best marks for this hotel go to its staff. Everyone was exceptionally nice, happy and helpful. We sort of felt like they were happy to see us. Imagine that! :) The rest of the stay was quite good too. The room was clean, recently updated and of an average size. It had a flat-screen TV and free make-your-own Starbucks. It has a large sports bar and a decent-size gift shop, if you're into that sort of stuff. The following may sound like complaints, but we weren't really bothered by this stuff... but we thought some travelers might like to know: no free internet, low water pressure in the shower, no mini-bar/fridge in the room. Also, the location wasn't great for a regular tourist, but we like to walk, so we didn't mind. It's still walkable to the West End and Arts District, it's just that its immediate surrounds were a bit bare. Again, big ups to the staff. They were great.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel with good service, only average food”
Reviews.Author: AndyTheGameInventor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights for a wedding. Perhaps because I am Starwood Preferred Guest and perhaps because they were full, we were upgraded to a room on the 27th floor which was very spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was large and well appointed. This was not luxury per se but at $140 very good value. Food at the sports bar was good and reasonably priced. I attended a private brunch in a function room of the hotel and found the food (trays of scrambled egg, pancackes, etc) to be mediocre. Internet is about $13 per day but the hotel does provide free wi-fi in some public areas - so you don't have to pay $13 to do that quick email check. I think that's a reasonable compromise. We did find prices at the gift shop ($8.50 for a tube of 10 Advil, $8.50 for a high-end chocolate bar) and parking ($29/day for valet) to be high. I do realize that this is no different than in other big cities. The Peet's Coffee in the hotel is a "partner enterprise", whatever that means, that charges 2X normal prices and doesn't accept the Peet's card. This is a convention hotel (attached to a convention center across the street) and the assumption is that someone else is paying your bill. Hotel service was friendly in most cases, valet was very good, concierge varied somewhat from very helpful to less so. As you walk in there are people standing there to greet you every single time, which is nice. Health club is very nice and well equipped, and the pool is nice, the pool deck has these cabanas of sorts (more like a bed with curtains) that were very enjoyable and free, unlike at some hotels. What this hotel could use is a larger variety of restautants, otherwise, a very comfortable hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Very large standard convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: nonamesforme
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Dallas is geared towards conventions and is perfectly adequate for that purpose, but would be disappointing as a "destination" hotel. The rooms are small, clean, and slightly dated. The bathrooms are tiny: floor space is 3x4'. An attempt to update involved granite counter and floor. the gym is actually very good, large and airy. The pool and pool deck are fine, if under attended. The restaurant appeared to be minimal, and my partner felt it was too exposed for comfort. The staff was excellent. The manager, Joe, was outgoing, attentive and very much on the scene. The housekeeping staff were friendly and polite. The concierge and reception desk staff were helpful. the elevators all worked, and there wasn't much waiting. The hotel location feels kind of on the edge of downtown Dallas. And downtown Dallas is not vibrant!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Dallas Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: IrishRed51
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Dallas Hotel is, by far, one of the best hotels I've stayed at. The moment the limo dropped me off at the entrance, I was treated with exception customer service. The only thing that would have made it PERFECT was if the guest shop employee had been friendlier. However, the rest of the Sheraton staff more than made up for it. Fast, efficient service. Helpful staff, beyond the usual.

Reviews.Title: “Wish all hotels were like this!!”
Reviews.Author: LakeLizard
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the fact that I was on the 29th floor in a club level room may have a little bit to do with why I was so happy, but my co-workers who stayed in a different tower were also very pleased with their rooms so I don't think I'm too far off base. Check in was quicker than I thought. We arrived for a conference and there were at least 30 people in front of me waiting to check in. But the Sheraton had prepared for the traffic and had staff at every available check in station...probably 8-10 staff...and they got us through the line within about 15 minutes. When it was my turn to check in I was greeted as a preferred Starwood member (don't remember when I registered for this, but THEY knew), was checked in promptly, was given details about Internet use, parking, and the new green program which gave me a $5 food/beverage voucher per day for declining housekeeping service during my stay. I was a little worried that because we'd received a discounted rate through our employer that we'd all end up in older rooms. The elevator quickly took me to the 29th floor, I opened the door, and WOW. I was so pleased. My room was clean, obviously refurbished recently, and was everything I could've expected and more. The beds are super soft and cushy. You almost sink into them when you lay down. The only problem with this is that it didn't provide the best support for my sometimes bad back, but it was so comfy for most of the night that I'm not complaining. The bathroom was clean...no hair from the previous visitors. Plenty of lighting throughout the room, lots of outlets to plug things in, curtains that covered the windows all the way, water, coffee, flat screen tv...are you getting the picture here? I also had free Internet service, I think as a preferred club member perk. As a club member staying on the club level, I also had access to the club lounge. Each time I visited, it was clean and there was a staff member available to greet me and make sure I had everything i needed. The lounge was spacious and had a great view from the 27th floor. The only complaint that really isn't worth mentioning was with parking. Valet was swamped when we arrived, which I expected it would be because of the conference. We did the self parking which is usually $21 per day, but we received a discounted rate because of the conference we attended. You have to swipe your room key to enter/exit the parking garage and each time we left we had to call for assistance because the key didn't allow us to exit. But the attendant quickly activated the card and we were off. Dining in the hotel is limited. I wasn't overly impressed with the menu at either eating establishment, and as is par for the course at all hotels, the room service menu is insanely priced. We only ate once at the Draft Sports Lounge. The food was decent, but we dined away from the hotel the rest of the time. Overall, I have no complaints about this hotel and would definitely, definitely stay here again. I like for a hotel to make me feel like, although 1,000 other people have stayed in the same room, I'm the first one to be there. Presentation, cleanliness, smell, lighting, outlets...all of this matters to me, a lot. And the Sheraton definitely exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to do after dark :-(”
Reviews.Author: TradeshowMagician
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are clean, the convention facilities are nice, the restaurant selection is poor.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again..”
Reviews.Author: BeachBrownie5001j
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for a conference at this hotel for 4 days. This hotel isn't too far from DFW or Love Field. Beautiful lobby, efficient, professional check-in. Staff accommodated my request for a room with a city view - it was gorgeous, especially at night all lit up. The room was clean, adequately spaced for 1/2 people, had a flat screen tv, and modern fixtures in the bathroom. I also liked the color scheme/artwork in the bathroom - tasteful. Outside of the restaurants in the hotel which I didn't try, there are limited restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. There is a food court that is across the skywalk that has a few healthy options, but it is only open for breakfast and lunch. You'll have to find other options for dinner. I didn't have a car so I walked one early evening in search of food. The downtown streets were kinda scary for a solo female so I would suggest driving or taking the Dart train to ensure your safety (women). A friend and I found a very nice and reasonably priced steakhouse (a must when visiting Texas). It's called Hoffbrau Steaks located at 311 N. Market - service was great and the food delicious! Top off your meal with the peach cobbler!!

Reviews.Title: “WE loved and will be back”
Reviews.Author: maxjack11
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful!!! The people were exceptional very friendly. It seems no one cares about customer service anymore however this is not true of this hotel. Everyone was friendly and helpful down to the people who valet parked the cars!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Three Stars”
Reviews.Author: tomandcynthia
Reviews.Content: I lowered the rating on this hotel due to the following: parking was an expensive add-on at $20+ per day; internet was also an expensive add-on at $25 per day; the king size bed room was extremely small (smallest I've experienced) with the bathroom so small you could stretch out your arms and hit both walls (and I'm a small person). Lastly, the air conditioner could not keep the room at a comfortable temperature (72-75 degrees). Dallas was experiencing temperatures in the 100's but I would think that is normal in the summer and their systems would be built to handle the heat, especially given the room was so small. We finally had to put the thermostat at 65 to get the room even a little comfortable. For the price, I was definitely expecting more. We stayed at the hotel over labor day and something was going on as parking and check-in were chaotic. Overall, the staff handled the volume of people very well. The hotel itself was nicely appointed (recently renovated) and well laid out with a great business center. Our room was clean. Also we had breakfast at the hotel and it was very good (pricey) with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but desolate area.”
Reviews.Author: BaronFoer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with nice rooms but there is virtiually nothing in the area. If you have a car it is not too bad and there is the "DART" transportation system right next to the hotel at $7 a day. All the restaraunts are on the west side of the downtown area. Nice beds but the ironing board is a 3 foot table top verasion (how cheap can you get). Hoep there are lots of ball games on TV... There is a good sports bar and it is hopping all the time, however the venue is priced at hotel rates....

Reviews.Title: “Just an okay place to stay”
Reviews.Author: K K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in September. We originally were placed in the south tower which has the old unupdated rooms. After seeing the room which had stains on the carpet, multiple stains on each bed sheet and pillow case, and marks on the wall, we asked to switch to a room in the center tower. If you stay here, make sure you get a center tower room because it's not worth it otherwise. The old rooms are small, and don't seem to be cared for well. I understand it takes a great deal of money to renovate hotel rooms but the old rooms should be maintained better. How hard is it to clean or cover up shoe marks on the wall? The front desk staff was helpful and made the switch for us which was appreciated. The center tower rooms were much more spacious and clean. Being that water or soda is a minimum of $3.00 a bottle in the guest shop, I tried walking to the vending machine to buy one at $2.00. The vending machine on my floor as well as four others was empty. I called roomservice to ask if they could bring one up for the same price and was told to go to the guest shop. When I explained the price difference, the employee told me that she was not sure why they don't refill the machines and told that she could not just give me one for $2.00. I mean it's a bit trivial and I'm not typically one to complain over a $1.00, but that just seems like mediocre service. Probably not worth the money for this hotel unless you can get a good deal on Hotwire or something.....no way this is a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not great for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: gretayesinia
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference. They had the gall to charge me $50 for access to wifi in the conference rooms for 2 days, and if I wanted access in my room, I'd have to pay another wifi charge. Talk about double dipping. Their tech support is horrible and they had me on hold more than 1/2 hour. Toilets didn't work. Room service for a simple snack took over an hour. The conference room didn't even have charges at the tables for laptops. The manager wouldn't waive the wifi charges not even given that my company is a big supporter of this chain. The decor in the hotel is very dated...something out of the late 80s and early 90s. Staff except tech support is eager to please, if not particularly helpful. The gym has modern equipment, but the pool is small. Might feel different if I was here on travel other than business, but do not recommend this hotel for business.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive facilty, comfortable with a fantastic menu!”
Reviews.Author: Denise H
Reviews.Content: For a large hotel, Sheraton Dallas was welcoming and warm. Elevators and stores were clearly marked, and the staff was very courteous. I was impressed by the wine selection, and even more impressed by the option to 'Create Your Own Salad' at the Kitchen Table Restaurant. In this cattle-boasting state, this was a wonderful option for a vegetarian. There were items such as eggplant, artichokes and feta cheese available, so it was above my expectations for normal salad toppers. It was one of the more reasonable items on the menu, as the breakfast buffet and a la carte items were priced rather high. Thank you for your lovely accommodations!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in a wonderful location at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: PhyllisTubac_Az
Reviews.Content: Tow women in Dallas for a wedding with quite a bit of free time. The hotel restaurant provided wonderful service and food twice, even though we were going in as they were closing. Room on the 26th floor was large and very comfortable. The wedding reception on 38th floor was lovely. We received advice from the hotel staff about sights in the downtown area and how to take the city train and enjoyed the JFK Museum, Neiman Marcus, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience for first visit to Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Pat H
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent full service hotel. From the exercise room to the restaurants, you couldn't ask for more. This coupled with its capacity makes it all the more impressive. The hotel restaurant (Kitchen Table) has the BEST home-baked rolls. The menu was a little pricier than expected but the quality was exceptional. The sports bar (Drafts) was excellent and the nachos were a pleasant surprise in that we made a meal out of them amongst three of us. Free WIFI / computers in the lobby area was the topper. All in all, can't say enough about the hotel. Even maintenance paid a visit to the room because housekeeping (or inspection) saw that the tub was draining slower than expected and they worked on it without us asking. Thank you Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.. but....”
Reviews.Author: Speeding_Wheels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night during the Radio Shack annual summit. We only got one night in this hotel due to a booking mixup on the behalf of the show company. We checked in at 8am because we were switching hotels. Luckily the Sheraton had a room available when we arrived...actually a suite!!! Well, the suite is one of the rooms in this property that has yet to be renovated. We were located on the 9th floor of the south tower. The room was HUGE however very dated. The bathroom had pocket doors that were long off their tracks and made horrendous noises when trying to close them. There was no hand shower even though the shower and bathtub were seperate. Otherwise the property itself is awesome. The staff is excellent. The property is very nicely kept and even with these shortcommings it's hard to be unhappy. I would love to stay here again in a room that has undergone renovation.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Sheraton Dallas Hotel. The staff was wonderful and very accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: Kim R
Reviews.Content: I have gone to Dallas on many business related trips and stayed at the Sheraton Dallas, but something was different this time. It was always good, but this time it was great. The cold drinks in the lobby during the heat spell was a nice touch. The staff was kind and interactive. The rooms are nice and clean, but the suites are beautiful as well. It was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay will return.”
Reviews.Author: Diamond5Anahuac
Reviews.Content: If you need anything special inform the hotel before you arrive and they will do all that they can to make it happen

Reviews.Title: “Awesome customer service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea W
Reviews.Content: I left some items in my room and housekeeping called me and placed them in the mail immediately!! The head of housekeeping called me and expressed concern, over the lost items, and was extremely polite, professional and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “summer conference the Sheraton way”
Reviews.Author: wenhen56
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Sheraton for a professional conference. I loved it! I got great rates, super clean rooms, professional, friendly staff and a very comfortable bed. Believe me, I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: g j
Reviews.Content: Travelled for a work convention and had a great time. Well kept rooms that were spotless and relaxing. Awesome beds. The restaurant downstairs was able to provide gluten free food for me as was the room service. Loved my stay and will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Experience was great at the Sheraton. Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte B
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and quiet. Hotel atmosphere was great and food was very good.. Staff treated us with respect and was very prompt with our service.

Reviews.Title: “Best business experience yet!”
Reviews.Author: Alden A
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to a lot of hotels for business with my company, but none like this one! It was warm, inviting and SUPER clean and classy. The woman who checked my husband and I in was so friendly and relatable. She got us in super fast AND was very helpful with ALL the details of our accommodations. I would stay here again and again! And even though we were there on business, we got to stay a few extra days for personal and it was wonderful for either type of stay! There's also ROWS of computers you can use for free in the lobby - what convenience!! #1 in my book!

Reviews.Title: “Love the after hours pool!”
Reviews.Author: Osonegr0
Reviews.Content: Great place but $21 a night parking fee, $5 bottle of water, a fee to call customer or guest services and a fee to have wi fi in your room when everybody else gives it free was a negative for me. The price to stay there already is high on top of that pay so much for what is normally free not good . And at night a bunch of drunk people roaming the lobby's not good.

Reviews.Title: “BAD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Nanny122954
Reviews.Content: We were excited about the great price we got at hot wire, but we did not realize until arrival that there was a $30.00 parking fee per day. Our son in law went to the gift shop to buy candy. but when he opened the Reeses candy bar he discovered it was old. He asked for a refund and the sales lady said they had a no refund policy so he picked out another candy bar, of course it was rotten as well. Our grandchildren wanted to swim but the pool ws cloudy and had things floating in it. Our 6 year old granddaughter got in and said " Nanny, there is fur floating in this pool. It was clumps of hair. When you got out of the pool your skin ws slimy from the sun screen floating in the pool. Our 10 year old grandson was not about to get in and sat on the cabanna with us. He said be careful where you put your hands, there is pidgeon poop all over this cabanna. It was very nasty! On our second day we were all in our car and the valet said there was a problem with the account, and took the keys in with him while our entire family sat out in a hot car. Of course it was their mistake on a 108 degree day. The rooms were fine, but after every thing else that happened, you couldn't pay us enough to stay at this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely done”
Reviews.Author: MaryAlice1960
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been completely remodeled and is just beautiful! Rooms are large, beds are comfy. Ate at the sports bar and their wrap was fabulous. Only complaint was you had to watch your bar tab, ordered a house wine and they charged for a premium one, not only one day but two. The pool is very nice and the gym is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “If Service is important to you...”
Reviews.Author: travaille2travel
Reviews.Content: Excellent service - Very warm greeting and check-in upon arrival. When we needed anything, including directions, bottled water, etc., they were very prompt in servicing our needs. Everyone from check-in to the bellhops and the valet were very helpful and answered any questions we had during our stay. The hotel itself is very nice -- you can definitely see the beauty of it with the new renovations they have done there. The room was very spacious and had a great view of downtown and Dallas (we were facing the east side). Only about a $5 cab ride to Uptown and walking distance to Main St. bars/restaurants. Only complaint was expensive for parking there, but I guess most downtown hotels seem to charge similar rates. Will definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “"A home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: AMOS O
Reviews.Content: I have been to several Hotels for leisure and conferences but my experience at Sheraton Dallas was an exceptionally positive. I enjoyed an extraordinary service right from my arrival to departure. The valet staff members not only helped with the baggage but their smiles and welcoming attitudes made me feel at home. The courtesy of the person who checked me in (and fortunately she was the one who checked me out too!) was great! She gave me an undivided attention in spite of the large crowd there that day. Her friendliness at the checking out was so positive that I did not hesitate to inform her how positive my experience was. The room was spacious for my comfort and my business. The room service was excellent due to the immediate response given to my need. In fact, my stay in Sheraton Dallas Hotel was so positive that I will remember it as my "Home away from Home." I will definitely return to the place whenever I am in Dallas. Thanks to all the staff who are the mirrors of Sheraton Dallas Hotel! You are all great!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Cool stay in hot Dallas”
Reviews.Author: RevJC
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a convention in Dallas, and stayed at the Sheraton. My stay from beginning to end was great; the staff was courteous and made every effort to made the stay comfortable and pleasant. The weather out side was hot-hot-hot! But, my experience at the Dallas Sherton, was cool and relaxing. Thanks, everyone for making me feel welcome for the week. Yours truly. Rev. Jeff Coggins-massillon, Oh

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: RegularTraveler012
Reviews.Content: I was particularly impressed with the helpfulness of the hotel staff during my four day stay. The housekeeping staff greeted those who passed by cheerfully. A maintenance employee took a detour from his work to help me find my way. The concierge desk was well staff and consistently detailed and attentive in their assistance. A manager not only suggested a restaurant within the hotel, but walked me to the entrance. When there was a back up at the registration desk and I had questions about my check out, I was able to get answers and check out by phone with a courteous operator, I sensed that hotel management encourages and models quality service.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE hotel but well-organized”
Reviews.Author: Chickenbiscuit
Reviews.Content: Enormous hotel located in downtown Dallas. Nice access to nearby eateries through a skybridge connecting the Sheraton to the Marriott next door. Eateries close around 5pm so prepare accordingly if you wish to eat outside the hotel. I was here as part of a convention of 3,000 and the hotel handled the crowds superbly. Very well-organized and orderly. Internet access is free if you use the hotel wireless in the lobby and about $15/day if you wish to purchase service in order to access the Internet in your room. A bit pricey but pretty standard for these larger scale hotels. Five banks of elevators are a bit confusing at first but once you gain an understanding of which one leads to your particular room, they are much more efficient that standard elevators which access all floors of a building. Comfortable room and nice soft bed. Starbucks coffee packs in the room made for a comfortable wakeup as well. I would recommend the Sheraton if you have a need to stay in the downtown Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynda P
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very knowledgeable and helpful to resolve all problems

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: minermike79
Reviews.Content: First time here and I can honestly say it will not be my last. My wife and I went for a weekend getaway and had a great time. Everybody was very pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The gym was amazing as well as the pool. The hotel is in a great location, near bars and restaurants. Cab rides where cheap and you can also take the dart or the M. One thing don't bring back leftovers our room didnt have a frig.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: kimmerdoon
Reviews.Content: The beds were oh so comfy, and the staff was so very helpful and quick to respond when we made requests. We were there for a Mary Kay convention. In Mary Kay we appreciate great customer service, and the service at the Sheraton was exemplary! Also loved their restaurant on site, especially the build-your-own salad menu! Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: scrivendedragons
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Dallas for the Mary Kay National Seminar, and I loved everything about the hotel. The cleanliness and atmosphere of the hotel made our stay one of the best I've experienced while traveling. The staff was exceptionally nice and helpful, treating us like royalty. I lost my cellphone while traveling and was able to use the computers in the tech center off the lobby to easily access my cellular company and my contacts which greatly minimized the negative impact of losing such an important tool in my business. The food in the grill and bar was excellent and the service outstanding (Jose was awesome!). I will gladly return to the Sheraton any time I am in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: srschwager
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived I felt pampered. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It was a pleasure throughout my stay. The hotel is conviently located, close to the Arts district. I would stay at Sheraton Dallas again and would recommend it to anyone I knew that was planning on a visit to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs, Elevators Out”
Reviews.Author: DieHardTraveler
Reviews.Content: I landed in this hotel via priceline and thought it was going to be great since it's a Sheraton. I checked the reviews here and knew about the bedbugs. Knowing that, I requested the center tower since it has the nicest and mostly recently renovated rooms per other reviews and still ran into them. After looking at the sheets when I got into the room and not seeing any, they appeared after I had been sitting on the bed for awhile and I got a bite. I asked for a new room and the staff didn't give me any trouble and gave me a new room . They confirmed they've been having a problem with bedbugs. The staff was very friendly, but they seem overstretched. Several of the elevators were also out of service. This wouldn't be a big deal in a small hotel, but when there are 29 floors, it's an inconvenience!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: birdatman
Reviews.Content: On our last night in Dallas we stayed at this fine hotel. Located in the middle of Downtown. They to gave us an upgrade when we told of our anniversary. We had a wonderful and modern room which had a recent renovation to the North tower where we were. Our upgrade was to the â€œClubâ€� level and had complimentary evening cocktails and breakfast in a private meeting are which is common to the Sheraton Chain. The pool area was small and very nice on an outside deck on an elevated floor. This is where we will come next time we are in Dallas for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Majorly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Teacher3355
Reviews.Content: When we arrived after a long drive, we went up to our room. Noticed that we had a few grasshoppers that liked jumping across the bed. Then we discovered that the television did not work and the air conditioning was not cooling the room. We promptly removed the grasshoppers intl the hall and called the front desk. They were very helpful and sent an engineer right away. He moved some wires, fixed and the tv and then said "well the fan is not on that is why the A/C is not working." He made it seem like OUR fault that we did not know how to work the a/c. He played with the thermostat and left. About fifteen minutes later it was still hot. At this point it was late and we did not want to move our belongings. First thing the next morning, we asked for a new room. The staff was very apologetic and friendly and promptly moved us to another room. We got to that room and things looked good. At about 5pm, the air went out AGAIN! I was very angry. Two rooms and this is still happening! We called an engineer again. The man who came was so friendly. He got a ladder and cllimbed up into the ceiling vent. Apparently, there was a jam in the coil. He fixed it and then it seemed to cool nicely after that. I decided to then take a shower and the water pressure was awful. I am disappointed in my stay and will NOT be returning to this hotel. This was supposed to be a getaway for me full of relaxation. It was not. The ONLY good thing I can say about this hotel is the staff was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: christianandshelbye
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and beautifully decorated hotel - very comfortable and luxurious. The location is great with access to public transportation and a skywalk to several eating places and a few shops. Perfect place for a romantic and/or luxurious get-away to the city! The only draw back in the somewhat confusing layout which mostly only applies if you are attending a conference there.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tds11
Reviews.Content: First class all the way . Every one went above to make a great experience. This was my fifth or sixth time to stay here .My wife an I also come ever november for 3 days for the magarita ball the is the best place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmingly Large, but Comfortable and Reasonbly Priced.”
Reviews.Author: NC1313
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had come into town to see another friend DJ. We booked the hotel last minute and needed to be in the middle of everything. The Sheraton, to our surprise was reasonably priced for such a great location with fantastic comfort. I will say that the parking is a bit obnoxious with a large garage across the street and with the hotel being so huge it made getting our luggage to the room a hassle. The check in was painless and the front desk was kind about a late check out. Our beds were plush and soft and the rooms were very quiet. All in all I would rely on the Sheraton again when visiting Dallas. Side tip - Sushi Zooshi was AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “ELEGANT, CLEAN, AND NOT EXPENSIVE; TOTALLY THE BEST IN DALLAS!!!”
Reviews.Author: HFLORES33
Reviews.Content: Take time to go to the Cathedral Church isRoma's style, Just 2 blocks apart from Hotel And don't forget to visit the Cowboys Texas Stadium many places to visit around Sheraton Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location and service oriented staff.”
Reviews.Author: 55711Mike
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and the staff is very helpful. i've stayed here many times and it's always a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Dallas Stay”
Reviews.Author: deanofslycology
Reviews.Content: Hotel is simply the best. I highly recommend the club level as the chief hostess, Miss Jackie, makes it her business to make a weary traveler welcome and at home. Overall the staff was very attentive, efficient and courteous. The rooms are spacious and well maintained and I enjoyed a great view of Dallas. The in-house restaurants were above average. The location of the property is superb. On a scale of 1-10, I rate this hotel at a 10+. You can do no better when visiting Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but beware of parking fees”
Reviews.Author: flav07
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, although it's so huge that it takes a couple days to figure out how to get to your room (lots of elevator banks, lots of 'wings'). Food in Sports Bar was reasonably priced, staff was friendly. The biggest issue I had was the price of the parking garage - I didn't know how expensive it was until I got there - $21/day for self parking! There are lots nearby off the street, but the staff warned it wouldn't be 'safe'.

Reviews.Title: “More hits than Misses”
Reviews.Author: kshannon7
Reviews.Content: The weekend of 4th of July, me and my friends stayed at the hotel ready for a care-free weekend. There were many good things about this hotel but there were a few misses that they may want to look into. Upon check-in Alexandra (the intern) was extremely welcoming and made our check in process, speedy and pleasant. She gave us information we valued and was a joy to talk to. Our room was very clean, the only thing we would recommend the hotel to do is to put signs on the coffee and water bottles. Every hotel I have been to advertises its coffee and water with a sign or note that reads "enjoy this complimentary coffee" or "Refresh yourself" with a sign on the water bottle revealing a price on it ($4.00). Breakfast at "Kitchen Table", one of few restaurants the hotel has, had a very delicious breakfast. It was a little pricey but the proportions are large and the service was good. Joshua was our server there and although it was early in the morning his happy mood was contagious and he was on his game meeting our every request. The hotel offers a Green choice deal for guest to not have their rooms cleaned each night. We chose not to do that but very soon realized that we would need extra towels. Helen at the front desk was great with arranging extra towels to be placed in our rooms, much appreciated Helen! We chose this hotel simply because of the frozen yogurt bar that we saw on the hotel's website. DuVeena, the employee at Chill Zone, is the shining jewel of the hotel. Since it was the 4th of July weekend the yogurt bar had different hours and we barely made it in before she closed but she was welcoming, quick with service, and offered us many different options even though she was limited. After leaving the frozen yogurt bar we were walking to the room when we noticed a homeless lady wandering around the hotel. The hotel should consider putting security on all entrances and exits of the hotel because it made us very uncomfortable when we watched this lady go around asking the guests for money. Downtown there is already enough people hassling for money when you walk the streets, but inside the hotel the guests shouldn't have to worry about that happening. Once we returned to the room we decided to lounge at the pool for a while, the chairs and beds at the pool are great but beware that people lay their towels out early in the morning to reserve the chairs until they decide to come down later in the day. The pool itself was pretty dirty and it only seemed to worsen over the 4 days we stayed there. We loved how big the hotel was but we were surprised to learn that there was so few restaurants and that their hours close early. We did get to dine at Draft sports lounge during our stay and we were very impressed with the sports lounge. It was a busy night and Laura was our server. She was very sweet but was overwhelmed with the amount of people eating there that night and we could tell.The food was great but the chips and salsa was a huge disappointment. I love all kinds of fresh salsa but this one did not taste like it was fresh made. It tasted and looked exactly like Pace Picante salsa. That was really upsetting to me, if your going to charge $8 for it, then make it worth it. The chips were extremely salty past the point of enjoyment. Check out was a breeze but it was disappointing that parking each night was $21. That is standard pricing for hotels with parking garages but it would have been nice to know that when we booked the hotel so we could have better arranged for it. Overall this hotel was good but it definitely has some areas that could use improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: NiniMississippi
Reviews.Content: I attended a national speech and debate tournament here.
