There were approximately 5000 students, judges, parents, and students at the tournament, many who stayed at this hotel, which was bursting at the seams. The competition used rooms throughout the hotel, on almost every one of the 22 floors and 3 towers. Although mornings were chaotic at the elevators, the staff handled all of the people and needs with amazing finese. I was impressed with how patient and cordial all of the staff was as they dealt with so many high school students. I called about an issue with the bed frame, and maintenance was at my door within an hour. I called about a barking dog( who brings a dog to a hotel and leaves it alone for 6 hours?) and security was on the floor dealing with the poor animal within minutes. There were negatives: no in- room refrigerators or microwaves... unless you rented them. No free wireles... Downtown Dallas is a bit scary. I was uneasy on the mass transit system, even in the daylight. We went as a group of 8 to the Westend for dinner one evening, and a homeless woman snatched the carry-out bag from one of my students saying she needed it more than he did....probably very true, but still a bit unsettling. Although there are many restaurants in the area, their hours understandably vary with the business trade. There are few shops. I would recommend the hotel for efficiency and a downtown business conference, but I would not recommend for a family base. A family would fare better at a hotel near the galleria or other perimeter area.

Reviews.Title: “Happ to see the Green Housekeeping Program”
Reviews.Author: KLMurphy
Reviews.Content: The Green Housekeeping program was very nice to see. Over the course of my week long stay I was able choose to not have the housekeeping staff come to my room to clean, change the linens, etc. Each day that I skipped the houseleeping service I was given a $5 coupon which I used to buy breakfast at Peets coffee shop in the hotel. I was glad to see the wise choice this facility made in helping our environment and giving me the choice of how I wanted to manage the room that I used during my trip. This step gave me greater comfort in my room. Thanks very much

Reviews.Title: “Best Banquet & Event Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: WilsonWaco
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the best banquet and event staffs. The banquet staff are extremely quiet when bringing food in and clearing tables. Not only are they very effecient but are exceptionally gracious and aware of guests needs. The hotel is in a great location close to the light rail as well.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel can't handle a convention”
Reviews.Author: mynameiscat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dallas Sheraton for the National High School Debate tournament. Our reservations were made months prior to our arrival, and we clearly indicated that we were traveling with minors - just like everyone else who was coming for this event, but when we tried to check in at 2pm they had our high school students in a separate tower than the chaperons. I had to stand at the registration desk for over an hour to get that changed, but the rooms weren't ready until 6pm. Their excuse was that they had checked out 2,000 guests the day before. As a convention center, they should be checking in and out large groups on a regular basis. It wasn't like we showed up unannounced; this event had been planned for over a year. They should have enough housekeeping staff on hand to turn over all of those rooms in 24 hours. One of the people traveling with us was a "Star rewards member" and she didn't get into her room until 7pm! It was so poorly handled. When I checked out they tried to get me to sign up for their rewards program and I said I would never stay in another Sheraton as long as I live if I could help it. The beds were cheap, thin mattresses. There was a lot of garbage in the hallways that sat there for days before it was picked up.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed, except for Helen”
Reviews.Author: happysun16
Reviews.Content: I just spent the weekend here with my sister, one of my good friends and her sister. My friend has been Starwood Platinum for many years. She booked our rooms over 3 months ago, and asked her ambassador to make sure that one of the rooms had 2 double beds (as opposed to 1 king bed). We checked in at about 7pm on the first night (a Thursday, the first of 4 nights). We were told by Ana at the front desk, sorry there's 2 rooms, but neither have double beds. Nothing I can do. Understand that it was a very busy weekend at this hotel (they were full apparently), with lots of conventions, but we did not think this was "service." My friend who booked the rooms said politely - will there be another double room free in another tower, any thing free tomorrow? you mean all the people in the double rooms have platinum status too..? is there anything you can do? Answer was (after she checked the computer) - nothing I can do. We almost booked a whole other room, then I suggested (vs Ana suggesting) a roll away bed, so she said, ok we will bring one right up. (which by the way never did happen). After this miserable check in experience, my friend and I then went to the lounge. Our key didn't work. The lady in the lounge said "it's because you only checked in a little white ago..." This has never been an issue in other hotel lounges (other Sheratons, Westins etc etc). We were like, ok, here's the name, no problem. We told her about the issues with check in, and she gave us the name of the hotel night manager (helpful). When we were leaving the lounge, she told us to move a chair back that we'd moved from the table beside us because there weren't enough chairs (surprising). After my friend called her platinum ambassador and complained about the check in experience, about 3-4 hours later, the night manager Roger (or Robert?) got us a room in a different tower with double beds. Appreciated, but hard to believe that this wasn't available somehow without my friend making a bunch of external phone calls to someone in another city. Took forever for the staff to come up with the room key (it was about 11pm + at this time, so really just wanted to get to bed). Room was in the older tower, but this was fine - relatively quiet and comfortable. The one bright spot at this hotel is Helen who works at the Kitchen Table restaurant. She was super friendly, all about service, and couldn't do enough for us. Dallas overall is a great city that is all about service... we didn't let the first crappy day at this hotel ruin our trip. We checked out the original Neiman Marcus - the ladies there were super nice and told us about the history of the store and we had lunch at the Zodiac (which was excellent). We took the Dallas Stadium tour (worth the money), checked out Southforth and went to a Rodeo at the Stockyards. All in all a nice visit and I would definitely come back to Dallas, I would just not stay at this hotel. I'd come back for drinks/dinner to see Helen, but I think I'd try the Joule or something in Ft. Worth.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont want any perks, stay here, nothing is free.”
Reviews.Author: anelson807
Reviews.Content: Check in was efficiant. they charged me 20.00 a night to park there. the elevator to the parking is tiny. parking is very small spaces. they dont give you free internet, you have to pay 18.00 a night to use it in your room. dont drink the water bottles, they will charge you 4.00 per bottle. they dont supply you with a microwave or a frig. the bed is not comfy. all in all the value was bad. they charged me 140 for a room that should have only cost 50.00. booked the room through travelocity and in the add for the sheraton no where does it say that you have to pay for parking and in room internet.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it and will return”
Reviews.Author: ldpf
Reviews.Content: The water was too expensive in the rooms. the service was excellent, the food good a little expensive but good. Sleeping was excellent. No noise heard except when staff claning. Provided refrigerator and microwave at a low cost. I love the chill's area and the young lady in there was wonderful. She had a friendly demeanor and helped me to obtained the food looking for even though it was not served in that area. Very clean in room and hallways. Meeting rooms used were clean and provided mints and water.

Reviews.Title: “Love A-kon, wish it wasn't at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tabitha_D
Reviews.Content: I've been attending A-kon for the past three years and love it. but this was my first year of staying in the Sheraton and I was not at all impressed. I understand that A-kon is a mess and a huge stress on the staff, but even allowing for that my best friend Claire and I were not treated decently. When we first arrived we were very happy with our room; there weren't enough towels for both of us, but we decided that I would take a shower the next day after fresh towels arrived. No real problem at that point. It was on the second day that issues started coming up. Claire always travels with her own pillow and blanket because she has trouble sleeping otherwise. When we arrived back at our room Friday afternoon, we saw that the room had been cleaned. Somehow, this included picking up Claire's blanket with the blankets. On top of that the bed was made without a fitted sheet and there were no fresh towels. Housekeeping did not come back by our room until Sunday night near midnight. Two of the three times that we reported the blanket missing (Friday night and Saturday afternoon) we were sent to several places before finding anyone who could help us at all. The only person who was truly helpful in this situation was the man who worked in the Business Office who took a lost and found report with me. Two and a half weeks later...no sign of the blanket. I am beyond displeased.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, welcoming hotel to a convention for weirdos.”
Reviews.Author: SamuelTaineous
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the country lecturing at anime and gaming conventions so I can say without reservation that the Sheraton Dallas went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable and convenient. With the exception of parking capacity, it was a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “lots of problems”
Reviews.Author: wendycm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two weeks ago for a week during the high school speech and debate tournament. Throughout the week there were lots of issues--the first issue was that we were not able to check in until 8 p.m. From 3 pm on they kept telling us our room ws being worked on and would be ready in 30 min. At six I finally asked why they kept saying 30 more minutes and they told me that was all their computer would let them say--two options--30 more min or not ready at all. In addition, the woman on the phone was crazy rude about it "You people have been calling me all day!" is what she said. I did not raise my voice, was not short with her, but was blown away by the rudeness. Finally, we did get our room and credit for $70 for the inconvenience. The next issue we had was trying to make phone calls using the business center. The woman working there was taking a personal call and loudly announced, "people here so I'm probably going to be here awhile!" There were three of us trying to make some emergency phone calls and use internet on our phones and the woman walked over and turned the television on to so you think you can dance so loud that I could not hear the person on the phone. Clearly, she did not want us in the business center. Sheets on the bed were musty smelling and housekeeping was marginal. Let me also say very clearly that last week I did email and spoke with mgmt and they apologized and said it had been a rough week for them. They sent me a voucher for a free room. I feel like they were trying hard and being more than fair, I'm just not sure I would ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGert
Reviews.Content: I believe in giving credit where it is due, and I really want to give the tip top rating to this hotel. Some may notice this is a second review of this hotel, as I was in it last year in June as well. Things didn't measure up to what I'd expect of a Sheraton at that time, but I really have to give them all the kudos possible on how great things were this year. First, the room was really awesome. Spotlessly clean as always, but also wonderfully cool. Last year they must have been having some sort of air conditioning system trouble, but thankfully that's all been remedied. The room was a bit warm but reasonably comfortable on our arrival, and cooled right down to just the right temperature immediately upon our setting the thermostat. I was told the rooms had been renovated, and I guess they had, because the vent wasn't located in the window sill like our room last year at all. We were able to shut out that hot Texas sun without also closing out the cool air. Like before, the hotel is still making an effort to go green by having the thermostat cut the air when the room is unoccupied, but this time it cooled to a comfy temperature practically just as soon as we touched the thermostat on our return. Second, big kudos on the comfort in the big convention center. Last year several people brought in thermometers and registered higher than acceptable temperatures in the big room downstairs even after midnight. This year was a big improvement. While I wouldn't suggest you wear your woolies, it was always a perfectly acceptable temperature in all parts of the convention center, including the big room downstairs. One of my group was told by an employee the air conditioning system had received a total overhaul due to customer comments since last year, but I can't say if this was the full story. Whatever they did, it definitely worked, and everyone returning from last year did a lot of talking about how awesome it was. I'm posting this because I want to make sure anyone searching reviews on this hotel knows everything is a-ok awesome now, and they should definitely choose this hotel. As always, everything was kept clean and the water stations were kept full at all hours. I made an effort to personally thank any employees I saw working, as I'm sure it was a big job with the big crowd they had for the weekend. I honestly didn't think my comments here after we spent what felt like a weekend in a low oven last year had really registered with the manager who left a reply, and I want to just put out there what an awesome effort must have been made to correct the problem and what a great thing it is to see a big hotel so obviously take a serious criticism to heart. After this stay, you can count on me to always book Sheraton whenever one is available where we travel. I'm so impressed! I'd also like to send special compliments to the chef who made a special effort to make a special order for my friend during Sunday lunch. I know it was an extra effort and would like him to know it was appreciated how he worked things out for a member of our party who just likes plain food and nothing fancy. I always think it takes more skill to make plain food taste like something special, and my friend was really impressed with the quality. Last, I'd like to leave a compliment for the staff who kept the coffee pot by the restaurant filled with hot, fresh coffee every morning and for the lovely waitress who so unobtrusively kept my cup full every morning when we all went in to breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive & Caring Staff Made Our Stay Great!”
Reviews.Author: Vampirate_Kitsune
Reviews.Content: We came to Dallas to attend a huge convention (more than 18,000 attendees). Despite the crowds, the whole staff was always friendly and cheerful. When we needed help with something, the staff responded remarkably fast. When we asked for our car, the valets had it out front in minutes. And the housekeeping staff were outstanding! Everyday our room was thoroughly cleaned and tidied, fresh towels placed in the bathroom, and our coffee supply refreshed. They all worked very hard and very efficiently. I'll be happy to stay at this Sheraton again!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks, Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: SraFlora
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for A-Kon (an anime convention). The hotel was clean and well staffed. Everyone from the valet driver to the desk clerk to the bellman was friendly and willing to help. My room was spacious, had wonderfully comfy beds and a large bathroom, which was kept well stocked with towels & toiletries. While I had a great time at the con, my time there was greatly enhanced by having a nice room in which to shower and collapse as necessary. I recommend the Sheraton Dallas at 400 N Olive St very highly and look forward to my next opportunity to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: Suzy6450
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton in Downtown Dallas. It is a huge hotel however they manage their size well. The personnel at the front desk for both the check-in and check-out process were very pleasant and accomodating. The night I stayed was during a High School Debate tournament so the hotel was full but the staff handled the young travelers well. My room had been recently renovated and looked fabulous. It had a very polished feel which was appreciated by my business traveler side and also by my mother side since my husband and son joined me on this trip. The restaruant menu and service was outstanding. I had a great experience at this hotel and recommend it as a great Dallas option.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing over the top but very comfortable and accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: homebody25
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay in a suite, but rather just a standard guest room. Nothing spectacular but the room was clean and spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel was quiet so I received a restful night of sleep. The fitness center is very nice and the pool area is lovely. I didn't use the pool as my stay did not allow me time to do so, however the pool area is inviting and I would have used it if I had had more time. There is no charge to use the fitness center which is nice. The conference area was wonderful and the staff was helpful and courteous. Our meals were excellent. The conference areas are located away from the hotel rooms and do not interfere with one's stay if there for pleasure. Shopping is nearby as well as other restaurants. Very nice area. They do hit you with internet fees.

Reviews.Title: “Massive yet comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: sr6266
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my son and his team mates for a tournament. Very comfortable and fairly spacious rooms. Would definitely stay here again. Plenty of places to eat nearby, especially Plaza of Americas across the street which is connected to the Sheraton by a covered bridge, thus avoiding the merciless heat of Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: reshanda
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Dallas. Great parking and the best gym I've seen in a hotel and I've stayed at a lot of hotels. Next time I'm in Dallas I will be staying here again. And you can't beat the free internet service in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen items, surcharges, and stairs, Oh my!”
Reviews.Author: OneVeryWearyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I know how quick people are to blame lost items on sticky fingered maids, but when it comes my personal items I am like a hawk. I left a diamond ring on the counter when I went for a swim, came back and was surprised to find the room (somewhat) clean, and my ring nowhere to be found. Needless to say I was treated like chicken little when I tried to get it back, and now I'm sure it's gone for good. I'd hate to point fingers, but the sheraton has had many incidents of theft and now I see why. Wifi was $12.00, valet parking was $21, self parking was $7 and by the end of the trip I spent more money on my hotel than on my vacation! They will nickel and dime you from the start, so be prepared! The elevators were clogged all day with teenagers here for a convention and when I did manage to cram myself into the screeching box of death they made me nauseous and dizzy for hours, I eventually gave up and ended up taking 14 flights of stairs to and from my room just to avoid the chaos of the kids and the macabre amusement park ride that was the elevator system. All in all it wasn't worth the money, I'm missing a diamond ring, and my thighs are burning. Pick a better hotel! DO NOT RECOMMEND!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not all I'd hoped”
Reviews.Author: Vashpapa
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Sheraton Dallas over the Memorial Day weekend was acceptable, but we encountered more annoyances and problems that I would have expected. In the hotel's defense: the property was full to capacity during our stay, which undoubtedly affected the quality of service they could deliver. Pluses: + Clean and attractive common areas. + Clean, comfortable room on 30th floor with pretty view of downtown. + Close (20 minute) walk to Dallas Convention Center and even shorter walk to downtown restaurants. + Staff was generally knowledgeable and helpful -- some very much so. + Zoned elevators worked well and we seldom had to wait for elevator despite the number of people in the hotel. + Hotel pool was popular. Some of the lounge chairs were missing their cushions and the hotel should have provided towels at the pool. The fitness center was well maintained and clean. Deltas: - It took three calls to front desk and an hour of waiting for a bellhop to collect our bags for check out. (Related plus: the guy who eventually showed up to help us was extremely helpful in getting us checked out using automated teller and in helping us quickly get our valet-parked car.) - Ice machine on our floor didn't work for entire stay. When we notified concierge, he said, "Yeah, that's been a problem." We ended up using the machine on the floor below us. - Our mobile phones (using AT&T network) did not work from our room when we checked in, but would work in the lobby. (This problem corrected itself during our second day.) - The amenities in our room seemed to be set up for a single guest when we arrived. It took three calls to the front desk to get suitable towels and toiletries for the two of us. Unfortunately later in the stay we were again down to a single wash cloth, soap, etc. Annoying, but we worked our way around it. - Parking fees and in-room internet fees were quite high. Side note: Dallas Fish Market, within walking distance of hotel on Main St., provided us a really superior dinner one night of our stay. It was a spot-on recommendation from Concierge Richard at the hotel. Bottom line: No major problems at this hotel, but more annoyances than I would've expected from Sheraton. We might stay at Sheraton Dallas again if we need a room in downtown Dallas, but we'll investigate other hotels as well.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster hotel that ruined my life!”
Reviews.Author: NiceGuy1010101
Reviews.Content: I came to the Sheraton Dallas for an academic conference. I was full of anticipation for an excellent week, but then the Sheraton Dallas ruined my life. Instead of checking into a hotel room when I arrived at the hotel, I was greeted by a horde of anime-loving creeps roaming the hotel. I was verbally harassed by the comic book freaks and ignored by the hotel staff. I tried to check in at 11, but my rooms were not ready. I am reasonable so I was willing to wait a little bit for a clean room. It is now almost 6 p.m. and I still do not have a room. Sheraton Dallas is the worst hotel in the world. They have the worst staff, they book conferences they clearly cannot accommodate, and frankly nothing goes right here. If I could choose between this hotel and the firey pits of hell, I would choose the devil lair over this cesspool. I hate this place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - definitely staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: illini5350
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and clean. They offer extra points if you "go green" and don't use housekeeping. The gym is AMAZING and well outside the normal hotel gym standards. I haven't used the pool but its by the gym and looks equally nice. Great sports bar in the lobby for a place to catch a game and a burger. I've stayed there several times. First time had a slow drain, it was fixed quickly. Also another stay had an issue with the television (which by the way is a 42" flat panel in HD!) and it was fixed shortly also. All in all, I really like this hotel! I have a negotiated rate, so the value is exceptional for me. Not sure what normal rates are or how they compare to the market. This place blows away the Marriott next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LeLe127
Reviews.Content: My friends and I enjoyed our stay here while attending a show at the new ATT Performing Arts Center. The downtown location was perfect and easy to find from the major highways. I booked the room on Hotwire at about half-price, and was pleasantly surprised to be treated like a VIP at check-in. We were even upgraded to a very roomy and quiet suite. I loved the Starbucks coffee in the room! Only con was no wi-fi in the rooms. There is a restaurant and sports bar on site that were very nice, and a gift shop/convenience store. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference location.”
Reviews.Author: BrrMotorSports
Reviews.Content: Great catering services for conference! Awesome selection and variety of foods and beverages. Very attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: ddiaddario
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay at the Sheraton Dallas was fantastic. The hotel was nice, the rooms clean and comfortable. I actually had one of the handicap accessable rooms and so it was larger than usual. i found the food in the hotel to be good as well. However being in downtown Dallas there is a large number of resturants close to the propeerty. I would say that the one stellar thing was the fitness facility. it had a large number of cardio machines of various type (probaly a dozen and a half) and a very well equipped weight area, including dumbbells up to about 75 lbs. It wasnt anything like your standard hotel fitness room, it was huge. if you like to work out and want to keep your gym time up, this is the place you need to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs. Bed bugs. Below average service. Bed bugs.”
Reviews.Author: Hamik
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a recent work conference and had a terrible experience. My room was in the renovated North Tower, but I found crumbled and missing bathroom tiles, torn carpet and... worst of all... bed bugs. On the second night of my four night stay, I noticed small red bumps on my arm. The next day I had tons of itchy red bed bug bites on my arms and stomach. Ugggggghhh. I contacted the hotel to notify them and super-washed everything in my suitcase. Housekeeping is obviously lacking - two days out of the four, I didn't receive any washcloths and the bath towels I put on the floor to be replaced were folded and rehung (damp towels were the tip-off). I finally left a note with an extra tip asking for washcloths -- arrived back in the room to find the tip gone and no washcloths. Nice. Beyond the rooms, the food and service are average. The meeting space seemed okay. Downtown Dallas isn't the best location, but at least some nicer parts of town are a quick cab ride away. Leave yourself 30 minutes to go to and from the airport. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. If you stay here, check for bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “loved it will return for next K.Of C convenction”
Reviews.Author: jawAngleton
Reviews.Content: Had very nice time the staff and everyone we encontered was just wonderful. The room was very confortable could not of asked for better service.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff....we will be back”
Reviews.Author: jfergus1
Reviews.Content: The staff was knowledgable and friendly. The room was superb and immaculate. The overall experience was outstanding

Reviews.Title: “My FIRST choice when in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: FNBWF
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is ALWAYS my FIRST choice when I'm working in the downtown Dallas, TX area. ALL of the staff is friendly and accomodating and the rooms are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay. I would recommend this hotel to all of my friends”
Reviews.Author: qballorr
Reviews.Content: The staff was very cordial and helpful. The staff was very courteous. The room wa excellent and comfortable. I cannot think of a single complaint concerning the accomodations or the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Trip Gone Bad”
Reviews.Author: Gr8RRHotels
Reviews.Content: I decided to visit this hotel for the Memorial Day weekend for some R & R. --The air was not working on my floor, and when the maintenance guy arrived on my 3rd night he said they just found out the air had been down for 2 days!! -- No free wifi; parking was $21/night; hard beds --The club lunge was on the other side of the hotel in a separate tower so in order to enjoy the member amenities I'd have to fight through the large crowds downstairs. --The hotel was taken over by a church conference group and the halls, lobby, skybridge, restaurant, front entrance, lounge areas were full of people all the time. Every staff member was overextended and check-in and checkout lines were ridiculous. Not a bell boy to help anyone who was not with the conference. Luggage all over and people standing around....MASS CHAOS for 3 days! It was not relaxing and even when I spoke with the concierge after getting my checked bags she said she felt sorry for me and acknowledge that I probably was not able to get much R&R.

Reviews.Title: “grat value”
Reviews.Author: mrmackay
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel - it has a good location that is close to many tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: R21ORCHID
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this great property. The hotel is located near several historical attractions and other points of interest/entertainment. All staff members I came into contact with from day 1 until it was time for us to checkout greeted us enthusiastically - and proactively offered any assistance with bags, directions, etc. Staff members in the vallet area were cheerful and motivated when offering directions, dinner suggestions, or arranging our taxi service. My family and I occupied 2 rooms in the north tower - both were very clean and well appointed. The beds were SO comfortable and the bathrooms were large and stocked with soft towels and a great makeup/shaving mirror. We had beautiful city views from our windows in both rooms. We stayed during a very busy weekend as there was a Knights of Columbus conference among others booked, however, our rooms were very quiet even as we prepared to checkout. I was very impressed with the lobby and how expansive it is. There is a yummy yogurt shop downstairs, a Peet's coffee, and a well-stocked gift shop among other restaurants/bar areas. I forgot to pack my hair styling items at home and was able to purchase hair mousse, hair gel and a pack of bobby pins easily at the gift shop. As big as this hotel is I was able to take a lengthy personal phone call in the lobby without being distracted by noise or interrupting others. There are various comfortable seating areas in the lobby were one can sit and take a phone call, wait for a guest, etc. and not feel hurried. If I have a complaint it would be a lack of bellman luggage carts/trolleys. I realize it was a busy weekend, however, we were unable to secure one during our stay at both check-in AND check-out. All of the carts were being utilized during the times we needed them and it was inconvenient as we had to carry our luggage through an expansive lobby and up to our room, etc. We hardly saw any during our stay so I if I could make a recommendation it would be to acquire more for such a busy property. Other guests I ran into during my stay also voiced the same opinion. Other than this detail my family and I were very happy during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...Just like I like it...”
Reviews.Author: NashDasher
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent business property. Just excellent. For an urban downtown property, it is easy to find, easy to park and easy to get in and out of. Adequate signage to help you move around and excellent service staff. If you are familiar at all with business travel hotels, you'll love this one. I did not try use any on-site food service so I cannot speak to that. Nor did I use the fitness center. The other shops and amenities, including the business center, were quite adequate. I keep internal records of peferred travel properties. The Sheraton Dallas is now on the list.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: JuliaNOLA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautiful. They accommodated me very well especially considering that I was stuck in Dallas one night since I missed my connecting flight. I also did not have my luggage, so the front desk was able to give me some toiletries and then direct me to their wonderful shop where I was able to get everything I needed, including a clean shirt to wear and a pink cowboy hat. The room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: brendaaguirre
Reviews.Content: I have to say over the years I have stayed in alot of hotels. this BY FAR was the best I have ever been treated. I did not make eye contact with one person who did not smile & greet me in some way. My girlfriend & I had some cosmetic procedures done that day... We had expressed that to the consieere's desk where I had asked where the best place for sushi was.... I was given specific directions, upon arrival a call had been made with reservations for myself & my friend with seating in a private area. Then at the end of dinner we were served a glass of champagne.... How AWESOME....Every one there treated us ALL so well......

Reviews.Title: “Always on point!”
Reviews.Author: jillashley1216
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel- it is in the heart of downtown- its beautiful and clean-- and everyone is always so helpful. There is a disconnect though with their business center- they charge and arm and legs for anything-- example- I got charged over $150 for the business center just to call me and tell me my FedEx packages had arrived-- they didn't even touch them! I went downt here myself and loaded them in my SUV. I talked to the hotel but was informed they are seperate so they couldn't provide any help. Its unfortuante because I would likely look to hosting more meetings and events here if there wasn't that disconnect-- because the space is beautiful- and the actual Sheraton staff is always on point!

Reviews.Title: “SPG Rooms Are New & Updated Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: turbosqrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a high floor SPG room. Vry modern & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay, comfortable rooms and great service”
Reviews.Author: nancydto
Reviews.Content: Three day work stay that incuded anywhere from receptions, meetings and large group sessions. Excellent facilities all around

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- But Unclean”
Reviews.Author: ScubaSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently renovated, and the rooms, while small, are updated with the latest amenities. I was on the 32nd floor and had an incredible view of the city. When I walked into the bathroom, things took a turn for the worse. There was soap in the shower from the previous occupant with a mysterious hair on it. I don't know if the hotel doesn't give the housekeeping staff enough time to clean all the rooms. On my second day, the cleaning was also shoddy. Its unfortunate that a hotel of this quality and recent upgrades can't keep up with the cleaning requirements. Beware of some of the extreme fees this hotel can charge. I attempted to make three phone calls to Houston through the room phone as I had bad cellphone reception in my room. The calls did not go through, but I was charged $9.00 per call for a call with a length of 0:01 on my bill (to be fair, the hotel did remove this charges when I complained). The attached conference center charges $100.00 for several hours of internet (not an exaggeration). The in room wifi is a little more reasonable with a fee of around $15.00/ day. I am a Hilton Diamond member, and this stay, reinforced my alliance with Hilton. While this hotel was nice, the cleaning issues were unacceptable. I have never had a cleaning complaint at a Hilton Brand (including Hamtpon Inns).

Reviews.Title: “Preety nice place”
Reviews.Author: Silrak
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty nice. It has been recently renovated and most of the decor is very modern. The rooms are a normal sized, the bathrooms are nice. Our main negative experience, was that our bed smelled like urine. We asked for a different room and the next day we were given a different room. No urine in this bed. I suspect that the urine bed was a fluke, and that most of the rooms are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for travelers to downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: sunjoe075
Reviews.Content: like the layout fo the hotel; very quite for business travelers; the location is perfect for business meetings in downtown Dallas

Reviews.Title: “A happy class reunion”
Reviews.Author: DrLiz65
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. We chose it for our mini-reunion because it is close to the home of a disabled classmate. As before the beds were divine; the concierge service superior; the food delicious; the central location great for sorties around Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Odd Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaTraveler
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the odder hotels I have stayed at.Parking is across the street in a convention center hotel. For $19 a day, you get to wheel your bags into an unlit elevator room, and then figure out how to get to the hotel. I walked thru an ongoing convention. If you find the bridge to the hotel, good luck finding the lobby. What appeared as a front desk must have been a bell desk, as I was directed down another hallway. Once I checked in, I had to pass 3-4 sets of elevators, with different towers. I finaly got to my room, as I passed several executive suites, none of which I was offered, despite being Starwood Platinum. The room was ok. There was a used towel on the sink, but otherwise clean. When I asked where the club floor was, it was in another tower! The staff was friendly, price reasonable, but just not worth all the shuffling around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: poncho525
Reviews.Content: No trouble at all. The parking garage payment is a little un-conventional and the parking is probably over-priced (I think it wa $19 per 24hrs). But it was quite, clean and professional. The fitness center was really nice and included wiht the room. That is a must for me. I would go back just becuase of the free clean huge modern exercise facilities open 24/7 where you can grab a sweat between meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Dallas Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: brandonejeon
Reviews.Content: Check- in was easy and fast. I stayed on 25th floor (Preferred Guest rooms) North Tower 5 for five day government conference. During my stay, I had to rekey the room key twice (security guard was rude at first but after a short talk he came around), noise from the elevator can be heard from the room all day all night, pillows were too soft for me, concierge lady (no greetings or a smile she was very dry when I asked for information on restaurants in surrounding area) and gift shop ladies were very unfriendly and unprofessional (they were too busy complaining about their coworkers while I and four other customers were in line to pay), quality of the food was not in par with the cost but service was excellent. I would opt to stay in Hilton or Marriot in surrounding area not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for Dallas business trip”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: A solid hotel for frequent travelers (and vacationers) to Dallas; Nice location; Staff was great - friendly -- I used hotel car service on a few occasions. Happy workers = happy guests

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but....”
Reviews.Author: cjderby
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean rooms, slept great, good location, friendly staff. Which I suppose are the things that matter most. But for the price, one would think you could have free in-room internet ($15/day). Or a mini-frig. And the elevators! Too many times over a 3 night stay that car after car after car after car were packed heading to the lobby. A couple times, after extremely looong waits, we finally caught an UP elevator just to get on one and took the round trip to the lobby. This was common among our crowd. These elevator issues happened way too often to be written off as a fluke occurrence.

Reviews.Title: “Great service... every employee made the experience super positive, you just don't see that everywhere."”
Reviews.Author: hankrichardson
Reviews.Content: Excellent facilities, spacious rooms--- but beyond the normal things one looks for it was that every staff member was so helpful, and not just help but friendly in their valuing the support and that from asking directions, to those that cleaned the rooms, or the front desk person addressing internet services issues, to room service, to the person that brings you the room service, to the restaurant, to the bell capt. getting your transporation arranged, to the guy ck.ing your brief case so you can hurry to another meeting. I'm picky and tough to please and these folks did a superlative job and a kudo to the hotel staff's amazing attitude. I would highly recommend anyone heading to Dallas to book a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super Experience”
Reviews.Author: txgrrl68
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline and bid $60 on a downtown hotel room. This hotel accepted my offer, and I was happy with it. I valet parked for $21, so with taxes and everything I ended up with a $189 hotel room for less than $100. I read several reviews from people who bid on their room and were not happy with the customer service at the hotel - even stating that they were told they weren't "the same" as full paying guests. I was a bit worried, but had no need to be! When I checked in, I gave the young lady my name and she replied "we have you in a junior suite tonight". I said "OK!". I was on the 9th floor with a view of Fair Park. The room was huge - with a couch, two chairs, a writing desk, big flatscreen tv and king bed. The bathroom was big with a seperate tub and shower. The decor was really neutral, and a bit old, but the bed was fantastic! All the employees were very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “No guarantee they will have a room for you - otherwise nice, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: beckychan14
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire to stay here during a convention taking place downtown in the convention center. We were walked to the Westin Park Central for the first three nights (along with six other people we personally know - they said seventy total were walked), which is 10 miles away from the Sheraton and an hour trip from downtown via public transportation, half hour by taxi - and they refused to reimburse us for travel costs (although they did refund the costs for one night's stay). We were told initially that we could return to the Sheraton for the final three nights when they did have room, but they canceled our reservation without authorization from us (they blamed Hotwire), and then claimed that only the Director of Revenue could address our issue. Even though she was informed (by email) on Saturday of our request, and we followed up with a call on Monday when she was supposed to be in the office, she did not return our call until Tuesday morning (by which time we had been to the hotel to try to resolve the issue to no end). If she had called twenty minutes later, we would have had to make an extra trip back to the Westin to get our luggage. All in all, they seemed to have little respect for our time and money, possibly because we booked through Hotwire. I should say that the hotel itself is nice enough, although overpriced. So if you're lucky, everything will be fine, but if you're unlucky, staying here could prove to be a giant hassle.

Reviews.Title: “I wish it was better”
Reviews.Author: HOSKI
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights for a conference for work. I wish I could say it was a great stay because I did sleep really well here and I usually have trouble sleeping when traveling but I just can't say it was good. I got in about 9:30 pm and check in was very quick. They asked if I parked a car and I told them no and they asked if I want to sign up for the green program. I said no and asked if I could change my mind later. She asked if a king was ok and since I was alone that was just fine. Off I went to room 1215 in the South Tower. Donâ€™t stay in this tower. People in the other two towers liked their rooms; the people in this tower hated them. The room was tiny. It looked ok except the ugly mustard yellow paint. I will admit I didnâ€™t check it well because I was hungry and tired. I went to eat in the restaurant off the lobby and it was pretty good. I then returned to my room and decided to start unpacking. Where to start? The drawer space is limited and the drawers are small so you really canâ€™t put folded jeans in them. I opted not to use them. The closet wasnâ€™t that big either but everything fit. Here is where I started to see that the room wasnâ€™t as nice as first glance. There was only 1 door instead of 2 for the closet. The one door was a big glass door that wasnâ€™t in the track but leaning up against the frame from the inside. I couldnâ€™t get it back on the track. While trying to do so I looked at the track on the floor and it was completely filled with dirt and crumbs. Yuck, yuck, yuck Ok, so I canâ€™t shut the closet, I would at least shut the safe door that was hanging out of the closet. Wrong, the safe didnâ€™t work and wouldnâ€™t stay closed. I used a folded up napkin to wedge it shut for my stay. I checked the bed for bedbugs and didnâ€™t see any. The bed ended up being the best part of the room. There was no dirt or hairs on the sheets or pillows so Iâ€™m assuming they were changed. That and the fact that they had a lot of TV channels including my favorites. The garbage cans still had garbage from the previous occupant in them. And to jump ahead to the next morning, Iâ€™m thinking housekeeping only changed the bed and did the floors. When I checked in there was only one towel and two hand towels in the bathroom. The one hand towel was folded strangely but the other set looked good so I figured Iâ€™d use that and get everything fresh in the morning. Well in the a.m. after my shower I grabbed the one towel that was there and that I assumed was clean. When I opened it, it was dirty. I squeaked, dropped it and used hand towels. Ok, it will get better because housekeeping will come and take care of everything. Wrong, I had a $5 voucher under my door and no one came to do my room. I called and asked for towels and decaf coffee. They asked if I signed up for the green program and I told them no and that I needed towels and decaf coffee because the one towel in the room was dirty before I got there. Housekeeping brought a stack of towel & washcloths along with 1 decaf coffee and a hand full of regular. I couldnâ€™t get my room serviced all week but eventually did get coffee from room service. This Sheraton has no idea on how to do a green program. It is a great concept but they are using it to not pay housekeepers and to not put supplies in the room. There are basic needs that still need provided even if a guest selects the green option. Oh, letâ€™s say toilet paper and hereâ€™s a stretch, more than 2 packets of coffee in 5 nights. Sorry this ticks me off because I like to go green but I have when someone uses it as a marketing ploy and really isnâ€™t being green. One way they could go green is to turn down the air conditioning in the meeting rooms so that people donâ€™t have to wear winter coats to meeting. Even the guys went for jackets and the speakers joked they had never been so cold when in from of an audience. The room was a mix of old and new. They left some really old fixtures and then added really nice counters and a few other items. $4.50 for a bottle of cheap water? Really? The bathroom ceilings are mildewing because there is no fan in the bathroom. When you look up it seems like there is one because there is a grate but look closely and the grate is covered and sealed with metal behind it. If I would have stayed in a room near the ice machine I couldnâ€™t have stayed their. I have a mold allergy and since the ice machine leaked for 3 days and soaked the carpet that part of the hall smelled so bad from mold and mildew that I could hardly breathe when I went for ice. The smell just got stronger as you went down the hall. The staff overall was nice. No one went out of their way except the valets out front. When I checked out it was quick and friendly. Then I looked at the bill and discovered I had been charged for parking each night. I couldnâ€™t see the same person again because she was helping the next person in line. When I went to someone else and told them I was charged for parking she asked if I had a car. She took it off the bill and handed me a new one. I havenâ€™t gotten my credit card statement yet to make sure it is correct. Overall, I would not stay here again and would not recommend it. There is so much more I could go into but this is way too long.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite business hotel in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: spgplat2
Reviews.Content: Ever since this place was renovated I have really enjoyed staying here. At first it can be overwhelming because the place is so huge, but after a couple stays it's very easy to get in and out of and you can self park right below the elevators to the main towers. As a starwood platinum I have always been upgraded to an executive suite which is a very large two room suite with a small dining table living area and a large bedroom. The restaurant downstairs was really good and there are also several places within walking distance for breakfast or lunch. The gym at this place is also newly renovated and one of the best hotel gyms I've seen. They have lots of machines, plenty of treadmills, and a large free weights section. There's an outdoor pool connected to the gym that is kind of small, but they added some comfortable seating around the pool which makes it a nice place to relax when it's nice out. I would have liked to see a larger offering at the club, but otherwise another excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “I could not have hoped for a better place to spend on a business trip.”
Reviews.Author: phall86
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, though quite large, very easy to understand. The people working were so wonderful and helpful. I really appreciate all the help I got from everyone at the hotel. And the icing on the cake was the private karaoke rooms!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay if you must”
Reviews.Author: RSorge
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a convention -- although the rate was no doubt discounted, the value is poor. I stayed on the 32nd [top] floor and could hear (too well) the elevator motors on the roof. The restaurant was able to produce an espresso but they have not yet invested in appropriate cups. I ordered a beer from the menu but they were out of it. And they charge a ridiculous $2.00 for a toll-free call. If your convention takes place in the hotel then maybe that's a reason to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Nobody0009
Reviews.Content: I stay at this property mainly because it is within walking distances near one of my company's offices. That being said, it is clean, and has all the amenities a business traveler needs --- gym, sundry shop, restaurant/bar, business center, etc. Also easy access to McKinney Ave hotspots. Of particular note, the gym has plenty of treadmills, so waiting around for one is not usually a problem in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business location.”
Reviews.Author: tnjerry
Reviews.Content: This hotel was almost perfect for a large convention. The meeting rooms were spacious and comfortable, easily reached, and everything needed for our convention could be held within hotel's ample meeting area. The room I stayed in was reasonably priced, had great sleeping beds, had adequate internet and business desk, and was clean. The bathroom was ok; nothing fancy, but very adequate. The main restaurant had a good selection of food, comparably priced for location, and the service everywhere was friendly and good. I have stayed in fancier places that cost more, but for our meeting, it was all we could ask for. Very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: AndreasMam
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 4 nights, its quite good for business stay. Very Friendly Staff

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here if you have a choice”
Reviews.Author: somehappycampers
Reviews.Content: Its midnight and my walls are shaking from a quincinera party they have booked on 38 th floor. Also a party in a nearby room with pot smoke. Ive called security 4 times. They say these parties go til 2 am sometimes. Ive had to relocate occupants from one of our 6 rooms and was told by bellman they get lots of partiers every weekend. Im going to write tremaine and write reviews to not book your conventions here if you want to be with decent classy people. I have been trying to sleep for 3 hours now as i have to get up at six. Was told by the bellman that people pay a lot of money to party in those suites. Guess their convention biz isnt as lucrative as their pot smoking and quincinera clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but...........”
Reviews.Author: Sean1960_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pre-booked for me, so I didn't have a choice. The hotel is fine, though a bit too impersonal. It's a large hotel. Rooms are great but you have to wait an age for the lifts if the hotel is busy. Parking is fine and the self parking entrance is on the opposite side to the main entrance. $9 cheaper if you don't valet park. The only thing that did annoy me was the charge for in room wi-fi. If the Marriott and other hotel chains can offer it for free, then why not the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent accommodations, wonderful atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: antonyandersen
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here for almost a month on business, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff were attentive, always friendly and accessible. They made me feel like I was at home; Janelle in Housekeeping, Dan the bartender, and Jenn the server in Draft were so nice and always eager to please. The Convention Services Manager Paul Ruby was a class act all the way. The location of the hotel was ideal, in that it offered access to a number of attractions near by(Dallas Art Museum, convention Center, American Airlines Arena, etc. First rate experience with a first rate staff.

Reviews.Title: “Too good to be this bad”
Reviews.Author: holly049
Reviews.Content: This hotel has too many good things going for it to be this bad: Clean rooms, fantastic gym, proximity to convention space and a very good lobby set-up for the business set. Made it all the more otherworldly when elevators that stopped working Thursday weren't fixed by Sunday; when false fire alarms go off at all hours, including 2 and 4 in the morning; when the concierge sends you to restaurants that are closed, or recommends places that aren't, frankly, that good; when you spend 10 minutes begging someone to let you out of the garage because your room key won't work; when they charge a criminal $15.95 for internet service on top of a $235 nightly rate; and so on, and so on. In a word: Overmatched. At least when the big show comes to town, a la the Super bowl.

Reviews.Title: “This is my favorite hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: cruisinsusan99
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel over a year ago and have visited at least another 7 or 8 times since on business. While I normally stay at Hilton properties I was recommended to stay here due to the proximity of where I was going to attend meetings. Now all I can say is that I look forward to each and every trip. The hotel had a huge renovation and is just gorgeous. The staff could not be more helpful. The rooms and amenities are wonderful. The fitness center is first rate. The DART train runs right outside so it is easy to take a train to any location you desire. If you have Concierge lounge access be sure to visit Jackie who runs the lounge on the 28th floor. She's wonderful and her positive attitude helped me start off many early morning in a much happier mood. The restaurant and lounge are great. Room services has always been top notch! Prices are typical of better hotels and they offer dinner buffets throughout the week for approx $20 which is not bad at all compared to local restaurants, etc. One of their features is a program where you can help save energy by foregoing room service for which you will get either 500 SPG points or a $5 voucher. I actually like this option a lot since I travel alone so for a 2-3 night stay have more than enough towels, etc. Bottom line, I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Front-line staff great but???”
Reviews.Author: gmanatee
Reviews.Content: Nice, huge complex. Front-line staff is great, stuffy management staff (bit of an edge, poor customer service) seemed to be more focus on the NFL group coming in for Super Bowl then us guest in the hotel now. hummmmmm great rooms, hot water......12 floor ice machine then up to the 14th ice machine out of service. Tip to upper ego staff. Chill!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & conference area”
Reviews.Author: MollyOrlando_Florida
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with a large conference for work. We were a very large group and they did a great job of handling everything at the hotel & in the conference area. The hotel rooms are very clean and the conference area was very nice. The staff was all very friendly. There is a nice large business center where you can print your boarding pass. There is internet service, but you have to pay for wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel with no security-felt unsafe.”
Reviews.Author: Fencingmomx2
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just too large for my comfort. I did not see any security or cameras in the hotel or especially in the parking garage which is easily accesible to anyone from the street. The staff is very friendly and professional especially the front desk. Which I had to visit several times as my hotel key refused to work 3 straight days. Very frustrating. No maid service for 1 day which left us with no clean towels or toilet paper. Really unacceptable. The room with very spacious and the beds very comfortable. It's pet friendly. Easy access to DART light rail although I didn't use it as I rented a car. Parking is $10 daily. No free Wi-FI in the rooms, but it is in the business center. My family and I stayed for 4 days at this hotel for a sporting competition and we will be returning to Dallas next month. I will be making reservations at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jon160
Reviews.Content: It takes a lot to make a big hotel feel individual. I was part of a group of dealers who stayed at the Sheraton in January. Our trade show was several miles away, at the Trade Mart. One morning, I saw a dealer who seemed lost, and couldn't find the shuttle. A staff member of the hotel walked the dealer to the door, and made sure they got on the right shuttle bus. It was none of the "it's over there" syndrome. That episode, won me over.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Spencer1230
Reviews.Content: Always pleasant from the moment you walk in to the very last day. My only issue on this particular stay was some confusion about when the brunch bar stopped. At noon on Saturday we were told that it had just stopped at 12. On Sunday we went in at 11 and were told that is was done today at 11. They seemed to be a little confused themselves on whether they were serving lunch or breakfast. Although the brunch bar was closed on Sunday, they did allow us to order from the brunch menu. One other small issue didn't really have to do with the hotel as much as Dallas in general. We told a few people that we were planning to go to Reunion Tower for a drink at Wolfgang Puck's restaurant. It was a Sunday and no one we spoke to mentioned that A. the observation deck is under construction "until further notice." B. Wolfgang's Five Sixty restaurant is closed on Sundays. None of this was mentioned by anyone we spoke to including the hotel driver who gladly dropped us off with his $20 fare. Again, I don't blame this on the hotel as much as Dallas itself, don't get me wrong, Dallas is a nice town, it is just so spread apart that people don't even know what happens on the other side of town unless they have a specific reason to know it. Hmmm, I guess I do have a bit of a problem with the concierge and driver who should have known. Oh well, still had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay when you are in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: craigb555
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, centrally located with great rooms and an attentive staff. A very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: damuellers
Reviews.Content: My son and I came to the Sheraton as part of the Snowball Express. The Sheraton donated rooms for all the families as well as the volunteers. The staff at the hotel was absolutely amazing and I could never thank them enough. The room was beautiful and spotless. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeSaltLakeCity
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to hold and attend a large conference. The touch screen computers throughout the Hotel were great to find places to eat and explore while I was visiting Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay on my next trip to Dallas”
Reviews.Author: spauldin1
Reviews.Content: hotel and staff are marvelous! I loved the view of the park and downtown from my room.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Arob2010
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great -Starbucks coffee in your room everymorning -Good water pressure from the shower -A comfy white robe to wear in the room -Comfortable beds Location -Walking distance to trolley... or the West End (lots of nice resturants for evenings out) -The Plaza is connected to the hotel so you can have access to several lunch or breakfast places -The North Park Mall is a $20 cab ride away or you can take the Trolley for $1.75 one way. Overall a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: minesaysBADMFonit
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks like a very nice hotel. Look closely and you'll find that the toilets in the rooms are as loud as jet engines. The bathroom wallpaper was hung by a 6 year old and overall the entire staff as been conditioned to be uncaring and indifferent. While there, we had our room charges screwed up and charged to another room. We had TERRIBLE service at their Sports Bar "Draft". I won't expand upon this because my disappointment deserves its own space!!! To print boarding passes in their "Sheraton Link" is tedious and time consuming. The best advice I can give for this hotel is stay only if it is a screaming deal. If this hotel is NOT at least $20/night cheaper than you next choice, TAKE YOUR NEXT CHOICE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great experience at this Landmark Dallas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mortgagemaster
Reviews.Content: The recent upgrades to the Sheraton Dallas have made it a truly great place to stay. The new room decor as well as the stunning lobby and restaurant areas have stepped this hotel experience up a few notches. Most importantly, the beds are the most comfortable of any hotel in which we have stayed. When business or pleasure takes you to the downtown area, This is the hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are great!! Nothing better than feeling comfortable & at home.”
Reviews.Author: seeyaskiray_10
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with the overall experience. There was a huge event going on. The Dallas Margarita Ball... I heard there was an estimated 12,000 people in attendance. With all of that going on I was still able get around and have a great stay. I really like the upgrades in the rooms and the quality of the room was great for the money. The location was good for grabbing a cab and getting around town. Mckinney Ave was a great strip to hang out on.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: scratchba
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Dallas is my favorite place to stay in Dallas. It is always well-maintained, and the staff is exceptional. Employees bend over backward to meet your needs. My room is always what I have asked for and requests like early check-in have always been granted. The location is perfect if you need to be in the downtown area with quick and easy access to 75 Central Expressway, I-35, and I-45. From my experience, they also do a fantastic job holding major events.

Reviews.Title: “The fitness center is worth it”
Reviews.Author: Sue2314
Reviews.Content: Of course it is very large (after all, this is Texas) with the service, cleanliness, and comfort you would expect of a high end hotel. The fitness center is far better than anything I have seen in properties of this kind. It is large and spacious with most of the free weights, circuit training machines, and cardio equipiment you would want. Yes, there are a few other things I would add but it certainly met my needs for a 3 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is so conviently located, well-maintained, and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: kdfitz
Reviews.Content: Front desk service - outstanding Club Room Hostess (and assoc. Host) - both amazing...they made our stay absolutely wonderful!! Concierge - knowledgable and extremely helpful Location is amazing Room met all our needs; however, thermostat didn't work for first two days Conference facilities are really nice; as are the laptop connections, outlets,etc. On-site Sports Bar was so convenient; however, service was really bad On-site Restaurant also really convenient; however (again), service not too great Liked the least...not nearly enough elevators - this is a conference-hosting hotel, but it is not set up to get conference go-ers, in mass, up to their rooms in the early evening...we waited over 30 minutes in line for an elevator...that was absolutely terrible and frustrating

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Dallas when Traveling Alone”
Reviews.Author: patricia_g_boardman
Reviews.Content: I often travel alone, and really appreciate accomodations that provide all the things I need and a good feeling of security. The accomodations for our event were excellent, and my room was freshly remodeled. The dining was great, as well as the room service. There were many local sites and resteraunts within walking distance, and I was able to catch the train just a few steps from the hotel to go the Mall! Thanks again for a great visit!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't board my dog here...”
Reviews.Author: CSHouston80
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a stay at the Sheraton Downtown Dallas location on Olive Avenue. I was utterly disgusted with my visit, both in the quality of the accommodations and the level of service at this facility. I've attached photos of the bathroom, which seemed to be in a serious state of disrepair, and of the towels that were placed in our bathroom for our use - which I quite honestly wouldn't have used at home for our family dog. There were also other issues, no remote for the TV, unresponsive hotel staff (took over 45 minutes to receive replacement towels and only after 3 calls), intoxicated guests who had a screaming match in the hall at 3:30am, etc. It so happened that the same weekend we stayed at the hotel, the Dallas Margarita Ball was also being held. After checking in to the hotel (around 1pm) and then leaving to visit some friends, we returned to the hotel (at 6pm) where we were told that parking, both valet and self, were full, due to the event being held at the hotel. Even being a paid guest in the hotel, we were made to park almost 6 blocks away and pay $20. When I complained to Leonard, the manager on duty, I was informed that there were 11,000 people coming to the hotel that night and "that's just the way it works". I quite honestly find it hard to believe that any business would treat a paying guest this way and still maintain their customers. I've always enjoyed staying at Sheraton properties, but this recent stay has left me wondering if I'll ever return.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, understood why they say everything is big in US”
Reviews.Author: Kayomarz
Reviews.Content: I am staying here currently and I must say its one of the biggest rooms I have stayed in. It must be a big task cleaning this room but the job is really well done. The breakfast is pretty neat though I would like if they add some variety by changing a few items everyday. It is very centrally located and close to quite a few restaurants. The view from the room is of the freeway and looks pretty nice as you can see a long distance from the higher floors. Staff are very welcoming and always ready to greet you. Another good feature I noticed is they also have an automatic machine for checkin and checkout and the same machine also allows you to get your boarding pass. Have always been satisfied with my stays at Sheraton and glad this one also didnt disappoint me, i would say it just gets better and better with each stay.

Reviews.Title: “I wasn't too impressed.”
Reviews.Author: mrsisaak
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to see so many positive reviews about this hotel. That really wasn't my experience. First off, when trying to check in, there were 3 workers arguing with another customer such that there was no one available to check me in. I was called up to the desk, but was ignored when the person who was dealing with me returned to argue with the customer some more. Not a good first impression. The room was very dark and there wasn't an overhead light, so difficult to find the switch to the lamp near the bed. They have a program where you can forgo room cleaning by placing a sign outside your door. I did not place the sign but, sure enough, there was one outside my door the next morning! (I was on the 18th floor and the sign was from the 34th so it seemed pretty obvious it wasn't "mine".) So the room didn't get cleaned for the length of my stay. Not a huge deal but can't the bed just be made WITHOUT changing the sheets so it still seems "fresh"? I wasn't near the elevators but there was some rattling heard overnight - never did figure out the source of the noise. The bar was very noisy and crowded but the servers did an amazing job getting to everyone. Overall the hotel was OK in that it was a work trip but I would choose to stay somewhere else if it were a personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for a convention”
Reviews.Author: jhall290
Reviews.Content: My family and I travel frequently, so I am no stranger to hotels, especially in the city. I am from Chicago and I was visiting my stepbrother and some friends and attending a convention that was held in the hotel. The room itself was decent. I didn't have the greatest view (almost entirely a brick wall), but I wasn't there for the scenery so it wasn't a big deal to me. I enjoyed using the coffee pot, which came with small samples of Starbucks coffee. The hotel was extremely congested because of the convention, and pretty much every escalator was not working for the 2 days/nights that I was there, which I found to be extremely inconvenient. Trying to get on an elevator was a joke - I had to wait at least 10 minutes to catch an elevator up to my room. I wouldn't have minded as much if it wasn't being run by incompetent convention staff - I would have much preferred to have the hotel staff keeping an eye on the elevator lines and making sure things ran smoothly. I didn't get a chance to eat in the hotel's restaurant (I ended up eating my meals at the adjoining Plaza of the Americas because it was quicker and cheaper), but I was able to eat at the yogurt shop located on the ground level of the hotel, which was delicious. I wanted to go to their coffee shop, but after looking at the menu and seeing their hefty prices, I walked right out (hence why I used the coffee pot in my room). Despite how crowded the hotel was because of the conference, I was easily able to get help from the front desk when I needed more copies of my room key, and the check-in/check-out went extremely smoothly. I did an express check-out on a computer in the lobby, which I liked instead of having to wait in a long line with everyone else. I also requested more towels for my room as I left for the day, and they were waiting for us in the bathroom when we returned after a few hours. Also, I didn't take advantage of this personally, but other convention-goers told me that the hotel staff was willing to hold onto their luggage for a few hours even after they checked out so that they could attend the rest of the convention and then head straight to the airport. Overall, I was satisfied with my stay. I wasn't really looking for anything too luxurious or mind-blowing, so the Sheraton exceeded my expectations on that level.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with bargin prices”
Reviews.Author: mmdeschepper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for a business conference, we we close to everything and they were very friendly. We had a horrible time checking in....they repeatedly messed up and the clerk was obviously annoyed. The rooms were nice, and we got a good price so we cant complain to much. If you have an extra hour to check in and out, then by all means stay at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: fallowdeer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very accommodating. The hotel staff was very friendly and went out of their way to help guests with special requests. The confernce rooms were great and the food was excellant. The food in the restraunts was great as well. Very close to to the Dart System. The staff was helpful with directions to shopping and dinning. It was a great conference and a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: frog1962
Reviews.Content: Facilities were excellent for a national conference. The staff members were very attentive to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and attantion to the little things”
Reviews.Author: Tony4432
Reviews.Content: Staff was attentive and really payed attention to the little things, like asking if i need a hand or just asking how i was today and if there was anything they could do. Front desk was quick and helped me with a room change with no hassel or begruging attitude. These are the reason I stay at Sheratons and Starwood properties. They have consistant and excellent customer service policies and are always willing to go the extra mile for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views of downtown Dallas skyline”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy402
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with fantastic views of downtown. Close to everything in downtown Dallas and easy access to skylink. Suites are well laid out with plenty of room and comfortable beds and large HD flat screen tvs. Concierge was great help with area restaurants and even providing coupons for restaurants. Very large fitness center with great selection of equipment. Overall a 5 star hotel with 5 star service. I would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Dallas Hotel - Awesome Choice”
Reviews.Author: Barrietravelonly
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an incentive trip to Dallas where we were fortunate enough to call this Hotel "home". Home is an apt description as the fantastic team did everything within (and beyond) their control to see that our entire group of over 41 had a great trip with many lasting memories. While a hotel is often just a place to lay your head, this hotel offers first class facilites, is within blocks of many top restaurants and attractions, conveniently located on the cities major transit routes for easy inexpensive access to much of the Dallas area. I would not hesitate to call upon this hotel on my next trip, business or pleasure to the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: YAYOTHEJETSETTER
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty busy upon my arrival, but everyone I dealt with treated me like I was the only guest there. The check-in desk personnel were very courteous, and took the time to answer all of my questions. I was very please with the accommodations, the suite I booked was larger than expected, and the floor was very quiet. I would definitely recommended that anyone traveling to Dallas consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Dallas - Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: imtw1951
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure, the staff were always friendly and very helpful. The room was well appointed and very comfortable after a long day at the convention center. Location was perfect - easy access to restaurants and clubs. The computer/internet lounge is such a great idea! I used it several times.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in downtown dallas”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior123332
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for several weeks for business (training class). Excellent location, near the DART system, close to Uptown, great area with restaurants and shops. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Nice pool area and large gym with plenty of equipment available for use. Would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Clean Room, Very Nice Hotel - Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rosenberglaw
Reviews.Content: Clean Comfortable Room with Modern Amenities. Very Professional Staff. Loved the Club Lounge Service. Wifi service was stable. Would stay again...

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: 19kegger74
Reviews.Content: I use the Dallas Sheraton for all my business trips to Dallas. The rooms are very comfortable with nice amenities. The staff is always friendly and will go to any length to make sure everything is right. The beds are very comfortable and the room levels are very quiet allowing for a good nights sleep. The Dallas Sheraton is one of my corporations preferred hotels. There is always plenty to do in the area and lots of good restaurants (including the ones at the hotel itself). It all makes for a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Dallas is the place to stay when in Texas.”
Reviews.Author: CLEtreetopflyer
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Dallas is a beautiful hotel with all of the necessitiesneeded for an excellent meeting experience. The hotel has excellent meeting space, nice comfortable sleeping rooms and suites. The staff there is very polite and attentive. The GM Ray Hammer is always cruising around making sure everything is going smoothly. The sales team, including Matt Sciarrino, are very nice to work with and very knowledgable about their product and services.
