I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone doing business or pleasure in the Dallas/Ft. Worth area. Dan Lough - CMP from UTU in Cleveland, OH

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown location”
Reviews.Author: barfly40
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location and a great value. Traveled on business and had a 2 room suite for great money. Close to the West end, good place to walk around and convenient highway access. Would definitely return to stay when I am in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice rooms, and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: willyag
Reviews.Content: I'm french, visiting Dallas, i stayed at the Sheraton on 2 differents rooms, the first one was big on central tower, the second one was small, but ok on the south tower. I had a perfect stay, the hotel is wonderfull, great service (except for the concierge who told me there is no bus or public transportation for Dallas love field airport, after spending 30$ for a cab, i founded that there is a bus for only 1.75$ !!! ) but my stay was delicious, the swiming pool is a great spot to hang out, even at night ! the gay bars of Dallas are only a short taxi drive (around 8$), perfect location downtown.wifi is free @ the lobby, but not in the room (13-18$ a day !) Be carefull of international calls from the room, i paid 33.50$ for a 2 mn call to France !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: therogerAustin_Tx
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night. I had read some poor reviews from people who booked off of Priceline (or similar) so I was somewhat apprehensive going in. However, we did not have any issues. There is a parking lot across the street from the back of the hotel (we could just see our car from the hotel window) and it cost $5 for 24 hours of parking. The hotel is large and the lobby is very nice. We were very near the elevator and did hear an occasional "ding" but it was not loud enough to wake up my light-sleeping wife. The only thing I could find to complain about was that the furniture and fixtures are a mix of old and new. For example, the bathroom was re-done with new tile but it has the old fixtures and toilet. The desk is adequate but it obviously old. The bed was fine. We did have to wait about 5 minutes to check in but they had 3 people working the desk at 9pm and they were getting through the line pretty quickly. The hotel is right next to the train so we were able to get to the State Fair grounds in about 5 or 10 minutes. Overall--a posive experience.

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL BASE TO EXPLORE DOWNTOWN DALLAS”
Reviews.Author: GLOBETROTTERS170
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Sheratons before in Canada & Malaysia . Got a competitive weekend rate to include buffet breakfast in one of their junior executive suites.Room on 5th floor in North tower was huge & newly renovated with very comfortable beds. City view included. Slept well as a very quiet floor ,despite loud young sports fans staying in other parts of the hotel this weekend. Buffet breakfast would have been excellent value even if paying $17 incl tax. Full range of cooked fare along with cereals, porridge, fruit ( including what seemed to be fresh raspberries & blackberries.. .very tasty !) & pasteries etc etc. Staff here as in rest of the hotel were very friendly & efficient. Location of hotel is convenient for walking to Dealy Plaza & 6th floor museum etc & strolling along Elm /Main /Houston/ Commerce streets was interesting in itself to retrace events of November 1963. Super Shuttle will take you directly to & from DFW airport for $17 each way & stops at hotel's entrance. Would definitely recommend the Sheraton Dallas as a comfortable & welcoming hotel well situated for tourists visiting downtown Dallas West End historic district.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeChix
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend stay at the Dallas Sheraton in downtown Dallas, TX. We stayed on the 26th floor in the North Tower in a standard room. The room was clean, spacious, and easy to access via the jet speed elevators. The hotel is located by a DART rail stop (Pearl St.), which was great for going to the big state fair and Cotton Bowl. We did not eat any meals there as the prices seemed expensive for a hotel restaurant. The kiosk check-in was a snap and kept us out of the check-in line at the desk. I would recommend the hotel to anyone for a downtown Dallas stay. Their 90 million dollar rennovation showed well.

Reviews.Title: “OK if your conference is here”
Reviews.Author: CookingGirl73
Reviews.Content: The only reason I was happy to stay at this hotel was because it was where my conference was taking place. So, for that reason it was convenient. Otherwise, the location is not good. It's not near anything of interest. Main Street has restaurants and a CVS, but the walk over there is sketchy. There's a small stretch between the hotel and Main Street that seems deserted. Once you get to Main street, it's OK, still not exactly bustling. The hotel is right at a train station, which is useful. I used the train to get to the mall, but it was a bit of a pain to get there. My room was clean and comfortable. The bed was excellent, I slept very well. The roof pool area is OK. It is ridiculous that the hotel has a Peet's coffee shop, but it closes at 3pm. So, there's nowhere to walk to, and no coffee in the hotel after 3pm, unless you want to go to the restaurant. It seems that since the hotel is in a deserted location, that the coffee shop should be open until late, especially when the hotel is packed with guests. The hotel food at the conference was OK. Breakfast was terrible, but lunch was passable. The dinner buffet in the Kitchen Table restaurant was OK. Nothing spectacular. The concierge was helpful. The area with the computers and internet access was convenient and great, especially because I didn't feel like dragging my computer to Dallas. My overall problem was feeling a little "trapped" at the hotel. Which would have been fine if the hotel had a few more amenities, or at least you could hang out at a coffee shop or the yogurt place after 3pm! Not everyone wants to hang out at their sports bar. I'm saying that I'd recommend this hotel, but only if you have a conference IN the hotel. Otherwise, this area offers nothing.

Reviews.Title: “So many mishaps---All coincidence?”
Reviews.Author: NoraSea
Reviews.Content: Obviously by the title alone, you could tell that it was not a pleasant stay for me. I'm not an avid traveler but does do my fair share to know the good from the bad. Years ago I joined the SPG and I try to stick with SPG whenever I could. I would have to say this Sheraton has fallen short of the SPG expectation. Upon arriving at the hotel, the 1st level/lobby area looks nice and appears to be newly renovated. The gentleman behind the counter cheerfully annouced that I was being checked into a junior suite in the south tower. When I got to my room and opened the door, the room was pitch dark and I couldn't find the light switch by the door to turn on any light in the room. I couldn't let go of the door since I couldn't see any thing if I do. Finally I had to wedge my suitecase in the door to prevent it from closing when I searched for a lamp to turn on. Now I could finally take a look at the room. The suite is about double the size of a regular room. But somehow the whole room just appeared to be really musky and outdated. The bathroom doesn't appeared to be updated at all. Definitely doesn't seem like a hotel that just went through a million-dollar renovation. Then I noticed this really loud humming/buzzing noise. I called the front desk and asked to be moved to another room. At first they were trying to convince me that it might be just an air filter problem and they will send someone over to fix it. But I insisted that could not be the case. So the front desk had to go check with the manager and get back to me. They called me 20 minutes later and offered to move me to a room that's 2 floors up directly above my current room(1507 to 1707). In between the 20 minutes window, the guy showed up and confirmed my suspicion and told me I'm right underneath a mechanical room on the 16th floor. So now I'm being moved to 1707 which is above the mechanical room? I'm not falling for that trick. I refused and asked to be moved to another tower(they have 5 different towers). So the front desk had to go check and get back to me again. 1 hr later, I finally settled into my 3rd room of the night which is in the North3 tower. The room/furnishing are much more modern and cleaner. I decided to order room service and watch a movie. Guess what, the movie shakes violently on the TV and you get a headache just looking at it. So I had to call guest service to cancel. 2nd day, called for toothpaste, doesn't show up for 1hr. Called 2nd and a 3rd time, it finally came. My laundry did not come back at 9pm as promised. Called and they said they will go check and call me back, no call back. Called again, they said they will go talk to the manager and call me back, no call back. Finally at 11pm they sent some security manager knocking on my door thinking something was stolen from my room. I had to drag myself out of bed to clarify the situation. 3rd day morning, I called again about my laundry, they said management is aware of the situation and they will call me back, again, NO CALL BACK! I couldn't wait, went to check out at the front desk. The lady behind the counter said: " oh we found your sweater, it was placed in the wrong room". So I was at least happy to have my sweater back. Opened the dry cleaning bag, the sweater was hanging nicely from the hanger with my hair dangling down from it! I proceeded to check it out, stain was still on the front. There are couple other minor annoyances I'm not going to mention here. Overall I would not stay here again even if you pay me. Yes , the facility is OK , but the service is definitely lacking. The staff is courteous, but what good does it do when all you hear is "I'm sorry...." I wish there's nothing they need to be sorry about in the first place. The best service at this hotel would be the man who delivers room service which makes me feel that the 20% gratuity is well deserved. And after all these inconveniences, no one showed up to offer a nice gesture to appease the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia062
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience, comfortable beds. Excellent meeting accomidations

Reviews.Title: “Same as always; Very clean, pleasant and good service.”
Reviews.Author: road_warrior081
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many nights, will always go here when i have to have overnight travel in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is very well positioned to...”
Reviews.Author: ahartly
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very well positioned to access all that downtown Dallas has to offer. The DART is well within walking distance. The employees were kind and helpful. The room on the other hand was very old. The paint was chipping everywhere, the bath tub drain was broken, the tub would not fill. The food was average at best. Parking was $26 for the night. Will pick somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Starwood Standards”
Reviews.Author: Texan
Reviews.Content: We stayed on one of the designated Starwood floors and yet the housekeeping was the worst I've ever experienced in a Starwood hotel. After the room had been cleaned, I found they didn't take our dirty glasses or leave clean ones or even take the paper coffee cups we had used and left on the counter. I called for clean ones and yet hours later when I returned to the room we still didn't have clean glasses. We were not staying using points, we were paying because we had a conference rate. But I would never stay there again unless it was CHEAP. Had a breakfast meeting in the hotel restaurant. The very mediocre buffet was $17 PLUS $3 for a cup of coffee! The drinks in the hotel bar were incredibly expensive. $9 for a very ordinary margarita, the same for house wine.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: wtxtraveler
Reviews.Content: In September, I stayed at several downtown hotels in Dallas, and for the money, I think the Sheraton was the best. Their remodel has made it an elegant place to stay in downtown Dallas, it's quite affordable. The only nitpick is that the front desk is very slow in checking people in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - Room, Food, Amazing Weight Room and most of all Service”
Reviews.Author: Jdktex12
Reviews.Content: Weight room is a must see, it is equal too if not better than most health clubs. The food at Hotel is a must, I suggest the Chicken Fried Pot Roast! I walked to the Museum area as well as the Aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is NOT a dying art! Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Jlynnstringer
Reviews.Content: Upon check in, our room smelled odd...this was the thought I had in my head...but the bellman was actually the one to say something. He left to see what he could do. I thought it remarkable that he said something as the typical company would try to pass the room off on you, until of course you said something. As we wait in the hallway for another room, room service attendants arrive with my friends birthday cake (brought in from her husband prior to our arrival). We tell them our dilemma, and they immediately put us in a room to wait in so we could be comfortable. After about 20 min, we are directed to go to our other room....we get lost....the room service attendant came and knew where to find us!! He showed us to our new room, then offered another bottle of champagne for our trouble....we accepted. Later, at the pool, the same room attendant sees us and offers to get us anything. We ordered water, and he graciously agreed, at no charge to us. The next day, we ordered a couple things from the front desk, the items came quickly, without having to wait a long time. We were very pleased with everyone we encountered at this hotel, and we will definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Suite Deals that ended on a sour note”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyBristow
Reviews.Content: My team realy enjoyed the suite we shared. Very roomy & comfortable, esp. w/add on refrig & microwave. I'm glad we joined the Starwood Sadly, while packing the truck to return home, we discovered the 2 large magnetic signs advertizing my home based business had been removed. The Garage Security was very kind in taking the report, but that was his only role.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton Dallas Meets and Exceeds Expectations”
Reviews.Author: pj17149
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Dallas qualifies as an outstanding 5 star hotel. Located in the heart of Downtown Dallas, the hotel is convenient to shopping and business conferences. The ambiance at the hotel is exceptional. The rooms are decorated tastefully, and offer a truly relaxing experience, making one feel as if he or she is at home. I truly enjoyed the service, staff, and delicious but affordable food offered in the hotel restaurant. I look forward to returning to the hotel in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Dallas Hotel is my Texas Home”
Reviews.Author: fred_heine
Reviews.Content: I have been working in Dallas since May 2010. I stay in the Dallas Sheraton every week the hotel is not fully booked. The amenities of this hotel start at the front door, continuies to the front desk and spreads out through the entire hotel. Most of the staff in the restaurants and gift store know me my name. They all great me, ask about my family and provide exceptional service. All my rooms have been great. I participate in the "Green" program and I always have enough towels for the full week. I am always disappointed when I can't get a reservation in a subsequent week due to conventions.

Reviews.Title: “Fanatic Stay, Great People everywhere in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpringDaddy
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night here, but the employees made me feel like I live there. From the men and women who meet you when you drive up, to the front desk personnel, even the ladies in the gift shop. I will definite stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Service, Poor Room Condition”
Reviews.Author: JaredMillr
Reviews.Content: I travel several times monthly and I regularly stay at a Starwood Hotel. This hotel left a lot to be desired. The front desk staff was very friendly, but the hotel was not in the condition I expected. My first room smelled terribly and my second wasn't much better. Neither room was clean enough and could have used a serious deep cleaning. There was no attention to detail inside or outside of the hotel. Disappointing experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rmaxcy13
Reviews.Content: I went to Dallas to take care of some things with school and to see friends and stayed at the Sheraton Dallas Hotel. From the moment I made my reservation to the time I checked out, the service was incredible. There was a little mix up about my reservation but the guest services represenative, Chelsea, was VERY helpful and so polite. And the person who checked me in, Meghan, knew my name when I walked up to the counter. I was so impressed and felt so welcomed. When I ordered room service, I again spoke to Chelsea who remembered me and made sure to tell me that she was glad that everything worked out. Overall this hotel is one of my favorites. the food is always fantastic and the staff is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent renovation and first rate staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hotrodcruiser
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay downtown, and it was necessary. Otherwise i would probably stay away from the high parking fees associated with it. The Sheraton was accomodating in every sense of the word. The staff was responsive, professional, and friendly. The hotel is beautiful, and has everything i need to be comfortable. The pool area is small, but well maintained. There is good food available, and i would stay here again. I joined the Starwood preferred program, and had an assigned floor. In room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever! :) Treated like a criminal! BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: CarrieN
Reviews.Content: I was treated like a criminal at this hotel! It was the WORSt experience that I have had with hotel management. I paid in cash for my room at the beginning of the stay because I like to get the room paid for first. The hotel representative did not know what to do with cash and gave me a hand written receipt. He acted like a new employee. Upon check out, The hotel staff did not want to accept the receipt. I explained what happened. They made me wait 1 hour while they went through their camera tapes and it showed that I indeed had paid in cash and had been written on a receipt by their employee. I missed an appointment while waiting on them for an hour. I told them I was upset to be treated so rudely. The manager simply said , " You may go now." No sorry, No , I am sorry for your wait. No, I am sorry that we were wrong. Nothing. IN fact, he was very rude. He was wrong and he was rude! He was SO RUDE! This hotel was owned by Adam's Mark previously as service was superb! I wrote the hotel corporate office management and they said that they could not do anything and to simply check with the hotel management at the hotel where I stayed? Really? WORST CUSTOMER HOTEL SERVICE !!!!!!!!!!! Now I simply pay with a credit card and no hassles. I guess that is what they were trying to do. I guess that they wanted me to pay with my card so they treated me like trash because I did not follow their system. However, nothing was said about not paying with cash previously. It is so sad that RUDE customer service is becoming the norm now a days. It is sad that the hotel corporate office did not care or did not try to make amends. This just shows that they DO NOT CARE about their customers. The hotel furnishings were nice. The service was and is the worst ever! Customers BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail, execution and commitment.”
Reviews.Author: Pete3530549
Reviews.Content: I stay in 75-100 properties a year. The difference between a professional and an amateur is attention to detail. This trip was for a conference involving 4000. The hotel even thought to put out complimentary bottles of water at the registration desk for those waiting in line. Lines, by the way, that never materialized because of sufficient front desk staff and preparedness. Without exception every staff person I had contact with was professional, courteous and helpful. The multi-towered property is laid out so long elevator lines don't develop at lunch or the end of the day. Connected to food places that are per diem friendly without braving the elements. Property is well maintained and comfortable after a long day.The Sheraton Dallas was committed to playing a role in the success of this conference. In my opinion, they hit a home run.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: alicat5576
Reviews.Content: From the curtious & knowledgeable staff at check in, to the conceriage helping us get a town car to DFW, this was first class all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience.....”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Traveler71
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is downtown Dallas is probably fine for some business travel, but it was certainly dissappointing to us. The self parking is poorly located and you must awkardly pull your luggage up some stairs to the outside street. The rooms are dated and small. The TV did not work well when we got to the room either...however, the hotel staff did respond quickly to address it. For the same money, there are many other better options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Host hotel for Child Abuse conference. Hotel did an excellent job with organization. Hotel was pleasurable and met my”
Reviews.Author: workerbee18
Reviews.Content: 1. fitness room outstanding. 2. Staff friendly. 3. Hotel met needs. only negative experienced, was upon check in to the room, the bathroom tub was not cleaned. There were multiple (intimate) hairs in the tub. Grossed me out.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place away from home.”
Reviews.Author: bagarcia
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the Sheraton Dallas Hotel is very warm and accomodating. Our rooms were cleaned daily and the linens changed when requested. The resturants and lounges have a very inviting atmosphere and the food is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: worrickj
Reviews.Content: The pool area was wonerdul. The fitness center was the best that I have seen at any hotel. The rooms were real nice, and the hotel was located in walking distance to a lot thing. What I really liked about the hotel was the pool area. You could go out at night, and just relax by the pool. It had a nice warm breeze at night, that made it so relaxing to be around. I really like how the pool stayed open after 10 pm. No place is perfect and I realize that, but this hotel had much more positve's than negative. It was a great place to sort just get away and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling Special”
Reviews.Author: BeautiControl
Reviews.Content: I entered a lovely hotel equipped with internet access (no need) to bring my own, great places to eat in a convenient area, and beautiful hotel room with wonderful bed, soft and oh so relaxing! I felt pampered!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great conference area, and great people.”
Reviews.Author: DonnaElaine
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Dallas Hotel had several large conferences going on. It was evident by the number of guests checking in and out. The hotel staff was professional and friendly: from the front desk, to the waiters and waitresses, and housekeeping. The accommodations were 5 star. The Draft Media Sports Lounge was a great place to unwind at the end of the day. The exercise room and outdoor pool were awesome as well. With so many guests, it was a relief to be able to checkout using the t.v. or lobby kiosk. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely nothing to specifically recommend this property. It is a typical middle-of-the-road business/convention hotel in the city center. On the positive side, the rooms have been recently updated, which means there is not the wear and tear you would expect to see in a large property of this nature, and are spacious enough. On the negative side, the first two rooms I was sent to upon check-in were duds--the first wasn't made up and the second one reeked of smoke, even though it was allegedly non-smoking. The third try was the proverbial charm, but a mistake of this nature, especially when I had arrived fairly late and had meetings early the next morning, was unexcusable. I did not have a chance to use any of the facilities of the hotel. Service was friendly, though a little amateurish as evidenced by the problems at check in. All in all, this is one of those bland hotels that you have trouble remembering unless something goes wrong.

Reviews.Title: “This very expansive hotel made me feel safe and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: LukePurvis1974
Reviews.Content: The room was large and beautiful. It was also very clean and I loved the Starbucks coffee. Although there were hundreds of guests staying in the hotel, I never once felt lost in the mix. They made me feel welcome. I have stayed in many hotels all over the US and this was absolutely the best!

Reviews.Title: “A long but pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: agent1700
Reviews.Content: The service at this Sheraton was great. Everyone I came in contact with was helpful, courteous, and knowledgeable. I dined frequently at the hotel and all the servers were prompt and cheerful. The concierge lounge for frequent guests was a joy. Miss Jacki is a gem! The amenities (pool & work out room) were top notch and the guest room was spacious. Great location to get around Dallas as well. I highly recommend a stay at this hotel while in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great experience with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: quiltcrazy57
Reviews.Content: The staff couldn't have been nicer. The suite was beautiful and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - bed very comfortable - good tourist location”
Reviews.Author: CBRB
Reviews.Content: Location is great - right near the art center of Dallas. Be sure to go to the Chase Building to see the view. It is open during the work day. The Westin Center which is adjacent to the hotel and accessible via skywalk has many places to eat. It also has an ice skating center. The Dart (public transportation) is located right near the hotel and for $4 day you can travel to the downtown area (West Side) to see the 6th floor museum (JFK memorial) and the Dallas Aquarium, more like a rain forest. We basically walked everywhere. Be sure to stop at the visitor center located at the Old Red Courthouse at 100 South Houston Street in Downtown Dallas - they are very helpful. The bedding is excellent - very comfortable. Internet was free in the lobby section. We were able to get a great deal for this hotel through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms, halls and stairwells were very dirty.”
Reviews.Author: mkibcdds
Reviews.Content: We were in 3 rooms because they were dirty. Finally on the last room, the housekeeping supervisor brought a crew to clean the room. Piles of dirty laundry and garbage in the hallways, broken glass, dried food and hair in the stairwells.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service and sweet suites”
Reviews.Author: travelcord
Reviews.Content: I spent the night here to surprise some family that was at a convention there that was during the week. I got a real suite deal by booking directly on the hotelâ€™s web site. I reserved one of their executive 2 queen bed suites for the night. My dad and I arrived early that morning of our reservation and went ahead and parked in the garage (one of them which is just underneath the hotel). Upon check-in the guest service agent was very friendly and welcoming, she saw my request for a high floor and gave my party a 32nd floor in the North Tower and also gave us information about the hotel. I also verified if the room included club lounge access which it does. Upon entering the room, housekeeping was just finishing up with the cleaning detail and what I could see just from the door was not much but when the attendant finished I saw a â€œjaw-dropperâ€� of a room. This room was unbelievable in size. This has been the biggest suite I have stayed in soo far. The room has a sectional sofa with bed in one section, sitting chair, table with four chairs, 2 TVâ€™s, 2 closets, bar/counter, and separated by a door is the bathroom and spacious bedroom with 2 beds, sitting chair and desk. The room also had 3 phones in it with one being wireless. I was very impressed with the room. Also there is lots of hotel room artwork present in the suite. This hotel is fully loaded with pool, fitness center and an open business lounge with internet in the lobby. The hotel is also right next door to both the DART rail and bus stations and is also connected via skybrige to nearby business areas with a convenience store and the Westin City Center that has lots of food venues and the ice rink in the plaza building area. During my stay there were some issues that I encountered. The first of the issues was that when I trying to turn on the bedroom TV and it was not working. I called down to guest services to alert them of the issue and within a few minutes a maintenance person was there. She fixed the TV super fast and when she left the desk called to make sure everything was taken care of. Later that night while my party and I were out, the manager on duty called to make sure everything was satisfactory on the voice mail and I left a voice mail to confirm everything. Now this is what I call service and dedication. I will give the hotel 2 thumbs up for that, it is so wonderful to feel welcomed here. The other part of my issues was that I had so much trouble with my key cards when trying to get in the room, leaving the garage, and getting into the club lounge. The desk agents mentioned that they tried a new system each time but I would like to recommend to the hotel is if possible to try another route to see if this can be fixed. Another thing to watch out for was that in the room the ice tongs were very dirty and the 2 glass tumblers looked like they had been wiped out versus being properly sealed and sanitized. Just a few notes/tips about the hotel: I would like to add is that I was surprised a little bit when I heard that there is only one club lounge, which in a way was ok with me but it is located in the South Tower. If you are staying in the other two towers (North and Central) you have to come to the lobby level then go all the way to the South Tower then up to the 28th floor. The club lounge is soo worth visiting if your room includes access to it. Also when parking in the garage that is underneath the hotel, level A is reserved for Valet only and level B & C are the self parking areas. Self parking comes to about $20.56/day (includes taxes) and is unlimited in/out with guest room key I do want to highlight a staff member who showed outstanding service. Jakki; the club lounge attendant. She makes her guests feel like first class and also feel right at home. My party and I felt like were VIPâ€™s and welcomed warmly. Once again the outstanding service never went unnoticed. I will definitely return to this hotel in the future if I am in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Productive”
Reviews.Author: rey_mata
Reviews.Content: I experienced a great stay. My stay involved a 4 day 3 night business conference. However, the evenings were very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DianaVCarrico
Reviews.Content: Great staff, amazing food, the most beautifull view of downtown Dallas, really close to everything, quiet, free starbucks coffee in your room ( for Starwood preferred guests ), HD TV, Amazing fitness center as well as outdoor pool with outdoor comfy beds, super fresh hotel in summer which was great 'cause outside was extremely hot. All i can say is that it was the best hotel i've ever stayed at for a solo traveler in business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent visit! Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kanon13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Dallas for three nights and had a wonderful stay. The outdoor pool and workout room are amazing! It is very easy to get around downtown as there is the Darty rail just outside the hotel. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated and the staff was very friendly. I recommend trying the italian restaurant just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and spacious rooms, wonderful hotel staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: skirklan
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton exceeded my expectations. Every staff member was extremely helpful and kind. The room, executive suite, was very spacious, beautifully decorated and clean. The bed is extremely comfortable. I was sad to leave due to truly being able to relax during my conference. The exercise facilties are top notch. Need helping getting around Dallas, ask the concierge.....they helped us daily from finding restaurants within walking distance to the best mall to shop at. Definitley on my list to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay for my daughter's wedding”
Reviews.Author: Blank09
Reviews.Content: My daughter was married in Dallas recently, and many of our family members live out of town, so we needed to find accomadations in the Dallas area for the weekend. We checked on rooms at the Sheraton downtown Dallas and requested information on a block of rooms for out-of -town guest and were given a great rate. The rooms were great!! They were very clean and were larger than most average hotel rooms. The location to down town activities was wonderful. Thanks for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome conference and hotel experience at the Sheraton, Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: paulafharvey
Reviews.Content: I was there for the Career and Technology Education conference and spent four nights in a great room with great service from all employees. Parking was reduced, thank goodness, for the conference stay. The guest services staff were wonderful checking in so many attendees at one time and still making everyone feel their needs were the most important at that moment.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT FOR A WEEKEND GETAWAY”
Reviews.Author: Rick4230
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful from the moment you arrive. Everyone from the Valet to the maid service were kind and helpful. Room was clean and compfy.

Reviews.Title: “The reason I am no longer a Starwood Platinum Member”
Reviews.Author: meauho
Reviews.Content: I have attended an event at this venue since before it became a Sheraton or Starwood property. While it was an Adam's Mark, the staff was always polite, responsive, and at least appeared to be trying to help, even with an event that overtaxed the hotel's capacity. The first year as a Starwood property I made some concessions for the change in ownership and branding, new staff, and management inexperience with the event. I can no longer make excuses for this venue. With the exception of one manager (detail lower down), the staff was rude, unresponsive, and incapable of assisting with any requests, answering any questions, or finding out who would be able to assist or answer questions. Typically, if service is simply very good at a Starwood property, staff learning that I am (was) a platinum member immediately lead to excellent service. At the Sheraton Dallas, the staff went from ignoring me to rude and condescending. The restaurant has also gotten really bad. The food was not up to previous standard for the venue or Starwood venues in general. Sitting at a booth, our waiter served the two people on the outside of the booth first, and then ran his sleeves through our meals to serve the two people in the inside of the booth. We had to repeat our orders multiple times because he was too busy joking with the hostess at the door, or just had too much on his mind and couldn't remember what he was doing after he left our table. Service was very slow and impossible to get hold of. We actually had much better service from every other waiter in the restaurant than our own (as they did more to get our orders, promptly, and correctly).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: profwho88
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the hotel, it was lovely. It's big, but that's the nature of conference hotels. I stayed on a non-conference trip and the hotel was empty. Very nice, will stay again. Right by the DART transit. EXCELLENT hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highs and Lows”
Reviews.Author: Rico3201
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Dallas recently for a business conference. The hotel is huge and a little difficult to maneuver, but about the time I left I was getting better at it. There is a second floor bridge to a large convention facility across the street. Check-in began one of the worst travel experiences of my life. There was a line to check in, something I have not experienced in other business travel for a good while, but I later learned the very large hotel was at close to 100% capacity. The front desk staff were very helpful. My first room was very nice. I was surprised to see I had been booked in a "Junior Executive" room... king sized bed, living area with sofa and two chairs, flat screen TV and a bar area with refrigerator. But... no air conditioning. Dallas in July can be very humid and as I unpacked I did everythkng I could to get cooler air. The fan worked, and the hotel has installed special thermostats that are supposed to sense when a person is in the room and then begin cooling. I called the front desk, but it took awhile for someone to come to work on it. Long enough, now, that I had called the desk again to request another room. I was dripping with sweat at this point and very uncomfortable. I was promised another room with the explanation that I was being upgraded (at no additional expense) to an Executive room in the other tower since the hotel was so booked. A service person did arrive and, perhaps, was able to repair the A/C. I'll never know since a bell hop arrived to assist me in moving my belongings to my new room. It was huge, the largest room I have ever stayed in. But, surprisingly, not all that impressive after you got over the square footage. My bell hop explained that this tower was a former office building that Sheraton had aqcuired, and I found myself wondering what the room might have been originally. The first room was a large living area, but with very little furniture or decorating. There was a sofa and coffee table, a couple of floor lamps, and a small round table with chairs. On one wall was a flat screen TV, but it was so far across the room from the seating area that I found I did not enjoy usuing this room at all... too hard to watch TV. It was almost as if this room had "not been completed" yet. The bathroom was nice, but there was no bar area with refrigerator like the room I had just moved from. I missed that. The bedroom was spacious with two queen sized beds and a small desk and chair. There was also another flat sreen TV in the bedroom. Drawer space was curiously poor, as there were about three small dressers spaced throughout the two rooms with very small drawers. I found I had to put my clothes in two rooms, rather than one, yet I was the only one staying in the room. Tired, sweaty, and very hungry I ordered room service and was told it would be about 40 minutes because of the full hotel. After an hour I called back and they asked to take my order *again*, as it turns out my order was lost, or otherwise never prepared. They comped this meal for me (fair) and got it to me as quickly as they could. It did taste good, but I was starving and irritated by this time. The rest of the stay proceeded okay, and I have to say that staff seemed interested (at times) in making my stay enjoyable. The wireless internet available in the room comes at three pricing levels. I'm pretty sure you are charged BY DEVICE as I found my iPhone did not automatically connect to the Wi-Fi access I had paid for with my laptop computer. Instead I was prompted for payment options again. I declined, but another traveler should inquire before setting up multiple accounts for multiple devices. I saw many people accessing convenient locations to use their laptops in the lobby area (comfortable chairs with power plug-ins close by) but, while I could detect a Wi-Fi signal with my iPhone, I could never connect to it. Once again I was prompted for payment options. I thought free wireless was available in the lobby area? Same thing for the convention center. Maybe it was just "my turn" for unfortunate travel mishaps but overall I did not enjoy the stay at this hotel and do not plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Conference stay at Dallas Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: gergs
Reviews.Content: The Dallas Sheraton is an excellent Hotel. The staff was extremely friendly. They were helpful with arranging rides to the airport, and the room service staff was courteous and always on time. They had all the little things right. The conference facilities were excellent and the staff at the conference did a great job. The rooms were clean and the bathroom was clean and functioning properly. Its amazing how many times the restrooms are in disrepair in other hotels. I would recommend anyone to stay at the Sheraton on business or please. The restaraunts, lobby and all amenities were excellent. I was also surprised at how easy it is to get around downtown. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Dallas was an excellent conference venue.”
Reviews.Author: mclean2
Reviews.Content: My 5 day stay at the Sheraton Dallas was one of the most enjoyable business trips I have taken. The food and service at the eating establishments was very good. The food provided for the lunches and dinners during the conference very good and served at the well to all 1400 people attending. The gym at this hotel is the best equipped I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Sheraton standards”
Reviews.Author: dallassmu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dallas Sheraton in June 2010. The accommodations were disappointing. Check in was very lengthy and staff was not knowledgeable of the rooms or Starwood status. I am a Starwood platinum member and usually receive excellent service. I was given a room in the North Tower and the room was extremely noisy due to an elevator malfunction. The noise was like a train going through the room. I called the front desk to ask for another room and was told no other rooms were available. Then I ask if I could check out and move to the Westin next door and to my surprise a room magically became available on the 30th floor. This room was a standard room but was quieter than the other. The bathroom did not have a bath mat, had one bar of soap and one bath towel. I guess they where trying to cut cost! The standard rooms are very small so travel light I would not give this hotel another opportunity for my business.

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED IN ROOM WIFI - NOT FREE!!!”
Reviews.Author: dconrad
Reviews.Content: The hotel environment is definitely 3 or 4-star. However, services to the business traveler are definitely in question. We traveled for a business conference in July, 2010. We thought it priced too high, but opted to bite the bullet and pay the $18.95 PER DAY for in-room wifi service. Things went well for the first couple of days of our stay (we were there four). We were both able to access the wife in our room with no problems. On the evening of our second day, one of us was not able to connect to wifi in our room. A quick call to tech support revealed that the charge should have been $18.95 per day PER COMPUTER. My conversation with Andrew Franks (guest services manager), was unproductive, and he offered, as a "goodwill gesture" to rescind the charge for one day. One factor that was also of concern, they did not tell us about the "per computer" part of the charge, which I found unreasonable in the first place. I recommend that you locate another hotel if your conference participants are dependent on wifi, and want the convenience of working from their guest rooms at no additional charge. Following is a list of hotels that provide free guest room wifi: AmeriSuites by Hyatt - AmeriSuites hotels offer guests a large, attractive studio suites are appointed with amenities such as kitchens, free hot breakfast, free high-speed wired and wireless Internet access and a business center. Durry Hotels - Check email or surf the web, fax anywhere in the continental United States, copy important documents or print that proposal for your morning meeting! All 24-hour business centers include a computer, fax, copier, printer and wireless Internet access. Hilton Garden Inns - With WiFi throught all Hilton Garden Inn hotels, plus secure remote printing from anywhere in the hotel to the business center - all complimentary - Hilton Garden Inns will help you stay connected during your stay. Holiday Inn / Holiday Inn Express - Free high-speed Internet access in the U.S. & Canada. These low-budget hotels are tried and true when it comes to free WiFi. Many of these budget hotels are newly constructed, small, low lying structures, which means outfitting the property with a wireless network is not a difficult task. Holiday Inn Express alos provides reliable free wireless network year in and year out. Homewood Suites by Hilton - To help our guests stay connected and productive while on the road, Homewood Suites by Hilton offers complimentary high-speed internet access at all locations in guest suites, wireless access in the Lodge, an area off the main lobby, and in each hotelâ€™s business center. Econo Lodges - All Econo Lodge hotels offer free Wi-Fi Internet hot spots in guest rooms, lobbies, public areas and meetings rooms. Embassy Suites Hotels - Embassy Suites Hotels offer both business and leisure guests complimentary high-speed Internet access is in every suite and free wireless Internet access in atrium spaces. Many but not all guest rooms have complimentary wifi in them just yet but its planned soon. Four Points by Sheraton - With free high-speed Internet access (HSIA) now available in most Four Points by Sheraton guestrooms in the United States and Canada, guests can stay connected anywhere they go - without the hassle of wires. In addition to free high-speed Internet access in guestrooms, many Four Points by Sheraton properties feature wireless Internet access in lobbies and wired high-speed Internet access in meeting rooms. Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham - Hawthorn Suites hotels offer free cable and wireless Internet, and other services to keep you connected while on the road. Hawthorn Suites include a desk with ergonomic chair, complimentary daily newspaper and business services such as personal voice mail. Best Western Hotels - At Best Western hotels in North America high-speed Internet both wired and wireless is always free both in the guest rooms and in most public spaces. Cambria Suites - With sophisticated technology such as digital televisions, MediaHub technology and free WiFi internet access. And other functions on your lifestyle, how a state-of-the-art fitness center, indoor pool and spa. Candlewood Suites by InterContinental Hotel Group - Sometimes, our guests of the suite as a temporary use in the office and a home. Therefore, we have hotel suites, with amenities such as free local calls and two phone lines with data port. And now, Candlewood Suites offers high-speed Internet access. Absolutely free. Courtyard Marriots - The budget brand from Marriott has long offered free WiFi in their lobbies, but we never found hanging out in a Courtyard by Marriott lobby to be particularly awesome â€” until this year, that is. Courtyard has introduced these ultra-modern new Media Pod booths with flat-screen TVs and plug panels. Having a meal, a glass of wine and our fave TV show in front of us as we work is just about as good as it gets. Comfort Inns / Comfort Suites Hotel - Most Comfort Inn hotels includes business travel services such as free high-speed wireless Internet access. Hampton Inns by Hilton - Whether you are sending a meeting recap or a weekend recap you can stay connected at Hampton with our free high-speed internet. Hampton Inns free high speed WiFI internet access in all guest rooms, lobbies and meeting rooms. Hotel Indigo - Hotel Indigo came onto the scene a few years ago, but it wasn't until last year that a significant number of Indigos came online â€” and we do mean literally online â€” with free WiFi in guestrooms. The boutique brand from Intercontinental Hotels strives to make the hotel stay a more personal, comfortable experience, and with free WiFi in the rooms, it's almost like we're at home. Hyatt Place Hotels - Hyatt Place is Hyatt's budget boutique hotel brand, with free WiFi. Recommendations at Hyatt Place for the tech-dependent set? Plug-panels in the rooms allows you to you all your media - laptops, DVD players, MP3 and gaming systems - directly to the 42-flat-screen HDTV. Springhill Suites by Marriott - Work smarter -- not harder -- at in-room workstations that feature ergonomic desks and chairs, plus phone lines with data ports and voicemail. Make a connection with FREE WiFi in the lobby and FREE wired Internet in all hotel suites. Staybridge Suites - Get connected and stay productive while on the road with Wireless Anywhere, a free Internet access throughout the entire hotel. Wired high-speed available in every suite. 24-Hour Business Center with computers, laser printing, and Internet access. Hyatt Summerfield Suites Hotels - Being away doesnâ€™t mean being out of touch. Hyatt Summerfield Suites allows you to connect with more people more often with our free high-speed wired and WiFi Internet in your room. Marriott Residence Inns - Marriott Residence is so proud of their WiFi that according to their terms they would even bring you a wireless bridge if your in-room signal was low. Most Residence Inns also come with free WiFi in the lobby, and they cater to business travelers and guests staying for the long stay as well. Omni Hotels - Most Omni properties charge a fee for WiFi access; however, signing up for the Omni Select Guest loyalty program â€” which is free to do â€” earns you complimentary WiFi at all levels. Quality Inn and Suites - Quality Inn and Suites like most Choice Hotels provide guests with free wired and wireless high speed internet access and local calls. Radisson Hotels - Radisson Hotels & Resorts in North America offer free high-speed Internet access. "We want our guests the possibility, as when traveling, as they are in their office or at home. Radisson Hotels in North America have free high-speed Internet access in the room." In addition, guests have the opportunity to print documents and are fetching in the printing station of the hotel, or select the documents delivered to their room at their convenience. Most Radisson hotels in the United States and Canada offer free broadband access in guest rooms. Rodeway Inns - Some Rodeway Inns by Choice Hotels offer free wireless internet in addition to free local calls and long distance access. See which Rodeway Inns provide complimentary wifi at this time. Sleep Inn and Suites - Free high speed internet access in all public areas and free wifi in guest rooms. La Quinta Inn & Suites - Whether you're traveling on business, a leisure getaway, or a family vacation, La Quinta has the right hotel accommodations for you. Take advantage of free internet access, both wired and wireless in all guest rooms and lobbies. MainStay Suites by Choice Hotels - All MainStay Suites provide guests with free wired and wireless high speed internet access and local calls. Super 8 Hotels by Wyndham - Most Super 8 Hotels provide property wide WiFi and dataport phones in their guest rooms. Wingate Inns by Wyndham - At Wingate by Wyndham, you know that we mean business. Therefore we are obliged to furnish your stay with us as pleasant and efficient as possible. Each hotel offers valuable amenities at no extra cost to you, including free WiFi Internet access offered in all public spaces and guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: drwatson32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our first experience with hotwire.com. We were told we were getting a four-star hotel that was in the vicinity of our dinner destination for the evening (Medieval Times). We ended up on the 17th floor of the hotel, which was clean and had 4 eating establishments located inside--The Kitchen Table (closed due to low occupancy), Draft (a sports bar and grill), Chill (an ice cream place that also looked closed) and a coffee place. Parking in the hotel's parking garage, which is below the hotel, was $19 for the night. We tried to park in a $5 lot across the street but were warned that traffic from the nearby club might cause it to fill up while we were out to dinner. So, the good deal we thought we got on the room was pretty much eaten up with the added parking. Hotwire does warn that hotels may charge additional fees, but this seemed a bit much. However, the hotel is in downtown Dallas, so if that's convenient for you, then the added expense may be worth it. We had chips and salsa at Draft. Food items seemed a bit pricey. Our snack was $5 and the salsa tasted just like Pace Picante, nothing special. The waiter was friendly, though. The lady at the concierge desk was also friendly when offering advice on the parking situation. Other downsides: the shower was slow to drain and I think there was supposed to be a light over the shower, which was burned out. It seemed really dark in that part of the bathroom, but it was roomy. Many TV stations on the flat screen were grainy. The pillow cases had a strange texture. The room seemed small for one with a king-sized bed. Check out time was listed as noon. At 9:50 a.m. housekeeping knocked on our door and we had to tell the lady we were still there. That made me feel rushed and I actually thought it was quite rude. Positives: the room seemed clean and the sheets were comfy.We didn't swim but we did check out the gym area, weight room and pool with cabanas on the fourth floor. That looked like a nice feature. They had a gift shop. Several computers with Internet were available near the lobby. The bottom line: we have been happy in most of the Holiday Inn Expresses where we have stayed in the past. Most of those are considered three-star, but we missed the included continental breakfast they offer and would rather stay outside of the bustling city at a place like that rather than a four-star in the middle of downtown Dallas that overcharges for parking. The Sheraton may have been nice, but it's not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great job on the renovations”
Reviews.Author: spgplat2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times over the years and never particularly liked it, but they did a fabulous job on the room renovations and this will now be one of my preferred hotels in the area. I'm not sure if all the rooms are renovated but I was in the North Tower and I would describe the decor as a toned down modern feel of the same quality as a newer Le Meridien. As another reviewer mentioned, the fitness center is one of the largest, nicest facilities I've experienced. There must be 20 or so treadmills and ellipticals and a room full of free weights and machines. The pool area was also tastefully redone. The pool itself is nothing fancy, but they put the nice padded chairs as well as some cabanas around it, so it's very enjoyable to lay out around the pool with a nice downtown view. I would highly recommend this hotel if you have business in downtown Dallas and definitely choose it ahead of the Westin if the rates are comparable. The only major downside is that the hotel can get kind of crazy if there's a large convention, but once you've stayed here a couple times, you'll figure out where everything is and the large size isn't much of a problem anymore. Room service does take longer due to the size, but the price and the quality of the rooms and fitness center more than make up for those small problems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: akamad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for few nights. The hotel was maginificent! There was a great restaurant and a sports bar downstairs. Do go to the pool if you get the chance. It's a lovely outdoor pool with beds! Only problem is that wifi is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business or pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: The_Sympsons
Reviews.Content: I had a conference at the hotel. Everything was top-notch - nice facilities, clean rooms, comfortable beds and great food. I enjoyed everything about my stay at the Sheraton Dallas, and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad27
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas to attend a convention of over 13,000 people. The convention center was right across the street from the Sheraton Dallas hotel and the amount of pedestrian traffic through the hotel was overwhelm,ing. The hotel itself housed many of the convention administration offices as well as some programming rooms. I give this hotel top marks for providing excellent rooms, a great restaurant (that served huge, delicious portions), super-helpful staff, and a host of extras, but especially for the way that the convention attendees were made to feel welcome as individual guests to be taken care of with graciousness and concern, not just as customers/sources of income. Bravo, Sheraton Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel has the best fitness center in the world.”
Reviews.Author: firstdean
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best kept secrets in the world. Everything about it is first class. My my stay from ckeck in to check out was of the highest standards. It is where I will stay in any futher visit to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special...”
Reviews.Author: gopoets
Reviews.Content: Nothing special about this newly renovated hotel. A few restaurants within walking distance. Attractions are not close by at all. Rooms are OK but not terribly comfortable. My room was #3448 on the 34th floor, which featured a strange floor layout. It was easier and shorter to cut through the fire stairwell when reaching my room otherwise I had to walk well past my room. The availability of computers in the main floor was outstanding. Food choices were OK. The fitness center was very good and quite large. I received a Fed Ex package while there and the charge was $9.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place for stay”
Reviews.Author: martin_9191
Reviews.Content: Being my first visit to Sheraton Dallas, I am impressed with it...so I thought why not write a review on how this hotel is doing....genuinely this place is worth each penny you pay for stay... nothing on the list of complaints.....front desk staff does a great job in showing a warm welcome to the guest. Rooms are clean and well organized..In short everything seems to be perfect for a stay.... Highly recommend for business meetings and stay...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: drdave51
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, once you figure your way around. Good sized roms with a large bathroom (which is appreciated by us plus sized travelers). Helpful staff, decent food (the buffets are an especially good bargain).

Reviews.Title: “Fun times.”
Reviews.Author: mueloegnaro
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very spacious and accommodating to my needs. The house keeping staff was very nice and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Overpriced on EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: TCANTU
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and clean but the prices charged for the extras were ridiculous. I was in town for a large convention and had boxes shipped to me at the hotel. The charges ran up over $500 and I was never told this when checking in. The food in the bar, restaurant and especially room service was terrible and way overpriced. Everyone who worked at the hotel was very nice and friendly and they do have a great "Green" program offered to guests who do not need their room cleaned every day.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: JLFrazier
Reviews.Content: A/C is "body heat activated" and weak. Nothing worse than coming back to a hot room in this Texas heat. Skid marks in the toilet, half empty water bottle in the bathroom, gnats flying around the room, no ironing board, ice machine on floor wasn't working. Requested another room. 2nd room same issue with the A/C, extremely weak and shut off if you left the room. Ice machine on floor of the second room also inoperative. My company's awards banquet was held at this hotel and after the banquet went back to a 90 degree room at 1am. Packed up and left with a full refund. I'm all for a "Green" hotel room but I place my comfort over that. Kill the A/C all you want but I want full control over it during my stay and I want it to work and work well.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY....has it all!!”
Reviews.Author: lfree1313
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice...the upgraded us when we checked in! Service was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: wesbw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dallas Sheraton for two nights while attending a convention. At first the hotel is overwhelming because it's so huge - with rooms located in three tall towers. However, after getting oriented, I realized what a wonderful place this is. I had a King-bed room in the north tower - room 1869. There was a spectacular view of the Dallas skyline from the room. The bed was comfortable and the quietness enabled me to get a good night's sleep. The best thing about this hotel is the wonderful amenities. The fitness center was the best I've seen at any hotel, and it was open 24 hours (no additional charge). Also, the hotel has a section near the lobby which has computers where internet connection is available to hotel guests at no additional charge. A DART rail station is located just outside the hotel, which makes this a convenient place to stay if you need to get to the Dallas Convention Center. On the second floor, the hotel is connected to a skywalk which will take you to Plaza of the Americas which has shops, dining, and an ice skating rink. Most of these businesses close early in the in the evening, but the McDonalds stays open longer. Aside from the hotel restaurant, it was difficult to find dining places that were open in the evening in this part of downtown. However, I found a great Italian dine-in/take-out place called Carmine's Pizzeria, just a couple of blocks from the hotel on the corner of Harwood & San Jacinto. They're one of the few places that stays open throughout the evening in this area. The bottom line is that I found the Dallas Sheraton to be a great place to stay in downtown Dallas. I would recommend it to anyone and it will probably be my first choice if I ever need to stay in downtown again.

Reviews.Title: “Intrusive Housekeeping Staff”
Reviews.Author: the-Soror
Reviews.Content: A housekeeper literally *WALKED INTO OUR ROOM* while we were sleeping and didn't answer a short, quiet knock on the door. We couldn't fold the latch because there were others coming in and out at all hours. I woke to the knock, and was standing, putting on clothes to answer when there's a strange woman standing in the room with me, staring blankly. After an awkward moment, she went back out into the hallway, asked 'are you checking out today?' and then halfheartedly apologized over her shoulder before disappearing around a corner. The Sheraton has always been a great venue, and during A-kon, which is why we were there, they have to put up with a lot, so I don't have any complaints aside from that, but if you stay here...definitely turn your latch, or some aging housekeeper will stare at you in your underwear.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!!”
Reviews.Author: k5116
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel for an overnight trip to attend a concert in Dallas. What a wonderful experience. We arrived in Dallas on a early flight from the east coast and worried that we would have to wait awhile to check in....not a problem though. The reservation desk quickly informed us our room was ready and proceeded to check us into an executive suite on the top floor! Our suite was absolutely beautiful, very spacious and comfortable (by the way...it was at standard price!). I was very impressed with the employees of the hotel, very friendly and accomodating. Nice restaurants and a very cool sports bar. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Dallas area. If you want comfort and luxury this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: valjs222
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. To begin the experience, check in was fast and pleasant. I stayed here due to a conference I was attending. All of the rooms I attended meetings in were very nice. Everything was easy to find and comfortable. My room was great and I slept so good both nights of my stay. The staff seemed to be concerned and helpful. Check-out was just as pleasant as check- in; fast and smooth. I just found out that I will be staying here again for a job related event in two weeks. I must say that I was truly delighted.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Dallas Hotel - Memorable Even For a Frequent Traveler”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMNMan
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business and many of my hotel stays tend to blend together and not make much of an impression. My recent stay at the Sheraton Dallas Hotel stood out from other hotels in that the room and bathroom were roomy, comfortable, updated and clean. My room service was on time and the food quality was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel for business or vacation travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal on Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: AirForceGuy1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over memorial day weekend. Hotwire price was $41 per night plus fees which was a great deal for this class of hotel downtown Dallas. Parking is $19 per night for do-it-yourself or $26 per night for vallet. If you are in and out alot, you may want to do the vallet. Just call from your room to the garage and they will have your vehicle waiting when you get down there. The pool is awesome except these queen B's that were trying to "reserve" all the chairs with thier flipflops for the other Gaga's that had not yet arrived. The only bad thing I can say about the hotel itself was you can only get free wi-fi in the lobby or pay for it per day. Cant recall how much but it was more than I wanted to pay for something that should be free anyway. Also, if you like to be on a high floor just request at the desk, they accomadated my wife an I no problem. We stayed on the 36th floor in the north tower with a pretty good view of downtown and Love field off in the distance. Nightlife; went to houes of blues and had an awesome time. Little on the pricey side for drinks but to be expected. Also lots of bars and resturants in the historic district which is walking distance or the trian takes you to and from the doorstep of the hotel. .

Reviews.Title: “Great local food within walking distance”
Reviews.Author: dmblnd
Reviews.Content: Take advantage of the local dining during the week as most of it shuts down on the weekends. The hotel dining has a very selective menu serving the same food at both lunch and dinner. Great fitness center!

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ElPas0an
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the Sheraton in Dallas from the moment I spoke with the friendly staff at check in. The room was very clean with a cozy bed and ample space. The fitness center was phenominal with all the equipment anyone could ever ask for. The Kitchen Table served up a delicious buffalo shrimp po' boy sandwich with sweet potato fries that I have since been craving. I highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Dallas for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Alas the only place to stay in downtown Dallas!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sanfelipe140
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff and what a great place to rest after a long day of meetings. It's also a short walk from what ever might interest you in downtoan Dallas. The Sixth Floor Museum, great food, shops and bars are3 a short walk away however the hotel restaurant and room service were more than good enough to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “NERC Meeting on Cyber Security Standards”
Reviews.Author: jmbucciero
Reviews.Content: Very positive experience. Hotel staff was very attentive and provided excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was in a Ritz Carlton the whole time the way I was treated.”
Reviews.Author: mvhiggins19
Reviews.Content: I was extremely satisfied with every aspect of my stay. The room, restaurant and health facility were excellent, however it was the service that reminded me of a Ritz carlton. I will seek out other Sheraton's now simply from this experience to see if they meet the standard set by Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location for your business conference, or just staying downtown!”
Reviews.Author: beckbr448
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a 3 day conference with my company. During this time, there were about 1,000 employees from my company there along with other smaller conferences taking place. I typically stay at Sheraton and other Starwood hotels, so the rooms cleanliness and comfort were great and what I expected. What was somewhat unexpected was the level of service and effort put in by the hotel staff involved in setting up the conference rooms, food service, and all other aspects of keeping the conference center and hotel clean. There was never a point, even with so many of our own group there, that service staff wasn't available almost immediately to address any need or question. They were all very nice and many workers were just a pleasure to work with. Also unexpected was how good the food was! I never expect much in this area when involved with large conferences, but their foodservice was excellent. Other items of note: huge workout facility, nice pool area, very fast check-in.

Reviews.Title: “A really great place to stay in downtown Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: oracle_10
Reviews.Content: I have experienced the renovation of this hotel since I have been staying at the hotel on a weekly basis for over a year now. It has transformed itself into a very versatile location for business with its Microsoft Internet Cafe. It has an extremely convenient conference center which can accommodate large events. The hotel is ideally situated for leisure travel as well, since it is located walking distance to the Dallas Arts District. The Dallas Area Rapid Transit light rail stops right out front to take a visitor anywhere on the DART system. The quiet rooms have all been renovated to Sheraton's latest standards with HD TV. The lobby is very appealing, and the new Draft Sports bar is very up-to-date. But the real gem is the staff--the service is outstanding. Every single person is dedicated to making my stay as enjoyable as possible. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelcheryl
Reviews.Content: My only complaint was late one night someone was making too much noise opening and closing door several times and I think it was the maid

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FACILITIES FOR A CONFERENCE”
Reviews.Author: Gduhon
Reviews.Content: The facilities of this hotel is great! Be sure that the hotel does not overbook itself for your conference. Also- hotel does not understand what the word BLOCK of rooms means. They will split up your party amoung towers and floors unless you harrass the front desk personnel. This was frustrating with minors.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton had it all, food, service and a great room. No need to go anywere else.”
Reviews.Author: PChrissy22
Reviews.Content: The Employes at the Sheraton were very accomadating to all our needs . The room was clean and the bed was so comfortable. Enjoyed the restaurants and the bars in the Sheraton too. The breakfast buffet was great.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frenchysmith
Reviews.Content: I think that your hotel does it right. The staff is friendly. The rooms are great. Your gym is one of the best that I have seen, and its hours are the best. Your food staff is great. I might see if you can improve the quality of the food in the sports bar, but it is fine for what it is. All-in-all yours is a great venue. I told my wife as much, and she sources meetings for Helms-Briscoe.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has gone through a major...”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustCochrane
Reviews.Content: This hotel has gone through a major renovation. The rooms are very nicely decorated; beds and linens are outstanding. Very nice furniture, flat screen HD TV. I've been to this hotel on business many times and I'm constantly amazed at the poor service received though. This last trip was yet another example, and these are small things, but when you travel for business very frequently, stand out. Our welcome conference letter delivered 4 days after arrival. I had to call guest relations twice to get a mending kit and when housekeeping delivered it, looked down her nose at the $1 tip I gave her. Housekeeping just decided one day not to clean my room, and left a $5 coupon for the restaurant instead. Small bottled water in the room costs $4.50. And the gift shop is out-of-this world expensive - $8.50 for a bottle of soda and a small bag of snack mix. $15 a day for wireless in-room Internet. I would not choose this hotel for anything but business travel.

Reviews.Title: “In my top two WORST hotel stays ever!”
Reviews.Author: sdwjla
Reviews.Content: Ever get into a hotel bed and get someone else's urine on your body? That's what happened to me at this hotel!!!!! Then once I switched rooms, the faucet in my second room would not turn to hot which I did not discover until I had just enough time to take a shower and get ready the next morning. In the end the manager took off all room and valet charges which was nice (and certainly expected) but to have two rooms that were unsatisfactory over a one night stay period leaves me absolutely un-impressed. Also, valet is $26 a day which I found to be outrageous. Most of the higher end hotels that we stay at for business have complimentary valet.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: VisitedNewPlaces
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference in the Convention Center in April, which is attached to the Sheraton on the 2nd floor. Sheraton Check in was rapid, efficient, and the customer service at a high standard. I was directed to my elevator and tower directly and made my way to the room. As is usual for Texas, everything is bigger, and this hotel is no exception. While the overall property is huge and common areas the same, the room floors design was laid out in an easy to navigate square pattern. I have stayed in much more sprawling properties. While the walk from front desk to the North Tower elevators is a 5 minute hike, from floor elevator to your room is a quick walk, regardless of where the room is in the square. The room was very clean, non smoking, well lit, had a nice large screen flat panel TV, and a wall to wall window with a view of downtown. The bathroom was surprisingly spacious, nicely designed, and stocked with toiletries and linens. The bed was very comfortable, and the room quiet. I had no problems sleeping for my whole stay. The eateries around the hotel were sparse. Being on the edge of town, a short walk (10 minutes max) to Main street was the fastest access to a restaurant area. I visited two places downtown, both of which had very nice cuisine, one Mexican establishment known as Iron Cactus and another Italian establishment known as Ravenna. I also observed several other interesting places on the same street. The West End was known to be near and worth exploring, which I did not have time to walk further into. Word of advice: The last night I ate at the Sports Bar in the hotel to save time. The food was very fried and awful compared to the external establishments on Main street. I would NOT eat there again. Also, the only coffee shop nearby is in the hotel, Pete's, which closes promptly at 5pm. You have to be joking. 5pm in a convention hotel? I recommend the SHeraton kick them out and invite a Starbucks onboard with a later opening time. The nearest Starbucks, by the way, is only open until 6pm and is also on Main Street. The Hotel gym is awesome. I have never said that in any property I have reviewed, but this one merits the praise. It was more like a LA Fitness or Bally's than a hotel based micro-gym. I never had a problem finding a treadmill, since there were about 20+, and that carried over to the life cycles, rowing machines, etc. All the equipment was new, functional, had TV screens, or you could look out at the roof top pool, which was surrounded by lounge chairs and outdoor beds. Yes, Beds, which sounded like fun for falling asleep after a quick swim or just enjoying the outdoor air. Blast not bringing my swim suit along! Checkout was efficient and in short order I was ready to leave from the underground parking area. Which leads me to the one issue I had with the stay. My room key was coded to allow egress from the parking garage. Naturally it chose to quit working when I used it in the underground lot that last day. The HELP button on the exit post worked, whereupon I had to explain who I was, why I was calling, and wait for them to check that I was valid to exit, a 5 to 8 minute delay. Not a tragic issue, but given all the good things that occurred at this property, one I can live with. I would come to this property again at any time and wholeheartedly recommend it to others staying in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Big, But Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: GeoSF
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake about it -- this is a very large convention hotel, which means at times (and depending on how many conventions) it can be very, very busy in the downstairs public areas, and in car valet area. The front desk area can also get very busy, especially during peak check-in and check out periods. So if you are looking for a serene boutique experience, this is probably not the hotel for you. However, we found this hotel to be very, very nice in many ways. We all stayed in the North Tower, which has been (I understand) recently renovated, and the rooms were nicely furnished. My executive suite was actually huge, very nicely appointed, two large flat screen televisions with HD, very comfortable beds (the usual Sheraton Sweet Sleepers -- but very nice.) The suite had brand new high end designer carpet. Very clean. Bathroom very nicely appointed -- not palatial, but very pleasant, and fine. We were on one of the club floors, and the club itself was basic but very nice. For convenience I found myself eating in the hotel restaurant several times, and the food was tasty and well prepared, and the servers were quite nice. Outside the restaurant, there is a nice outdoor areas with chairs positioned around fire pits -- and it's a very pleasant place to grab a drink at night. The front desk staff was pretty much all business, but they get the job done. But it is frantic down there with such a large hotel, so one understands that they don't really have the time to do back flips. So, all in all, we had a great stay, and were very pleased.
