I generally do not enjoy hotels this huge, but all in all, this particular hotel has a lot of pluses which compensate. At least that was our experience! And the hotel is very well located, within easy walking distance of the Meyerson Concert Hall and the new Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “My experience was great”
Reviews.Author: Portastorm
Reviews.Content: Interesting to see such a varied group of experiences at this hotel. My experience was great. First of all, I expect to see some service charges and to know that if you're staying at a hotel of this caliber in downtown Dallas, you better expect to pay. My room was awesome. Great, comfortable beds. Lots of workspace room. Good-sized, very clean bathrooms with nice amenities for shampoo/conditioner, etc. I was a little bummed that the TV selection didn't include HBO (they have Showtime) but that's a small drawback in comparison. The staff was very helpful and the quality of food for the dinner buffet the night I ate downstairs was very good (Italian). The waitstaff fell over themselves trying to serve me. If anyone has heartburn over paying for Internet, the hotel has a massive Microsoft-oriented center on the main floor where you can access the Internet freely and print out stuff, etc. Lots of computers and few people there. I loved this hotel and would go back there in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away at all cost-you will be stiffed.”
Reviews.Author: alfver
Reviews.Content: These people are crooks and do not have common sense! Make a long story short, they made a $200 charge on my credit card for a smoking fee. What?!!! Hello, me and my husband are non smokers. We even advised the front desk that our room smelled like smoke, to which they kept telling us to hold on (were understaffed). We figured it was no big deal and left to our dinner reservation until weeks later saw the charge on our statement. For which, the manager declined to credit it. What do they base themselves on??!! Can they show me proof? Very rude and just waiting to see where they can steal from you. Will never stay at another starwood hotel in my life, and will def tell my enourmous circle of friends and family about this!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - avoid this hotel at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: seekingtomorrow
Reviews.Content: Had a horrible stay at the Sheraton Dallas. The rooms were not clean at all. Dirty bathrobe was left on my bathroom door, hairs were in the bed, mud on the bathroom floor, air-conditioning didn't work, coffee creamers were expired and came out in chunks. When I tried bringing my concerns to the hotel management via email after my stay they blew me off and said there was no record of any of this in the night managers log, essentially blaming me. Forgive me for not calling the night manager. I had just traveled internationally to be there and had not slept in 2 nights. My first thought was not to talk to the manager. Don't even look at this hotel! Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “4 star public areas, but 3 star max room”
Reviews.Author: TravelDawgSA
Reviews.Content: First off, I'm sick and tired of being "serviced charged" to death when I travel. Normally I don't go for 4 stars because 95% of the time the higher the star the more you pay for "extras" like parking and internet. I guess they think everyone walks or cabs to hotels, and the internet is still a "new" science that should be paid for. I did manage to get a great price on another website, and knowing I would be charged some for extras I thought "what the heck" I'd guess I'd pay about $20 for both those things. Parking and Internet instantly added $32 to every night!! Ridiculous. The good news is the Gym is great (and surprisingly free), but the bad is the room. While big, is a bit dated with peeling wallpaper, stained drapery, & mirror missing on wall (but hooks still there) etc. Definately not 4 star. Lastly I tried 3 separate floors to get ice and water (BTW water in the room...$4.50) but all machines sold out, and no ice machine worked. All in all not a impressed with the personal space as I should be for this rating.

Reviews.Title: “rediculously expensive”
Reviews.Author: rossBeefInFrance
Reviews.Content: Very clean, huge bedroom, good facilities but nothing exceptional to justify the price. 16$ for an average buffet breakfast? Over 12$ for a poor internet connection?? 4.50$ for a little bottle of mineral water? No minibar. One colleague complained of noise from the elevator and another stayed in the nearby Hotel Indigo (literally 5 minutes walk) which was half the price and a perfectly adequate alternative. There is also very little to do in the vicinity - we spent most evenings in the hotel's own, very good sports bar which is reasonably priced. If I ever return to Dallas, it won't be in the Sheraton - I'll find something cheaper. Recommended only if you want to be right next to the conference facilities - which are first class.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, wont stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: TxTravellers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the restaurant is great but customer service is lacking to the point where it ruined my stay. The first night they left me 3 towels, I called and after 2 more calls and 25 minutes had passed a housekeeper came by with more towels. The second night they had left us with only 2 towels and it took an hour and 30 minutes plus 6 phone calls before someone came. The concierge got involved went and personally picked up the towels and gave them to valet attendant to bring to our room. We were part of a chess team and the school had provided them with the tax exemption but we were still charged for it. I spent 30 fruitless minutes with the checkout person trying to explain that but he was incapable of doing simple math, finally I gave up and left. Its a shame that this ruined our experience with the hotel as it is a very aesthethically pleasing hotel and the gym rivals the finest gyms that you can go to.

Reviews.Title: “I would be mad if I paid full price”
Reviews.Author: paulandlauren
Reviews.Content: We booked this at the last minute using priceline. We got a $39.00 rate and stayed on the 27th floor. The first impression was, "what a huge and busy hotel". We were staying in Dallas for the night and only needed a place to sleep and move on. Short and sweet here it goes: The room was decent size, big bed(fairly comfortable), shower head didn't work correctly and it sprayed water all over as you huddled under it hoping to get the soap rinsed off, expensive parking($20/night valet), loud noises came from the wall when you turned on the water, walls were paper thin and we were unable to sleep due to noise and the fact that the maid came knocking on every single door down the hall at...... 8:30 a.m.!!!! We were not happy with several aspects of this hotel but seeing as how we paid $39/night, we can't complain. I would not pay full price for this hotel nor woud I suggest a friend wanting some R&R to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: BrandiZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference. It was a beautiful hotel. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, quiet, modern room”
Reviews.Author: ElJayP
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and I'm very picky. About once a year or so I love a hotel. This was my one. This hotel was fantastic - it gave me just what I want: A huge, quiet, clean, non-dingy well-done room (recently renovated and very spacious, modern, and relaxing; couldn't hear anything in it; tub slightly stained - though clean - so refrained from a bath, my only complaint). Friendly staff. Extremely relaxing (well designed) dining space, decent food. A Peets and frozen yogurt shop downstairs - honestly, what more could you want on a business trip??

Reviews.Title: “Very clean Downtown hotel with comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: G31
Reviews.Content: Having just escaped the nightmare of another Dallas Downtown hotel (Hotel Lawrence, see separate review), I phoned the Sheraton and got a nightly rate of 111USD for 2 weekend nights. The hotel is huge. 2 Dart stations are just outside the North Tower. The staff was friendly and even gave me a free breakfast voucher having heard about my previous bad experience in Dallas. The room was large with a great and very comfortable king size bed. The sheets were crisp and clean and the Plasma TV massive. The bathroom was large and very clean. Breakfast was ok (buffet style or you can order). I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Parking Fees!”
Reviews.Author: 2parrot
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Dallas Hotel for our Anniversary weekend Feb. 25-28. The hotel is located Downtown Dallas and the location is convenient to the West End Market Area. I had booked the room online and actually called days before to make sure we received a king but was told by the person answering the phone that all room assignments were made at check-in. While checking in, we were told they were putting us in a room with 2 queen beds. I asked if we could have a king and mentioned that we were there for our anniversary and the gentleman at the desk said no problem. But when we arrived at our room there was a problem. We were in the South Tower that is not renovated and while the room seemed nice enough, there was only one television and that was in the "sitting area". While the sitting area is in the same room as the sleeping area, the TV was so far, far away there was no way we could see or hear the TV from the Bed. We went back to the lobby (tried to call from the room but phone won't work) and asked for a room with a TV that could actually be viewed from the bed. We were told that the there were only queen beds in the renovated towers, and that they didn't have any kings (not that there were just none available... he told us they didn't MAKE any kings in the new areas, a little unbelievable). We took a Queen room and it was okay. Definitely not a 4 star, as advertised, as I have stayed in nicer Holiday Inns but it was okay. Wireless internet is available but at an ADDITIONAL CHARGE ($10 per day, I think) and I did not use it so I can't say if it works well or not. Our major disappointment came at checkout when we were told that there would be over $50 in ADDITIONAL charges for parking. There was no street parking, so hotel parking was the only option. There were NO signs telling us the charges and we were never told about the cost until our card had been charged at CHECKOUT, even though I had asked if there was a charge for parking during Check-in and my husband said "not I am sure they won't charge us for parking" and the person checking us in just didn't answer . I would NOT stay here (or any Sheraton for that matter) again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge”
Reviews.Author: MCTIER
Reviews.Content: This hotel is huge with guest rooms in three different towers. Stayed in a suite with separate living room and bedroom and large flat screens in each. Excellent bedding. Very quiet and comfortable overall. Breakfast buffet was rather expensive ($16) for not having anything made-to-order. Pleasant and helpful staff. Note that this hotel hosts lots of major conferences and conventions. I have no complaints but for personal ventures in the future probably would prefer something smaller.

Reviews.Title: “A really mediocre place, despite the renovations...all due to poor management”
Reviews.Author: Jakeman-will-travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 4-8 January as part of a large business meeting. Overall, I am very disappointed. I fully expect one of the managers to write one of their disingenuous responses to this review. Which tells you that talk is very cheap. The problems were significant and impacted virtually every colleague I met. 1. The entire hotel was freezing cold. Even men were complaining. This was a systemic issue. Rooms had to be set to 78 degrees to get any warmth. 2. The carpets were not vacuumed. They renovated. There was lint everywhere. Huge lint balls formed on everyone's shoes. Disgusting. There is no excuse for this. It is just evidence of the way they do not take care of their hotel. 3. The housekeeping staff did a half-baked job. Shower gel was not replaced. Shaving cream was not replaced. It too multiple days for open bottles and coffee cups to be tossed out. Trash was left behind. Other colleagues had similar fates with food not being picked up. Clearly, this is a managerial issue. 4. Cocktails tasted good but were low on alcohol. Clearly, they are penny pinching here. 5. Multiple people had problems with the remote in the room working properly. 6. They overcharge for internet...as usual. There are a few strengths-- the hotel has been renovated. The bar staff are nice. The food service staff were friendly and attentive. The laundry was done correctly. Overall, please try to avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: TexasBusinessGal
Reviews.Content: I travel often to Dallas Texas on business and pleasure. This was the first time I have stayed at the Sheraton downtown Dallas and I will NEVER stay here again. When I checked in and was taken to my room by the bellman the door to the room was latched from the inside. This should have been a clue. The bellman had to call maintenance to literally break-in to the room. Once inside the â€œjunior suiteâ€� is was apparent from the condition of the room â€“ why the door was latched from the inside. It room was filthy and apparently had not been used in months. The hotel was undergoing renovation â€“ however, all advertisements, including the Web site stated that renovations were complete. Well, renovations were NOT complete in the South Tower where they had placed me. The bellman (a nice and hardworking person) went back down stairs to the front desk to change the room for me. When the bellman returned, he led me to another room. The next room was not as dirty â€“ but this time there was no working latch on the door. In fact, the latch was lying on the floor just inside the door. In addition, this was a MUCH smaller room. Again, I called down stairs and again the bellman went down stairs to get another key to another room. After moving to the third room, in the same South Tower â€“ again, which was NOT renovated, there were no towels, no soap, and I had to wait 2 hours to have these items brought up to the room by housekeeping. No one, at anytime, offered to move me to one of the renovated Towers. No one offered to upgrade my reservation. I was nice to everyone. I tried to understand that everyone was busy. I never lost my cool or made a scene â€“ perhaps I should have. Further, the front desk was rude and acted as if I was an imposition. When I visited the Concierge to make a dinner reservation, she stayed on the phone talking to a relative for 15 - 20 minutes. Needless to write â€“ I will NEVER go back to the Sheraton in downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “HIghs and Lows - Service is Everything in My Book”
Reviews.Author: TravelloverAlabama
Reviews.Content: The Lows: I stayed at this hotel with my family from 12/3/09 through 12/7/09. We arrived @ 3:00 a.m. (about 3 hrs late) because of a flight delay ...which led to delays at every other step along the way. We were greeted immediately by someone from valet parking. He asked if we wanted valet parking and my husband said, "I am not sure...give me a second to think." Needless to say, we were functioning at less than top speed at this point. At this response, he promptly disappeared....back into his valet office/room & away from the cold. He did not ask if we wanted a bellman....which we definitely did. I went inside to check in while my husband unloaded the car...expecting a bellman to appear at any minute. By the time we were checked in, my husband had brought all of our bags inside so we began looking for a cart. We found one and loaded our bags on it...right in front of the valet window. My husband went to park the car while I took the bags and two children upstairs. When I came back down to return the cart, I decided to ask Mr. Valet Parking whether they even had a bellman on duty. He told me they did and he was on break, but he would be happy to help. This offer seemed a bit disingenuous since it came after he had watched us load our bags on the cart and watched me and my two children struggle to move it past his valet window. I told him I had taken care of it and he promptly went back to looking at his computer screen. Highs: On Friday we decided to order room service for dinner, but didn't have a menu in our room. After waiting for one to be delivered for half an hour, I finally walked downstairs to the restaurant to get a menu. Mr. Magdy Rizkalla did not have a menu, however, he kindly offered to let me order room service at the restaurant rather than continuing to wait for a menu to be delivered. Our order was delivered in about 30 minutes and, surprisingly, it was complimentary. This was completely unnecessary, but very much appreciated and demonstrative of the fact that Mr. Rizkalla definitely understands the importance of service. On Saturday night we had dinner in the bar while we watched football games and had excellent service by a woman in her 40's with long wavy blonde hair...don't know her name, but she was terrific. Another Low: Our room service menu took slightly over an hour to arrive. We got it about 4 minutes before our food was delivered. Another high: The room was clean and quite spacious...bedding was very comfortable. We were attending a dance competition at the hotel so we were in and out of our room all day. The hotel was at maximum capacity and yet our room was serviced in a timely manner...and completely without our knowledge. How did they do that? Because of Mr. Rikalla, service in the sports bar, and housekeeping, I would recommend this hotel. Service means everything in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Big and Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItsmeDanielle
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed here as we were traveling cross country. The hotel is easy to find off the highway. We arrived late at night but the staff was pleasant and helpful. The lobby area is beautifully renovated. Our room was clean and spacious. We grabbed a drink at the bar and chatted with the friendly bartender for a while. Most of the people there seemed to be traveling on business. The hotel is in a great location. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a pleasant stay in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: joshandheather
Reviews.Content: This recently renovated Sheraton was beautiful and very conveniently located. The rooms were great- only complaint is that the walls are thin (my neighbor was in the shower at 4:30 am so that is when I was forced to wake up.) Beds were comfy, love the down comforter. Staff was incredibly friends- greeting me with a smile on my way out to my meetings and on my way back. Again, only complaint is that I had pre-ordered room service for breakfast, woke up early and requested an hour earlier delivery and they forgot about me (had to call back 30 minutes later). Outdoor space is beautiful with fun fire pits where we had a welcome reception. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Starwood experience!”
Reviews.Author: MousseMakesGumbo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Dallas on a business trip this week. As a road warrior, I am loyal to Starwood hotels for my business and personal travel. The Sheraton Dallas ranks at the top of my list for Starwood properties. The staff throughout the hotel was friendly and accommodating. The hotel has been newly renovated. The guest rooms are very nicely appointed and very large. I found my room to be very quiet. The internet was fast - a surprise for a hotel of this size. The quality of food in the hotel restaurant, the Kitchen Table, was well prepared and "comforting." I had the gulf shrimp on johnny cakes and the planked salmon during my visit. What's very unique about the Sheraton Dallas is that the in-house coffee shop is Peet's Coffee & Tea, from the bay area. As a bay area resident and Peet's customer this made me feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great service.”
Reviews.Author: natkoehler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton on business and loved it. The hotel staff was very, very friendly and accomodating. They bent over backwards to ensure a smooth check in and even followed up my wake-up call with a personal call to make sure I was awake. I had an executive suite and the room was beautiful and clean. I oved the toiletries created by Bliss Spa. The entire stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fan -- not up to Starwood Standards.”
Reviews.Author: hrppa
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at the Sheraton Dallas for a meeting. My entire experience was subpar, beginning with a long line for check-in, followed by a very, very strange and robotic front desk clerk who immediately handed back my Starwood Gold card instead of looking at it weand then asked me if I was a Starwood Preferred Guest member. When I responded affirmatively, she just shook her head and said "No, no, no." Although she did locate my SPG number and apparently added it to my reservation, I did not receive an upgrade or even a room on the SPG floor of the hotel. My room was tiny, with a space for a fridge but no actual fridge, wet carpet, a rattling AC unit, and an odd, smoky smell. The capper was when I was already in bed, well after 11 pm, and two different housekeeping staff members pounded on my door, insisting that I had called to ask them to bring up a room service menu. I had not, obviously, although there was no hotel information in the room; the second staff member responded very rudely and sarcastically when I asked her not to return and that I was trying to sleep. Ironically, I was exhausted because I had been awakened by a 4:30 am false fire alarm at a different Sheraton in Arlington, VA that morning. The rooms where our meetings were held were adequate and the food was fairly good, but I would not recommend this hotel, especially for leisure travelers. I am glad that my company picked up the tab for the room, because I would be incredibly disappointed if I had paid for this room and the incredibly low level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience, unfriendly manager and staff”
Reviews.Author: pirate43
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for a conference and stayed at this hotel I have to say that It was an incredibly unpleasant experience that ended with me being unexpectedly charged a fine for smoking ($200). I had a very difficult time sleeping due to the constant noise from partying people in the hallway and was dismayed at the drunken behavior in the lobby, presumably the students coming in for the Oklahoma/Texas game. When I asked for a taxi, the bellhop said I should take a flatrate limo instead of the taxi, which caused the taxi driver to correctly accuse the bellhop of trying to cheat customers (the flat rate was twice that of the metered taxi). I expect more from high class hotels like the Sheraton. The main reason I am writing, however, is the unexpected charge. When I checked in, I gave the receptionist my credit card, and received a card key for the room. That is it. I was not informed that the hotel was nonsmoking, nor did I sign any no-smoking agreements, and there were not any no-smoking signs in the room. So, I was surprised when I was asked to stop smoking in the room-which, of course, I did, when asked to do so. No problem, I went outside to smoke my cigars. I was much more surprised to learn that a $200 fine/charge was levied on my folio. When I asked to speak with the manager about the charge, a surly, somewhat off-putting person repeatedly told me the charges would stand, regardless of my attempts to explain the misunderstanding. I sent a letter about this only to be told that the fine stands. I have stayed in many Sheratons and never have been treated so callously.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fitness Center- Rooms So-so-a bit smelly. Renovated, but not up to par.”
Reviews.Author: 2jokers
Reviews.Content: Great Fitness Room: 10-15 each elliptical and treadmills, 6 bikes(3 recumbent), free weights with benches, 20+ weight machines- all the standards. The rooms were renovated, but they have not kept up on maintaining the rooms. Our room had a bit of a stink(either left over smoke or other musty smell), splatters on walls, carpet had snags in it. Outside pool had bathing pigeons everyday. Amenities in room: Fridge, microwave, coffee maker, recycling bin in trash can, magnifying mirror at sink. Missing: Place to put folded clothing, space to walk by desk and chair when not stowed, booklet explaining services for the hotel( internet, fitness center hrs, pool hrs, restaurants), clean feeling in bathroom(tile that didn't ever seem clean, darkened spot on tile floor). Bit noisy in North tower from the street trolly and traffic Our reservation was booked as 2 stays in one room, an inconvenience to have keys rekeyed, also had to have them rekeyed for parking in the garage. $15/day for parking. Tagged along with my spouse for a conference, but didn't feel safe walking around downtown by myself as I have done in NYC. Only worth a stay if you are here for a conference in the hotel. Bit of a confusing layout with 3 towers and elevators only going to certain floors with conference rooms on 4 floors and across the street. Conference food was passable. Conference rooms could use some sprucing up. Internet was $10-25/day

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: LalaB3
Reviews.Content: it was awesome it was awesome it was awesome it was awesome it was awesome it was awesome it was awesome it was awesome it was awesome it it was awesomewas awesome

Reviews.Title: “Nice, rennovated hotel, poor service and excessive charges”
Reviews.Author: kittytraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice in the common areas, and the rooms were large, clean, newly remodeled, and beautiful. However, the fees in the hotel were excessive ($52 for a no-frills room service breakfast for two). We were vendors at a convention, and the add-on fees for receiving packages, electricity hookups, phones lines, etc. were excessive and not competitive with other hotels we have done business with. The hotel staff was cordial, but did not go out of their way to make us feel welcome and valued. Check-in was like a cattle call where the bellman abandoned our cart of luggage next to the registration area and walked off without a word. Hotel check-in clerk was all business, and did not seem warm, or happy to have us there. Hotel did not offer free internet in the $119/night rooms. The $30/day parking garage fee was excessive.. Sure the hotel is located downtown, but there is nothing to speak of within walking distance, other than the Americas building with some fast food outlets that all close around 6pm. Our hotel bill of $690+ for a 4-night hotel stay (and the 1 day of room service breakfast) was, in my opinion, too high for the service we received. I would never repeat an experience like this unless absolutely necessary for business. Had I been one of the convention attendees, I would have been even more disappointed in the hotel's value for price paid, and might have left the first night to go stay somewhere else. It is clear that the hotel uses the fact that there are no shopping or food stores nearby to its advantage, and overcharges its guests. If you have a car where you can go out and buy things, then you get to pay $30/day to park it. Shame on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Billed as a conference hotel, but not managed as one”
Reviews.Author: diversitylady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Dallas with my daughter for three nights at the end of July/beginning of August to attend a conference. The hotel is huge, ranging over a number of towers and streets, with an adjacent conference center. There were at least two large conferences taking place simultaneously when we were there. Our room on the 24th floor was fine, although small details were missing (the breakfast "hang on the door menu" was not replaced after the first day even though I called to mention this) and we had to call for the inroom hotel service guide. Surprisingly there is no in room dining menu. The major downside of such a large hotel is the inadequate range of eating options - and the very lousy service within them. All of the staff we encountered were polite and pleasant, but either overwhelmed with the number of people they had to serve or under trained or not properly supervised. The service in the Sports Bar was particularly slow and on two occasions we left after 20 minutes without even having been offered a menu. In the main restaurant/buffet, we were given contradictory information about when the buffet was actually open even though the food was out, it was apparently not available for service. On the first night, we left the breakfast order hanging on the door for delivery the next morning. When it did not arrive within the specified "window", I called and was told they had never received the order. To their credit, we did receive the same order on the house the next morning. Lastly and again surprisingly for such a large hotel, all of the food offerings were closed by 10pm. Having chosen to eat after the evening session one night, we could not even get food in the Sports Bar and ended up having to buy an over-priced muffin in the Gift Shop.

Reviews.Title: “Aggravating experience.”
Reviews.Author: Shiandra
Reviews.Content: This is my first (and hopefully, last) BAD experience with a Sheraton Hotel. My partner and I were here to attend a scheduled convention held at the Hotel. My partner checked in mid-afternoon and I arrived after 10:30 on 7/30. The room he had been given was in the south tower. The walls of the room were unfinished - almost as though it were still under renovation. There were more than 40 rivets and bolts all around the door itself - snagged my blouse opening the door. The toilet in the bathroom, aside from the extremely bad floor planning, was a PUBLIC toilet! The brand that you flush with your foot. The shower head was the old, circular type and even that had lime deposits and didn't release water through more than half of it. I went down to the concierge who was extremely polite and helpful. He directed me to the hotel manager who was also very helpful, polite and expressed understanding of the situation. He asked the lady at the registration desk to find another room for us. While she did find another room, she was taciturn almost to the point of rudeness at having to do so. And no, I wasn't rude - after all, I was being moved to better accommodations. They moved us to the North tower - this room was much better. The elevators - There were two elevators for the second tier of rooms of the North tower. One didn't work the entire weekend. The working elevator was faulty and didn't pick up on certain floors of that tier. At times, it did not recognize the down call button from the 17th floor and the only way to get the elevator to pick you up was to hit the up button and go up before coming down. I waited for 17 minutes, hearing the elevator come down past our floor twice before realizing I needed to go up before going down!! Parking - The room card is used to let you out of the parking structure. Our room key DIDN'T work a single time during our stay. We had to push the call button to get someone to let us out. They said they would fix it and it was never resolved. And TWO times, NO ONE responded to the call button. On both occasions, we had to ask other hotel guests to use their room key to let us out. Other hotel guests had the same issue. Check-out. We were overcharged by $125 for the three-day stay. Instead of being able to express-checkout, I had to go back to the registration desk to sort out the bill. After telling them they overcharged us, they said they took $100 off the bill (the difference in the room charge from $189 to $139). I had to insist the associated taxes to be adjusted as well or I would have been charged the taxes for the incorrect room charge. On a good note - housekeeping was good. And the pillows were excellent. The comforter was very good quality but was noticeably stained in several places. The concierge desk was wonderful. Everyone I spoke to was professional, friendly, helpful and an absolute credit to the hotel. Overall - this was the most aggravating and disappointing Sheraton experience I have ever had. I spent what should have been an enjoyable weekend convention, frustrated and constantly alert over the incompetency and inadequacy of the hotel accommodations. Trip Advisor has this hotel listed as a 4-star hotel. I've had better 2-star hotel experiences than I had at this Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CarefreeDVP
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas recently for vacaction and stayed two nights at the Sheraton. It's a very comfortable hotel that has nice modern style to it. The lounges are very lush and the sports bar at the hotel is extremely nice with pool tables and a karaoke room stuffed into the back. The menu is small but great. The buffet is a little pricy at 12.99 but unlimited. The room itself was quite comfortable and the bed was amazing. Had a flat screen tv and a big chair in a standard king room. They have rate sales and considering it was less than 200 for the two nights, it's a great value. Close to all that is in Dallas, including the JFK site and looking for nightlife, McKinney Ave. is a short cab ride away, as well as the West End. It's a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Working hard to compensate for ongoing renovations”
Reviews.Author: espritnumber5
Reviews.Content: Much of the hotel is undergoing renovations but the staff worked hard to make the service compensate. When we checked in our keycard didn't work in the room, so I went downstairs to get another and someone came up to ensure the new key would work... which it didn't. but they quickly let us into another room on the same floor so we didn't have to go back downstairs, went down and got the new key for us, and we didn't even have to change floors or towers. (Very thoughtful since I was waiting there with my 2-year old!). The rooms were very nice with a great view. Plenty of toiletries, replenished daily. Paid internet - the price varied according to your desired connection speed (never my favorite bit). The jacuzzi was closed while we were there, and the pool was quite cold but the loungers around the pool are fantastic! Due to the construction there is a detoured path to the pool area and the nearest restrooms could be closer (only the top floor restaurant was open when we were there). Most of the restaurants / cafes in the hotel are under renovation, but there is a skybrige connecting it to plaza of the americas with the ice rink and lots of fast food options. This skybridge is a great place to take a toddler with energy to burn, especially as there aren't any playgrounds in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--Staff not very helpful or friendly”
Reviews.Author: deezoomo
Reviews.Content: My sons and I stayed at the Sheraton this past weekend. We went to see the King Tut exhibit at the Dallas Museum of Art. The hotel was great. Very clean. Sitll some renovaton going on but it wasn't bad. Our room smelled new, had great amenities and a great view. Now for the not so good. We had booked a room that offered a package deal for the museum exhibit. The room came with 2 VIP tickets and I was told on the phone by their agent that I could purchase and additional ticket from the hotel if needed. When we arrived and I asked about buying the third ticket I was told that the hotel did not have any way to get us a third ticket and we should just contact Ticket Master. I booked this trip in the fall of 2008, I would have had plenty of time to get another ticket had I been told that I needed to go through Ticket Master. No apologies were offered no assistance offered just a very rude " As I have already told you, you need to go to Ticket Mater" The best they could do was refer me to Guest Services. The lady at Guest Services tried to call the Museum for us but could not get through. We were able to resovle the issue at the Museum with their ticket office--where they were VERY helpful. But it was obvious that no one at the hotel had ever spoken to the Museum about remedies for such a situation even though the lady in Guest Services told me that she had run into the same problem numerous times. Upon check out there was a couple trying to check in that was having a problem with their room rate. The hotel would not honor the roomrate they were quoted. BRING YOUR PRINTED CONFIRMATION with you!

Reviews.Title: “just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: wheelersmom
Reviews.Content: We went to Dallas to see Ron White at the Majestic. We picked the Sheraton because it was very close (walking distance). This was a BEAUTIFUL hotel! Everyone was so nice. I mentioned it was my husbands birthday and they upgraded us to a suite. They gave us free wine, horsd's and breakfast. It could not have been a better place. Would love to go again and again. I would recomend this hotel to anyone. The rate was even wonderful. This a gotta see and stay. Thanks Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “An unremarkable hotel with the service to match.”
Reviews.Author: wtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Dallas for 3 nights in March 2009 when in town for a convention. I paid $159/night for a king room in the South Tower (1 of 3 towers in the complex) on the 23rd floor. The hotel is undergoing renovations, and I am only focusing on elements that would hold true outside of the renovations. But my recommendation is to stay at the Westin across the street or one of the other hotels in the area. The Sheraton has a reputation for lousy service, and it is well deserved. The staff lack the sophistication and intelligence of most 4-star hotel staff, including executives. this Sheraton is the Wal-Mart version of a conference hotel: more than 1,500 rooms, dining, and conference facilities to put the show on, feed, house, and bathe convention goers. Do not expect more. The room itself was fine, though the sheets were like newspaper, and there was good water pressure and toiletries. Room service was a bright spot - prompt, well-prepared, courteous. Central Dallas has all the life of a parking lot; stay elsewhere in the city for leisure. At the end of the day, I made all my meetings and appointments, but the hotel contributed little to the productivity of my stay. An excellent 2-star hotel, but not for 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “All-Around Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: SmallNomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Sheraton while visiting Dallas for the King Tut Exhibition. Despite some of the other reviews, we had a fine experience at this hotel. We were given one of the remodeled rooms (straight out of the hotel photos) on the 26th floor of the Central Tower. This is a huge hotel, but seeing as we've stayed in other large hotels (the Omni Shoreham in D.C. for instance), this wasn't a problem for us. There were three of us in our party; two adults and one teenager. Our room was newly-remodeled, comfortable and clean, although the toilet did flush oddly on occasion. We had state-of-the-art temperature controls in our room, and our section of the hotel was very quiet (a little highway noise from passing sirens, but nothing more bothersome than that). We were across the hall from a Presidential suite which may explain why we had very few travelers sharing our floor. It has been noted in other reviews that some hallways, etc. had odors, and our hallway did have a somewhat musty odor, but nothing that was really noticeable, and the smell did not carry into our room. The hotel staff that we encountered was incredibly friendly and helpful. From check-in until check-out, we found this hotel staff to be some of the "nicest folks" we have encountered, and we have stayed at hotels around the world. (If you want really rude hotel staff, try a Galway Bay hotel in Galway, Ireland, during Race Week!) We ate a few meals in the hotel restaurant (Pearl Street Cafe) in between our jaunts to museums, and ordered room service one night. The waiters and waitresses at the Pearl Street Cafe were attentive and friendly. We were even given free desserts during our first meal there. While small mishaps occurred with our restaurant meals (bacon left off of a bacon cheeseburger, for example) the food was good, fast, and really appealed to our teenage son. Room service was incredibly fast and thorough, with the person taking the order going over each choice and each entree methodically. No mistakes of any kind were made with the room service. Also, the weekend breakfast buffet was actually good (we're not usually fans of breakfast buffets). The hotel has an internet area off the main lobby that has numerous stations, and while internet access in the room comes with a fee, the service off the lobby is free for hotel guests. We used both services, painlessly and easily. This hotel is walking distance to most museums and the historic West End District, which has some fun places (like Gators) for casual food. We did not rent a car for this trip, and for what we were doing, did not need one. A DART station is right outside the hotel, so trips outside of downtown can be easily made using this form of mass transit. The Plaza of Americas was the only disappointment to us; we thought it was a bona-fide mall, but it really is only a hotel, with an ice-skating rink and an extensive food court attached. Our trip to this attraction took only ten minutes, but luckily, the museums in the area made up for the Plaza. The hotel is less than 30 minutes from Love Field, with a taxi ride costing about $30 (not including tip). The hotel also has an indoor pool and fitness center, but we had no time to try either on this trip. Overall, for the price, this hotel proved to be a good choice for us and made for a very pleasant stay. If we were to need a hotel in the Dallas downtown area again, we would choose this Sheraton again over some unknown experience somewhere else. We booked this hotel through American Express, not a discounter like Priceline, so the hotel room was pre-paid when we arrived, and we had no problems with our check-in; we got the exact room we asked for, and then check-out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Way better then what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: grfan20
Reviews.Content: I decided to go to Dallas on a whim for the weekend just to see the city. I used priceline to get a hotel downtown and got placed at the Sheraton for a really good rate. After reading the other reviews I was a little concerned about the hotel. Maybe it was because there didn't seem to be a convention going on the weekend of my stay, but my experience at the Sheraton Dallas could not have been more pleasant. I pulled up to the front but wanted to self park so the valet politely gave me directions to the parking garage. I then went to check in. No lines, and the man behind the counter had my reservation right away and handed me my keys within 30 seconds. He told me where to go to get on the elevator and asked if I needed help with my bags. I got to my room and it was one of the newly renovated rooms. The room was not huge but perfect for my needs. It was amazingly clean, smelled great and had a large bathroom. They put me on the 30th floor so I had an amazing view of the city. To address some of the other complaints people on here had; I never once had to wait more then 30 seconds for an elevator; the rooms were well appointed and clean; I never heard one peep from any of my neighbors, and I found the neighborhood around the hotel to be plenty safe (walked around the city all weekend including past 1 AM and never felt threatened). The hotel may not be located in the most exciting part of Dallas, but most of downtown is dead anyway...so that makes little difference. I only have to complaints. The outdoor pool was closed, the indoor hot tub was also closed, and the indoor pool seemed to be open but was yellow in color and emitted an unpleasant odor. Also, one of the nights I wanted some late night food. I asked the concierge on duty if he knew of any places around that may still be open (it was 1AM). He sneered at me like I was dumb for asking and said that there was a Denny's 2 miles away and that was all (I wanted something within walking distance). I ended up walking around and found my way over to Main St. where I found a number of open restaurants serving the after bar crowds. You would think in a hotel this size, the concierge would be more knowledgeable of the local area. Overall I had a great experience, but like I said, there were no conventions going on during my stay. I could see there being some issues if the hotel was really busy. Needless to say,I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking at staying downtown and wants a good deal on a nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for business, boring hotel otherwise”
Reviews.Author: sarapac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a convention my husband was attending for a week. If you are looking to relax and just visit Dallas, I don't suggest staying here. It was crazy busy the entire week with at least 3 different events going on at once. Not much fun if you are in town on leisure, like I was. The staff were nice and very organized. Our standard room was clean, but quite run down. There was a creepy hole right above the shower and the toilet did not flush properly. It had a 20 inch TV with basic local channels, tons of news channels and no movie channels. There was a fee to connect to the internet in the room. There was also a business center with free internet, even with the help of the staff we were unable to even print boarding passes there. The restaurant and room service were ridiculously overpriced. There is a coffee shop, but it was hardly ever open. Luckily they supply Starbucks coffee in the room. During the week there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance for lunch, but at night it was pretty dead near the hotel. Most nights we walked to the West Historic District or took the free M-line Trolly down McKinley to find restaurants open. The Plaza of the Americas that is connected to the hotel, was very disappointing for shopping. It did have a food court for with a variety of fast food. The location of the hotel isn't bad, if you don't mind walking about a mile to all the touristy points of interest. We really enjoyed the art museum, just a few blocks away. Some other neat places to see were Thanksgiving Square, Dealy Plaza (where JFK was shot) and Pioneer Plaza (really neat bronze longhorn statues) All were within walking distance. We also spent a night in Deep Ellum bar hopping. Lots of fun, if you like to party. If you get a chance, see a show at the Sons of Hermann Hall. We had a blast here with the locals. We walked there, but I don't advise it at night. You have to walk underneath very dark overpasses to get there from downtown. Overall we had a great time in Dallas, just not while we were at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: dsdr54217
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over the last three nights during a conference. The staff was, in general, very professional, helpful, and friendly. However, I called Guest Services on my first day in the hotel and asked that the stained shower curtain in the bathroom be replaced (it had what appeared to be a small bloodstain). The staff member apologized and when I returned to my room later that evening, I could tell by the lights that someone had entered my room but the shower curtain had not been replaced and was not replaced for the duration of my visit. At another point I called Guest Services to retrieve a message (as directed by the automated system) and the phone rang 15 times before I gave up and just went to the front desk. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. The restaurant food was typical of hotel restaurants, although I was not happy when I entered the restaurant as a solo diner and was first offered the absolute worst table in the restaurant and the restaurant was not crowded. Upon asking the hostess for a different table, I was accommodated without complaint. The valet and bell staff were great, although when I asked if there was a Starbucks nearby I was told "the hotel brews Starbucks coffee." Not exactly the answer I was looking for. The gift shop is not part of the hotel apparently, so if you want to make a purchase there and charge it to your room, be prepared to stand and wait for the cashier to first call the front desk (and sometimes not get an answer right away). It's best to just pay in cash. Internet service is good, albeit a bit pricey (but in line with what many major hotel chains charge) at $14.95 per 24 hours. The hotel does have a very nice internet lounge area with quite a few computers and the internet service from those computers is free. The screens are large and there's absolutely no privacy so it's not advisable to view anything personal or secure. My room was in the South tower. There is a good deal of hallway noise that can be heard in the rooms, the doors close very hard and every time someone closed their door it could be heard very clearly and loudly. Overall I would consider staying there again but not as my first choice unless I got a great price.

Reviews.Title: “we arrived during the re-model”
Reviews.Author: srtxtraveler
Reviews.Content: Over-all the hotel is "tired" I was glad to see they are remodeling. Rooms are clean, but certainly looked old. One of the tables in my room had the entire front off. The water (shower) would barely come out of the faucet. All of the staff were very nice and constantly reminded us of the remodel. We had drinks in the bar, the waiter seems overworked. All food items in the hotel were expensive. (typical) Good: the view from the 18th floor was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we thought...”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaBRIDE08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Dallas for just a couple of nights for a concert at the House of Blues. We got a reasonable rate on priceline, but after reading all of the horrible reviews, we were terrified of what we would find. First of all, this hotel is ridiculously huge, and the set-up is kind of confusing. There were people all over, attending conferences. At check-in, the nice man working the front desk upgraded us to what we think was a King suite. I think it was one of the newly remodeled rooms that was made from 2 rooms into 1 bigger one. The room itself was nice (pictures posted). However, there was a TERRIBLE smell when you go off the elevator in the hallway. Thankfully, our room still was okay. The location of this hotel is okay as it is very close to the light rail/trains, but within walking distance, there isn't really anything going on as far as bars/restaurants. It was very quiet and it almost seemed like the city was empty. We ended up going to the West Village during one day for a little shopping and lunch, and then Victory Park for the HOB concert. Both were a little more lively.

Reviews.Title: “Bad, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: hmarina
Reviews.Content: I'm here, and will be here until friday, at a convention. The room is ok, but very cold. The heater does not work. When I arrived, my TV did not work. I called to ask for service. They said it was on its way, never got to my room. I just called for room service, to have dinner in my room.. what will be the waiting time you expect from any hotel? even from a bad hotel? Well, this is worst: 2 hours!!! Of course, I cancelled the order. Good luck if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unforgettable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this week as part of a convention...And have stayed here every January for the last 3-4 years...I liked it better as the Adam's Mark...But under either name, this is an unspectacular hotel with absolutely nothing that stands out. The rooms haven't changed since the Adam's Mark...However, in previous years, I had MUCH larger rooms. I was not in the Adam's Mark loyalty program, and am just a 'standard' Starwood member, but I received better rooms when it was an Adam's Mark--Every year. I don't know if I was lucky in the past or just really unlucky this time...I saw three rooms this time (which I'll explain below) and all were very small, even for downtown hotel standards...I've had bigger rooms in Hong Kong and New York City, which are notorious for their small rooms. When I checked in, I had 2 rooms reserved...One for me and one for one of my employees. They did get us rooms on the same floor...When I opened my door, the room was not cleaned yet! Back downstairs to the check-in desk, where I stood for 20-25 minutes waiting to get helped again. I was pretty upset by the wait, given that I was already 5 hours late getting to the hotel, and had lots of work to do that night yet... Finally when I got helped, the staff was apologetic--I don't blame them, as they just go by what their computers tell them is clean and available. I was calm and polite and asked "Since I've gone through all of this, can I get an upgraded room?" The man said "Of course". Although my new room was on a higher floor (separating me from my co-worker), it was no better, no bigger and no nicer than the room that was dirty. Some upgrade! The bathroom was tiny--You couldn't fit two people in there standing up--it's probably 4 feet by 6 feet, including the tub! The toilet, which reminded me of a bus station the way it had the 'pull lever' is about 5 inches from the sink which butts right up to the shower. Tight quarters! The restaurant was much better under Adam's Mark...They had many Mexican offerings and a nice variety...Now it reminds me of a small-town Holiday Inn...Limited menu, very little creativity, and high 'downtown hotel' food prices. The English spoken by the staff was horrible...I could barely communicate with my waiter one night, and not to mention the assistant staff. I have easier communication in Asia! On my way to a meeting, I was going to stop to the gift shop (on the second floor) and grab a juice and a muffin for breakfast. Despite the permanent sign saying something like "Open 7AM to 8PM" (or whatever it was), the doors were closed and there was a sign on the door saying they'd be back in a half hour (this was at 9AM). Very annoying and not what I'd expect from a full-service hotel...So, I missed breakfast that day. The place isn't bad...It's just not great by an stretch of the imagination. Had it not been for the convention being right there, I'd surely have sought accommodations at the nearby Fairmont or Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: ShambhalaKeith
Reviews.Content: We booked online to stay the night after a 3000 person dinner. When we arrived at the hotel shortly after 3:00 PM, they had closed valet parking for guest and the parking garage was full. Upon check in, the King room we reserved was not available. We also heard other guest complaining that suites they had reserved had been given away. We took another room with two queen beds and we were given two vouchers for the buffet breakfast. Ok, that was acceptible. I did appreciate it. However, the person at the desk did not ask for any ID, so in reality they could have given our room to anyone. Once in the room, we found remnants of previous guests that had not been cleaned out. Nothing big, just tags in the top of the closet. But it does make you wonder how well it was cleaned. We had a small snack in the restaurant to tied us over until the dinner that night, signed the bill back to our room, only to be chased down in the lobby. At the desk, they didn't ask if we wanted to put down a cc for further purchases so the restaurant could not charge to the room. Again, nothing big, just embarrasing. The next morning, the staff at the restaurant was incredibly rude. The coffee cup I was offered was dirty, and the waiter slammed it into the saucer as he took it away. When we asked to break a $20 in order to tip, he was rude again. We are putting together a convention in Dallas for another proffesional organization we belong to. Even though the bid they gave us was good, I can assure you it will not be with the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift, but otherwise it's fine”
Reviews.Author: aqp
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton in downtown Dallas is showing it's age. The front desk staff told me they were starting a multi-million-dollar remodel and all rooms would be non-smoking once it was complete. In the meantime, the hotel is really showing its age. Carpet, wallpaper, hallways and elevators all look very worn, but the rooms have good linens, nice towels, and our room was very clean. The Sheraton does not have the Starwood Heavenly beds - our mattress was okay, but not great. I liked the pillows better than most hotel's. The bathroom amenities from Bliss are nice. The lobby looks like it has been updated recently. It sports a very cool steel cowboy / bucking bronco statue. There are some restaurants within walking distance ( I recommend Campisi's). The hotel has adequate parking ($14/ night self park). I will definitely stay there again after the renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “Not exciting, but at least clean!”
Reviews.Author: Nicococure
Reviews.Content: This downtown Dallas hotel is formerly the Adam's Mark . My overnight stay was for a training conference/retreat held at the hotel. The property is nothing flashy or exciting, just adequate accomodations which are well-suited to business people and conference-goers. The room and bedding were clean. The bathroom tile looked dated, but clean also. Conference rooms were good for our training group, and the food and beverage served were fine. I guess there's nothing that says a hotel has to be "modern and contemporary" to be acceptable. However, any renovations to update this property will surely be in it's favor.

Reviews.Title: “I'll keep this brief....”
Reviews.Author: Paco1paco
Reviews.Content: As my title suggests, I will keep my review very brief as there are plenty of reviews already stating the rundown nature of this hotel. It's old and definitely dated, although spacious and convenient. I cannot overemphasize the need to avoid eating ANY food at this hotel. From the eggs-only breakfast to the tasteless dinners, the menu is uninspired and bland. I highly recommend Pappasitos even thought it is a bit of a drive from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking”
Reviews.Author: carrache
Reviews.Content: It's hard to imagine who this hotel is aimed at. The only folks I can imagine who would end up here are people who would choose it based on its name. It's not worth it. This isn't a bad place, it just seems like there has to be better value for the money. The room I had was clean, large and had a high enough view. I felt comfortable and my room was quiet enough. The core problem is that I didn't feel like the quality/price ratio was right. Aside from everything from the internet connection to the bar and restaurant being wildly, wildly overpriced, the cost of the room itself suggested a five star stay, but the room was really only about three. The location is nothing special either. Despite being downtown, there is precious little within walking distance. I'll be looking for a better value the next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “okay for Hotwire price”
Reviews.Author: bhawbill
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel and have no serious problems with it.Its geared toward convention business so it is very busy during the week and empty on weekends.Only 2 minor complaints,they charge for internet access in business center[most places I've stayed offer it for free]and their sports bar,Players has only 2 tvs.If you are sitting in the wrong place you can't see either of them.I did find there guest services desk to be helpful and friendly anytime I had a question.

Reviews.Title: “Again, seems to be hit or miss. Depends on your expectations.”
Reviews.Author: leadpntchp
Reviews.Content: Think the trick is to sign up as a Starwood Preferred Member - or at least say you are. Stayed at one a few years back, but couldn't find my membershirp card, so signed up again. When I checked in, they couldn't locate me, but signed me in as a preferred member anyway. The Good: I was in the South Tower (27th floor), which, according to other reviews, was most recently updated. I felt the room was huge - Preferred Member?. The bathroom seemed large enough and I had no problems with hot water. The room was clean and well stocked. The bed was very comfortable and had about a dozen pillows. The hotel is connected to Bryant? Tower and Plaza of the Americas. As I was there for business, this was an excellent conveience. Dallas offers excellent public transportation. Access to the Train to the West End, where there is a variety of restaurants/bars is within a block. There is an old time trolly - you have to walk about 7 blocks to get it, but it's free and well worth it - takes you to another part of downtown Dallas with other restaurants/bars. Please tip the conducter. The Bad: Although the TV was a huge LCD, the cable line up was limited. About 20 "channels" 10 in analog, then the same 10 in digitial. There were no heavy drapes to block out the morning sunlight if you wanted to sleep in. There was Wi-Fi connectivity, but you had to pay for it, as well as local calls. As a Preferred Member, I was given access to the continental breakfast for free. In the rinky-dink little town where I live, the cheapest of hotels offer these services for free. For the price of the room, these should be free. You could hear doors "slamming" all night. My first thought was why are people slamming their doors? But, that was just the nature of the heavy doors. The Ugly: The hotel lists several different "restaurants." However, the list hasn't been updated as most of them are now closed. Of the remaining, most close around 7 pm - as do most of the restaurants in the Plaza Food Court. The "Sports Bar" has four average sized TV's in a grid against a wall. This was closed by 10 PM. A sports bar that closes at 10PM? (Actually, it seem to be the norm in Dallas, places closing early.) The sole restaurant that has extended hours has a VERY limited menu and is quite overpriced. I didn't make it to the pool area or hot tub, as business needs superceded. I had no problems checking in or out. I called for a wake up call, came about 5 minutes later than the time I requested, but the clock could have been off. Asked which cab service was best and found out there was a shuttle every 30 mins to the airport - I don't recall this being mentioned in the services of the hotel. Summary: Not a bad experience - of course, I didn't have to pay for it. For an upscale holel, you pay far more than for what you recieve. Instead of a Hotel, it seems to be more geared as a Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “hot water is an issue”
Reviews.Author: CJSLubbock
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite in the South Tower (which is supposed to be the refurbished rooms - 3 years old). The suite was beautiful. It was very comfortable and had great amenties. Free bottled water, a loofah, and even a bathroom scale! However, when I went to take a shower, the water wasn't hot. It wasn't even very warm. I called guest services and they said it was normal, especially because I was on the 20th floor. (The higher up you are, the more likely you won't have hot water.) They offered that I could change my room, but I was in a beautiful suite and didn't want to move rooms. Then she told me to just let the water run until it turned hot. I let it run a full 15 - 20 minutes, which is expensive and wasteful. After 15 - 20 minutes, it was a good temperature. But it is pointless to stay in a suite and not have hot water! I didn't like the food in the restaurant either. Not only was it extremely overpriced ($6 for a cup of soup), but the food wasn't anything special. When it was the Adam's Mark (before April 2008), they had an awesome restaurant on the top floor. Now, that's gone and the only restaurant is the mediocre one in the lobby. On a positive note - the staff is wonderful! I would recommend this hotel if you can get a good price, or if you need the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Could use a little attention, from everyone”
Reviews.Author: kentdshaw
Reviews.Content: I definitely would have been more critical of the room if I hadn't gotten a deal for it on priceline. Overall, the hotel just needs someone to stay at it. Judging from the size of the convention area, and from some of the other reviews on this site, it must be very crowded during the week. My girlfriend & I were staying there on a weekend. And the place was a ghost town. I never saw anyone down in the hotel restaurant, either morning or evening. In fact, I could count on two hands the number of people I saw in the lobby, period. With the mammoth dimensions of the lobby, it just felt incredibly empty. The hotel might have felt a little different if there had been more people there. But with that emptiness, many of the rough edges appeared even more rough. Though one rough edge they can't really cover is the pool area. This thing hasn't been updated in at least 20 years. It's a guess. But considering that the linoleum at the bottom of the pool is starting to peal, and the stainless steel hot tub has graffiti, I can't help but think there are some major updates which should be scheduled for the very near future. The room itself, though a little cramped (as another review pointed out) wasn't so bad. There is an updated, flat screen television. There are matching granite table tops. There are comfortable seats beside the window. There are lush, thick, thick towels. And there's an incredible bed. We had a king sized bed in our room, and both of us slept like we were dead. Waking up was very difficult. Again, some rough edges (like an antiquated air conditioning system and paneling that was coming off), but most of the room felt very cozy. And, most importantly, the furniture that was in the room was very comfortable. Like I said, if I had paid full price for this room, I might have a different story. As far as my experience, I got much more than I paid for (thanks priceline). I might not recommend the hotel, but if I knew someone was going to stay there, I wouldn't warn them against anything.

Reviews.Title: “Long way to go”
Reviews.Author: txrus
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed here before, I can't comment on any changes since the hotel became a Sheraton property. The fact that the water in one of the 3 flower vases on the registration desk was in desperate need of changing shouldn't depend on ownership, however. During check-in, one staff person (thankfully not the one who was checking me in!) was both eating & talking w/her mouth full to another guest-ugh! Rooms, at least on the 7th floor of the South Tower, are incredibly small as are the bathrooms. The room is so small the side table for the arm chair is actually behind the chair!! No fitted bottom sheet on the bed, no pillow top or even mattress pad, either. First room I was assigned had a malfunctioning A/C unit; hotel sent 3 staff to work on it &, after I requested it, changed to me another room. I didn't have time for them to spend hours tearing the room apart, though I appreciated the effort. 1 of the sliding doors to the closet of the new room was off the track & literally leaning against the wall (eventually that was, somewhat, rectified). No luggage stand-multiple requests for one, plus additional hangers, & foam pillows until nearly 4 hrs later. The single long blonde hair hanging off the shade of the desk lamp was a nice touch that was still there when I left nearly a week later. As I said previously, the bathroom is very small &, I think, laid out very awkwardly. They clearly spent a small fortune on covering every surface in the room & bathroom w/granite, including bedside table, corner shelf for the tv (large flat panel) as well as the bathroom floor), but couldn't spare a few dollars for a curved shower curtain in the bathroom to give guests a tiny bit more elbow room. The 'don't steal me' hair dryer is actually behind the toilet which makes it difficult to use given the short cord on it. At least they refrained from 'don't' steal me hangers' in the closet. Carpet in the room is in desperate need of cleaning (even before my can of Pepsi exploded all over the closet door, walls, & ceiling). A red 'status' light behind the tv started blinking in both my room & my colleague's room next door Monday night & since the tv's sit on a shelf in the corner, we ended up w/a flashing red light clear up to the ceiling. By that point, we were both so fed up w/the hotel, we simply threw towels over the flashing light for the duration of our stay. The public areas of the hotel are, overall, quite run down, dingy, & in desperate need of, if not a complete make-over, at least a deep & thorough cleaning. My traveling companions, who have (unfortunately for them!) stayed @ this hotel before, said the service in the Pearl Cafe has improved quite a bit since the change-over, however, the food itself hasn't. We only ate breakfast there, so I can't comment on the rest of their menu. The Westin City Center is connected to the Sheraton by a enclosed skywalk which has a number of food court style restaurants as well as the Westin's restaurant where we ate 3 nights (the crab encrusted tilapia is wonderful!). All in all, this hotel has a long way to go to become a real Sheraton.

HotelInfo.Name: Sheraton Dallas Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 400 North Olive Street, Dallas, TX 75201
